It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 20, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme: FAQs for settling tax disputes easily Taxpayers can resolve pending income tax disputes under the Direct Tax Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024 by settling the disputed tax amount and avoiding additional interest and penalties.
Content:
In a bid to bring relief to taxpayers, the Direct Tax Vivad Se Vishwas (DTVSV) Scheme 2024, introduced in Budget 2024, offers a simplified route to resolve income tax disputes. With this scheme, taxpayers can clear pending tax liabilities by paying the disputed amount along with a specified additional percentage, while enjoying the waiver of interest and penalties. Designed to reduce litigation and streamline tax resolution, the Income Tax Department has issued new FAQs to clarify eligibility and procedures. Let’s have a closer look at some of these FAQs. Can a taxpayer file a declaration under the DTVSV (Direct Tax Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme), 2024 if their appeal was disposed of on merits or dismissed as withdrawn before filing the declaration, for the purposes of the scheme?
Yes, such cases are eligible for settlement under the scheme, as the appeal was pending on 22nd July 2024. The disputed tax will be calculated as if the appeal had not yet been disposed of on that date. Is a case eligible for settlement if a taxpayer has filed a declaration in Form-I, and the appeal is disposed of by the concerned authority after the declaration?
Yes, this case is also eligible for settlement. If the time limit for filing an appeal expired before July 22, 2024, but an appeal with an application for condonation of delay was filed after this date, can the taxpayer opt for the scheme in this case?
No, the appeal must be pending as of July 22, 2024, for a taxpayer to be eligible for the scheme. Therefore, such cases will not be eligible. If an appeal and an application for condonation of delay were both filed before July 22, 2024, and the appeal was admitted after the condonation of delay before filing the declaration under the scheme, can the taxpayer opt for the scheme?
Yes, the taxpayer can opt for settlement under the scheme in such cases. Is an appeal filed against intimation under section 143(1) of the Act and pending as of July 22, 2024, eligible for the DTVSV Scheme 2024?
Yes, any appeal filed against intimation under section 143(1) of the Act and pending as of July 22, 2024, is eligible for settlement under the scheme. Are cases with pending review petitions before the High Courts or Supreme Court eligible for settlement under the DTVSV Scheme 2024?
No, the pendency of a review petition does not equate to the pendency of an appeal before the High Courts, and therefore, it does not count as an appeal pending for the purposes of the scheme. Can the DTVSV Scheme 2024 be availed in cases where proceedings are pending before the Income Tax Settlement Commission (ITSC) or where a writ has been filed against an order of the ITSC?
No, the scheme cannot be availed in these cases. The Direct Tax Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024 offers a unique opportunity for taxpayers to settle their pending income tax disputes in a streamlined manner, helping to reduce litigation and providing financial relief. By addressing key questions about eligibility, the Income Tax Department has provided much-needed clarity. However, taxpayers should carefully assess their individual circumstances and stay informed about the specific requirements to make the most of this valuable scheme. With the right guidance, this initiative could pave the way for quicker, stress-free resolutions of tax disputes.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 20, 2024

Headline: 55th GST Council Meeting begins: What could become costlier or cheaper todayGST Council Meeting: From essential services to luxury items, a wide range of proposals are under discussion, some of which could significantly impact consumers and businesses.
Content: The 55th GST Council meeting, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, has brought together ministers from 28 states, two Union Territories, and key stakeholders to deliberate on sweeping tax reforms. A wide range of proposals, from essential services to luxury items, are under discussion, some of which could significantly impact consumers and businesses.LUXURY ITEMS UNDER SPOTLIGHT Luxury items are under the spotlight, with a proposal to increase GST on high-end products. Wristwatches priced above Rs 25,000 and shoes costing over Rs 15,000 per pair may soon attract a 28% GST, up from the current 18%. Additionally, changes in the tax structure for readymade garments have been proposed. Garments priced below â‚¹1,500 are expected to remain at 5%, while those priced between Rs 1,500 and Rs 10,000 may see a jump to 18%. Premium garments above Rs 10,000 could face a steep 28% tax. These changes aim to rationalise rates and align taxation with the pricing structure of luxury goods.FOOD DELIVERY PLATFORMS In a move to ease costs for food delivery services like Swiggy and Zomato, the GST rate may be reduced from 18% with input tax credit (ITC) to a simpler 5% without ITC. This could lower delivery charges, benefiting end consumers. The measure also seeks to address the disparity in tax burdens between dining in and ordering food.GST ON INSURANCE PLATFORMS The meeting has taken up proposals to reform GST on insurance premiums, especially to benefit senior citizens and essential health cover. The Group of Ministers (GoM) has recommended exempting health insurance plans with â‚¹5 lakh coverage, term life insurance, and certain senior citizen-focused policies from GST. Currently, health and life insurance premiums attract an 18% GST rate, while endowment and annuity plans face differential rates. The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) has underscored the need for exemptions, citing international practices where insurance products are largely tax-free. The proposed reforms could make health and term insurance more accessible, particularly for marginalized groups.AVIATION TURBINE FUEL UNDER GST The council is also considering bringing Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF) under the GST regime. This longstanding demand from the aviation industry would allow airlines to claim input tax credit, potentially reducing operational costs. However, this proposal may face resistance from states due to revenue concerns. Meanwhile, a broad set of 148 items, including compact vehicles and pre-owned electric vehicles, may see tax increases. These items are proposed to move from the 12% to the 18% GST bracket, aligning with ongoing efforts to rationalise rates.OTHER POSSIBLE DELIBERATIONS The four-tier GST structure will remain unchanged, but discussions on introducing a 35% rate for sin goods, alongside extensions to the GST compensation cess regime, signal the council’s intent to fine-tune the tax system. While the council's decisions are expected to balance revenue generation with consumer relief, consensus remains critical to implementing these sweeping changes. The meeting's outcomes could reshape taxation across sectors, influencing consumer choices and industry practices in the coming months.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 21, 2024Must Watch

Headline: GST Council Meeting: Will tax rates on health and life insurance premiums drop today? GST Council Meeting begins: One of the key items on the agenda is the proposal to reduce the Goods and Services Tax (GST) on insurance premiums, a move that could bring relief to policyholders.
Content: The 55th GST Council meeting is expected to make significant decisions on tax rates for life and health insurance premiums. One of the key items on the agenda is the proposal to reduce the Goods and Services Tax (GST) on insurance premiums, a move that could bring relief to policyholders. A Group of Ministers (GoM) set up by the Council, led by Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Chaudhary, has already made progress on this matter. In its meeting last month, the GoM recommended exempting term life insurance premiums from GST, a proposal that has garnered support from several states. Additionally, the GoM has suggested that premiums paid by senior citizens for health insurance should be exempt from the tax, which could benefit a significant portion of the population. There is also a proposal to exempt GST on health insurance premiums of up to Rs 5 lakh, paid by individuals who are not senior citizens. This move, if approved, would make health insurance more affordable for a broader section of the population, especially as medical costs continue to rise.WHAT ELSE IS ON THE AGENDA?  While these changes seem to have strong backing, the Council may defer decisions on other major tax reforms, such as a higher tax on so-called sin goods like tobacco and alcohol. States are still divided on the proposal to increase taxes on these products, and a final decision may take more time. The upcoming decision on insurance premiums is significant not only for policyholders but also for the broader insurance sector. A lower tax burden could encourage more people to opt for insurance, increasing the penetration of life and health coverage in India. As the GST Council continues to evaluate various options, the focus on insurance premiums reflects the government’s ongoing efforts to make essential services more affordable, especially for vulnerable groups like senior citizens. With most states in favor of tax reductions, a positive outcome for policyholders seems likely.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 21, 2024Must Watch

Headline: GST Council delays decision on lowering tax for health, life insurance premiumsGST Council Meeting: During the 55th meeting held on Saturday, technical considerations led to the deferral, with the Group of Ministers (GoM) tasked to conduct further deliberations.
Content: The GST Council has postponed its decision on reducing tax rates for life and health insurance premiums, officials told news agency PTI. During the 55th meeting held on Saturday, technical considerations led to the deferral, with the Group of Ministers (GoM) tasked to conduct further deliberations. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman chaired the meeting, which concluded that additional discussions were needed before finalising any changes. Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Chaudhary, who leads the GoM on insurance, stated that more time is required to resolve outstanding issues, particularly regarding the taxation of group policies, individual policies, and senior citizens' plans. A subsequent GoM meeting is scheduled for January to finalise these discussions. In November, the GoM recommended certain reforms, including exempting premiums paid for term life insurance policies from GST. Similarly, health insurance premiums paid by senior citizens were proposed for exemption, alongside those up to Rs 5 lakh for non-senior citizens. However, premiums exceeding Rs 5 lakh will continue to be taxed at 18%. The delay reflects the need for further technical assessment, as there are varying opinions among states about these proposed changes. With most states supporting the notion of reducing the tax burden, a positive resolution remains a likely outcome, albeit requiring additional time for consensus.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 21, 2024Must Watch

Headline: GST at 18% on used EV car sale by business, jet fuel stays out of its ambitThe GST Council in its 55th meeting also decided to clarify on taxability of popcorn, saying caramelised popcorn will continue to attract tax at the rate of 18 per cent.
Content: The goods and services tax council on Saturday decided to levy an 18 per cent GST on margin value on a sale of used electric vehicles by businesses and agreed to keep jet fuel (ATF) out of the 'one-nation-one-tax' regime. The GST Council in its 55th meeting also decided to clarify on taxability of popcorn, saying caramelised popcorn will continue to attract tax at the rate of 18 per cent. However, pre-packed and spiced popcorn will attract 12 per cent, while 5 per cent will be levied on unpacked and unlabelled ones. It has been decided to regularise the issues for the past on "as is where is" basis... "It is a clarification being recommended by the GST Council to settle the disputes arising out of interpretation," an official statement said. The panel, headed by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and comprising representatives of all states and UTs, deferred decisions on reducing tax rate on insurance products as also on levy of the tax on food delivery by app-based platforms. The panel cut the tax rate on fortified rice kernels used for public distribution to 5 per cent from 18 per cent, Sitharaman told reporters after the meeting of the Council here. The Council also decided that no GST will be payable on penal charges levied and collected by banks and NBFCs from borrowers for non-compliance with loan terms. The panel deferred a decision on reducing the rate of tax on insurance premium, pending comments of the sector regulator, she said. A group of ministers examining the issue had recommended exempting insurance premiums paid for term life insurance policies from GST and premium paid by senior citizens for health insurance cover. It had also suggested GST exemption on premium paid by individuals, other than senior citizens, for health insurance with coverage of up to Rs 5 lakh. Alongside, the GoM on rate rationalisation, which is looking at tweaking rates on 148 items, will be given more time to arrive at a decision. The finance minister said the council decided to raise the rate of tax to 18 per cent from 12 per cent on all used EV sales, just as in case of non-electric vehicles, and it will be applicable only on the value that represents margin - the difference between the purchase price and selling price (depreciated value if depreciation is claimed) - by businesses. Sale and purchase of used vehicles by individuals will continue to be exempt from GST. Without naming any state, she said the states wanted to continue to keep aviation turbine fuel (ATF), used in aircraft, out of the goods and services tax (GST). When the GST subsumed more than a dozen central and state levies into GST in July 2017, five products - crude oil, petrol, diesel, ATF and natural gas - were kept out of its purview. The central government levies excise duty on them and states levy VAT. "Every state clearly said that ATF should not come into GST... States did not feel comfortable" to include ATF under the GST, she said. She said black pepper and raisins when supplied by an agriculturalist is not liable to GST payment. GoM on health insurance requires more work, she said, adding the same was the case with rate rationalisation GoM. "No report (on rate rationalisation) has been finalised," she said. The GoM on GST compensation cess, under Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary, has been given an extended deadline to submit its report. The earlier deadline was December 31, 2024. On small companies facing registration problems, she said a concept note has received in-principle approvals. This may require amendments to be made to the GST Acts to make it easier for small companies to register. The Council also decided to set up a Group of Ministers to mull over allowing states to levy cess under GST to overcome financial distress after natural calamities. Finance ministers of Uttar Pradesh, Telangana and West Bengal would be part of the GoM. The Council decided to form the GoM after Andhra Pradesh sought Council's approval to levy 1 per cent cess to overcome financial distress post flood in the state. No decision was taken on levy of tax on delivery charges by quick commerce and food delivery platforms. "This has been deferred," she said, adding the Fitment Committee will again review it and the issue being debated is if the tax should be equivalent to 5 per cent GST levied on food or more.Published By: Vivek Published On: Dec 21, 2024ALSO READ |  Paytm Money launches 'Pay Later' Margin Trading. 3 things to knowMust Watch

Headline: GST Council's key decisions: What's cheaper, what's costlier, and all other detailsGST Council brings key tax changes impacting everyday essentials like popcorn, used cars, fortified rice, corporate sponsorships, and penalties.
Content: The 55th GST Council meeting, chaired by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday, introduced significant changes to the Goods and Services Tax (GST) framework.  These decisions aim to streamline tax processes, provide relief in certain areas, and align taxation policies with emerging needs.WHAT’S GETTING CHEAPER? Several items and services will see a reduction in GST rates, offering financial relief: Fortified Rice Kernels (FRK): The GST rate on FRK has been reduced to 5% when supplied through the Public Distribution System (PDS). This move is targeted at ensuring affordable nutrition for economically weaker sections of society. Gene Therapy: In a step toward making advanced medical treatments more accessible, gene therapy has been fully exempted from GST. Food Preparations for Free Distribution: Inputs supplied for food distribution under government schemes for the economically weaker sections will now attract a concessional 5% GST rate. Systems for Long Range Surface-to-Air Missile (LRSAM) Assembly: The Council has exempted Integrated Goods and Services Tax (IGST) on systems, sub-systems, and tools used for LRSAM manufacturing, a move likely to benefit the defense sector. Inspection Equipment for IAEA: Imports of equipment and consumable samples for inspection by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) will now be exempt from IGST, supporting international regulatory compliance. Pepper and Raisins (Direct Sales): Pepper and raisins sold directly by agriculturists have been clarified as not liable to GST, ensuring relief for agricultural producers.WHAT’S GETTING COSTLIER? On the other hand, some items and services will see higher GST rates, increasing costs for consumers: Old and Used Vehicles (Including EVs): The GST rate has been increased from 12% to 18% on the sale of old and used vehicles, except for certain petrol and diesel variants. This change will impact the resale market for automobiles. Ready-to-Eat Popcorn: Pre-packaged and labelled ready-to-eat popcorn will now attract a 12% GST, while caramelised popcorn will be taxed at 18%. Non-pre-packaged and labelled popcorn with the character of “namkeens” will continue to attract 5% GST. Autoclaved Aerated Concrete (ACC) Blocks: ACC blocks containing more than 50% fly ash will now be taxed at 12%, affecting construction costs. Corporate Sponsorship Services: These services have been brought under the Forward Charge Mechanism, potentially increasing costs for corporate sponsors.OTHER POLICY UPDATES The Council also announced several updates aimed at clarifying existing policies and addressing long-standing ambiguities: Vouchers: Transactions involving vouchers have been clarified as neither a supply of goods nor services, making them exempt from GST. Penal Charges: Penalties collected by banks and NBFCs for non-compliance with loan terms will not attract GST, providing relief to borrowers. Definition of ‘Pre-Packaged and Labelled’: The definition has been updated to align with the Legal Metrology Act. It now covers commodities intended for retail sale, containing not more than 25 kg or 25 liters, and requiring mandatory labeling under the Act. These decisions are expected to have a varied impact across sectors, from healthcare and agriculture to automobiles and retail.  While some changes aim to reduce costs and boost affordability, others align with the government’s focus on revenue optimization and compliance.Published By: Manisha PandeyPublished On: Dec 22, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Epigamia co-founder Rohan Mirchandani dies at 42 due to cardiac arrestRohan Mirchandani, co-founder of Epigamia, died due to cardiac arrest. Known for transforming India's food market, he led Epigamia's growth to over 20,000 retail outlets in 30 cities.
Content: Rohan Mirchandani, the co-founder of Epigamia, one of India's leading Greek yogurt brands, died at the age of 42 following a cardiac arrest. The news was confirmed by Epigamia's parent company -- Drums Food International.  "All of us at the Epigamia family will deeply mourn this loss. Rohan was our mentor, friend, and leader. We remain steadfast in our determination to carry forward his dream with strength and vigor. Rohan’s vision and values will continue to guide us as we work together to honor the foundation he built and ensure that his dream continues to flourish," Drums Food said in an official statement. The statement also mentioned that Epigamia's daily operations will now be managed by senior leaders Ankur Goel (COO and Founding Member) and Uday Thakker (Co-founder and Director), with full support of the Board of Directors, which includes Rohan's family, Raj Mirchandani, and key investors, Verlinvest and DSG Consumer Partners. "Rohan was our mentor, friend, and leader. We remain committed to carrying forward his vision," Ankur Goel and Uday Thakker said in a statement. Mirchandani, a graduate of NYU Stern and The Wharton School, co-founded Drums Food International in 2013. Under his leadership, the company transitioned from its initial Hoki Poki ice cream line to Epigamia, a brand now available at over 20,000 retail outlets across 30 cities. The company had also been planning an expansion into the Middle East by 2025-26. Mirchandani had often spoken about his motivation to innovate in India’s FMCG sector, inspired by a lecture during business school. His plans included scaling Epigamia's revenue to Rs 250 crore by FY25 and increasing the brand’s presence in quick commerce channels. His death is among several recent losses in India’s startup ecosystem, including those of Pepperfry co-founder Ambareesh Murty and Good Capital’s Rohan Malhotra.Published By: Sahil SinhaPublished On: Dec 22, 2024ALSO READ |  Padma Shri awardee environmentalist Tulsi Gowda dies at 86 in Karnataka

Headline: Sensex, Nifty snap losing streak with IT, metal surge; RIL shares up over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 577.72 points to 78,619.31, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 185.80 points to 23,773.30.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices broke their 5-day losing streak to open higher on Monday and started the week with an upward momentum driven by a rally in IT and metal stocks.  The S&P BSE Sensex was up 577.72 points to 78,619.31, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 185.80 points to 23,773.30 as of 9:21 AM.  The markets witnessed a bull run in early trade with bears losing their grip as all sectoral indices traded in green.  The top gaining stocks were Shriram Finance, which rose 2.11%, JSW Steel increasing 2.00%, Bajaj Finance up 1.85%, Hindalco gaining 1.75%, and HDFC Bank advancing 1.58%. On the downside, HDFC Life declined 1.07%, SBI Life Insurance lost 1.00%, Apollo Hospitals dropped 0.53%, CIPLA decreased 0.43%, and Sun Pharmaceutical fell 0.30%. The top gaining sectors were Nifty Realty rising 1.23%, followed by Nifty Bank up 1.11%, Nifty Financial Services gaining 1.05%, and Nifty Private Bank increasing 1.03%. Other gainers included Nifty FMCG advancing 0.71%, Nifty Financial Services 25/50 up 0.69%, Nifty Metal rising 0.68%, Nifty IT gaining 0.64%, Nifty Oil & Gas up 0.51%, and Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom increasing 0.71%. The remaining positive performers were Nifty Auto up 0.28%, Nifty Media gaining 0.26%, Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank rising 0.26%, Nifty PSU Bank up 0.20%, Nifty Healthcare Index gaining 0.01%, and Nifty Consumer Durables advancing 0.11%. On the downside, only Nifty Midsmall Healthcare saw a decline, falling 0.20%, while Nifty Pharma dropped 0.09%. "Slowdown in Q2 GDP growth and stagnation in corporate earnings in India have soured the domestic market sentiments. In the short run there will be market rebounds which may be followed by renewed FII selling. A sustained rally is possible only when we have indications of a growth revival in the economy. This is likely in early 2025," said Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: Zomato shares to be in focus today. Here's why Zomato's stock has surged nearly 43% over the last six months and approximately 126% over the past year, far outpacing the Sensex's one-year return of 10.7%.
Content: Zomato shares are set to be in the spotlight today as the food delivery giant achieves a huge milestone, becoming the first new-age tech company to join the BSE Sensex’s 30-share index. This change, part of the benchmark index's planned rebalancing, will take effect on December 23, replacing steel major JSW Steel. The index reshuffle is expected to result in changes in fund flows. Brokerage firm Nuvama has estimated inflows of $513 million into Zomato due to its inclusion in the Sensex, while JSW Steel may see outflows of $252 million. This rebalancing underscores the evolving dynamics of the stock market as tech-focused companies like Zomato gain prominence. Zomato’s inclusion in the Sensex comes after an impressive performance in the past year. The company’s stock has surged nearly 43% over the last six months and approximately 126% over the past year, far outpacing the Sensex’s one-year return of 10.7%. In contrast, JSW Steel has delivered around 9% returns over the same period. Brokerage firm UBS attributed Zomato’s rally of nearly 150% over the past 18 months to its ability to improve unit economics and move closer to profitability, particularly in its quick commerce (qcom) segment. Zomato reported strong financial results for the July-September quarter, with a 69% year-on-year increase in consolidated revenue from operations, reaching Rs 4,799 crore. The company also recorded a five-fold jump in net profit to Rs 176 crore. The relaunch of its subscription program, Zomato Gold, earlier this year has played a key role in driving growth. The program has helped increase ordering frequency among the company’s top customers, contributing to its robust financial performance. As of December 21, Zomato’s market capitalisation stood at Rs 2.72 lakh crore, surpassing JSW Steel’s Rs 2.24 lakh crore. According to UBS, Zomato is trading at a forecasted FY27 EV/EBITDA (adjusted) of 39 times, which translates to an FY27 EV/Sales multiple of 6.3 times. These metrics highlight investor confidence in the company’s future growth potential. The rebalancing extends beyond the Sensex to the BSE 100 index, which will see the addition of six new stocks: Jio Financial Services, Suzlon Energy, Adani Green Energy, Adani Power, Samvardhana Motherson International, and PB Fintech (Policybazaar). These companies will replace Ashok Leyland, P.I. Industries, IDFC First Bank, Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC), UPL, and APL Apollo Tubes.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Dam Capital Advisors IPO: Check GMP as listing enters last day for bidding Dam Capital Advisors IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 840.25 crore. The entire issue is an Offer for Sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares by the selling shareholders, meaning the company will not receive any funds from this offering.
Content: Dam Capital Advisors IPO will close for bidding today, December 23, 2024. The public issue, which opened for subscription on December 19, has garnered strong interest from investors, being subscribed over 7 times. As of December 20, the IPO had been subscribed 7.1 times. The retail investor segment led the interest with a subscription of 9.16 times, followed by the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) category at 11.56 times. However, the Qualified Institutional Buyer (QIB) segment saw only 0.07 times subscription, showing limited demand from institutional investors. Dam Capital Advisors IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 840.25 crore. The entire issue is an Offer for Sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares by the selling shareholders, meaning the company will not receive any funds from this offering. The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 269 and Rs 283 per share. The minimum lot size for applications is 53 shares, making the minimum investment for retail investors Rs 14,999. For Small Non-Institutional Investors (sNII), the minimum application size is 14 lots (742 shares), requiring an investment of Rs 2,09,986. Large Non-Institutional Investors (bNII) need to apply for at least 67 lots (3,551 shares), amounting to Rs 10,04,933.GMP AND EXPECTED LISTING PRICE The latest Grey Market Premium (GMP) for the Dam Capital Advisors IPO is Rs 160, as of December 23, 2024. With the upper price band set at Rs 283 per share, the estimated listing price stands at Rs 443, reflecting a potential gain of 56.54% per share. The allotment of shares is expected to be finalised on Tuesday, December 24, 2024. Investors can check their application status on the registrar's website, Link Intime India Private Ltd, once the allotment is announced. The shares are likely to be listed on both the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on Friday, December 27, 2024. The IPO’s book-running lead manager is Nuvama Wealth Management Limited, while Link Intime India Private Ltd serves as the registrar for the issue.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: Sensex jumps 800 points: 3 factors behind today's stock market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 802.66 points to 78,844.25 by 11:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 243 points to trade at 23,828.60.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices surged sharply in early trade, breaking a week-long losing streak and providing much-needed relief to investors. The S&P BSE Sensex climbed 802.66 points to 78,844.25 by 11:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 243 points to trade at 23,828.60. Broader market indices also rebounded as market volatility eased significantly during the session.HEAVYWEIGHT STOCKS GAIN Heavyweight banking, financial services, and IT stocks played a significant role in driving today’s rally. Metal and realty stocks also performed well, adding to the momentum. Leading contributors included Reliance Industries Limited and HDFC Bank, with gains of up to 1.7%. Stocks such as JSW Steel, ITC, Tech Mahindra, and Wipro also posted notable gains, further supporting the market’s recovery. Analysts at Emkay Global raised HDFC Bank’s target price to Rs 2,100 from Rs 2,000, citing the bank’s attractive valuations and robust asset quality, which is expected to outperform peers. The positive outlook for HDFC Bank provided additional confidence to investors.METAL STOCKS JUMP Metal stocks rose 1.3% after the Directorate General of Trade Remedies initiated a safeguard probe into imports of non-alloy and alloy steel flat products. Investec highlighted that domestic steelmakers, particularly Tata Steel and JSW Steel, could benefit from the potential imposition of safeguard duties. Tata Steel gained 1.7%, while JSW Steel surged 3%.STRONG GLOBAL CUES Global cues also supported the rally, with Asian markets climbing after data showed US inflation remained subdued. The MSCI Asia ex-Japan index rose 1.3%, buoyed by expectations of a less aggressive stance by the US Federal Reserve. Despite today’s gains, market experts caution against over-optimism. Dr. VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, added that foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold Rs 15,826 crore last week due to India’s economic slowdown and better returns in US markets. While rebounds like today’s offer temporary relief, experts believe a sustained rally will depend on clear signs of economic growth revival, which may only emerge in early 2025.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 23, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Concord Enviro IPO closes for bidding: Check latest subscription, GMP The Concord Enviro IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 500.33 crore. It consists of a fresh issue of 25 lakh shares, which will raise Rs 175 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 46 lakh shares valued at Rs 325.33 crore.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Concord Enviro Systems Limited will close for bidding on Monday, December 23, 2024. The IPO, which opened on December 19, 2024, has attracted decent subscription numbers across investor categories. By the morning of Day 3 (December 23, 2024, 11:09 AM), the Concord Enviro IPO had been subscribed 1.82 times. In the retail category, it was subscribed 2.72 times, while the Non-Institutional Investor (NII) category saw a subscription of 2.01 times. However, the Qualified Institutional Buyer (QIB) segment lagged, with only 0.02 times subscription. The Concord Enviro IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 500.33 crore. It consists of a fresh issue of 25 lakh shares, which will raise Rs 175 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 46 lakh shares valued at Rs 325.33 crore. The funds from the fresh issue will be utilised by the company for its business needs, while the proceeds from the OFS will go to the selling shareholders. The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 665 and Rs 701 per share. Retail investors can bid for a minimum of one lot, which contains 21 shares, requiring a minimum investment of Rs 14,721. Small Non-Institutional Investors (sNII) will need to apply for a minimum of 14 lots (294 shares), which requires an investment of Rs 2,06,094. For large Non-Institutional Investors (bNII), the minimum application size is 68 lots (1,428 shares), amounting to Rs 10,01,028.LATEST GMP AND LISTING EXPECTATIONS The latest Grey Market Premium (GMP) for Concord Enviro Systems IPO stands at Rs 50, as of December 23, 2024. Based on the upper price band of Rs 701 per share, the estimated listing price is Rs 751. This suggests a potential gain of 7.13% for investors upon listing. Concord Enviro Systems Limited, established in July 1999, provides solutions for water and wastewater treatment. The company’s technologies include zero-liquid discharge (ZLD) systems, which enable the recycling and reuse of water. With a global presence, Concord Enviro serves industries that seek sustainable solutions to address water management challenges. The allotment of shares is expected to be finalised on December 24, 2024. The shares are scheduled to list on both the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on December 27, 2024. Motilal Oswal Investment Advisors Limited and Equirus Capital Private Limited are the book-running lead managers for the IPO. Link Intime India Private Ltd has been appointed as the registrar for the issue, overseeing the allotment process and handling investor queries.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: Stocks to watch today: Zomato, RIL, TCS, Vedanta, NTPC Green, Ultratech CementBoth the BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 witnessed massive losses last week, with the Sensex dropping over 4,000 points across five consecutive sessions and the Nifty falling by nearly 1,200 points, marking a 5% weekly loss.
Content: The stock market will be in the spotlight as a new week begins after experiencing a sharp decline last week. Both the BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 witnessed massive losses, with the Sensex dropping over 4,000 points across five consecutive sessions and the Nifty falling by nearly 1,200 points, marking a 5% weekly loss. The downturn was driven by hawkish signals from the US Federal Reserve, foreign investor selling, and concerns over high valuations and sluggish corporate earnings growth. As the new trading week begins, several stocks are expected to grab investor attention due to recent developments.ZOMATO  Zomato shares are set to remain in focus as the food delivery giant becomes the first new-age tech company to join the BSE Sensex 30-share index. This inclusion marks a significant milestone for the company.RELIANCE INDUSTRIES (RIL) Reliance Industries Ltd's subsidiary, Reliance Digital Health, has signed agreements to acquire a 45% equity stake in Health Alliance Group Inc (HAGI) for $10 million. HAGI is a US-based company specialising in technology-driven healthcare solutions for underserved communities globally.TATA CONSULTANCY SERVICES (TCS) TCS Africa, a subsidiary of Tata Consultancy Services, has agreed to sell its 30% stake in TCS South Africa to comply with Broad-Based Black Economic Empowerment (B-BBEE) guidelines.NTPC GREEN NTPC Green Energy has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Bihar government to promote renewable energy initiatives in the state.AUROBINDO PHARMA CuraTeQ Biologics, a subsidiary of Aurobindo Pharma, has received marketing authorisation for Bevqolva, its biosimilar version of bevacizumab, from the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA).VEDANTA Vedanta has revised its previously announced demerger plan, opting to retain its base metals business within the parent company instead of spinning it off.NHPC NHPC has entered into an MoU with the Bihar government to invest Rs 5,500 crore in solar energy and green hydrogen projects in the state.PIRAMAL ENTERPRISES Piramal Enterprises' board has approved plans to raise up to Rs 2,000 crore through a qualified institutional placement.INDUSIND BANK The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has imposed a penalty of Rs 27.3 lakh on IndusInd Bank for non-compliance with certain regulatory norms.ULTRATECH CEMENT UltraTech Cement has received approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI) to acquire a 32.72% stake in India Cements. UltraTech will make an open offer to public shareholders for an additional 26% stake at Rs 390 per share.INDIAN OIL CORPORATION (IOC) IOC's board has approved an investment of Rs 657.33 crore for a yarn project in Bhadrak, Odisha.TEAMLEASE SERVICES TeamLease Services has announced plans to acquire a 90% stake in TSR Darashaw HR Services and a 30% stake in Crystal HR and Security Solutions as part of its growth strategy.HINDUSTAN CONSTRUCTION COMPANY (HCC) HCC has sold its stake in Steiner AG through its subsidiaries to Uniresolv SA, a Geneva-based real estate and finance company.AGI GREENPAC The packaging firm's board has approved a fundraising plan of up to Rs 1,500 crore through various methods, including preferential issues and qualified institutional placements.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: Unimech Aerospace IPO opens: Check opening date, gmp, price band, lot size Unimech Aerospace IPO: The price band for the IPO has been set at Rs 745 to Rs 785 per share. The minimum lot size for investors is 19 shares, which requires a minimum investment of Rs 14,915.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Unimech Aerospace will open for bidding on Monday, aiming to raise Rs 500 crore. The IPO consists of a fresh issue of 32 lakh shares worth Rs 250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 32 lakh shares also valued at Rs 250 crore. The price band for the IPO has been set at Rs 745 to Rs 785 per share. The minimum lot size for investors is 19 shares, which requires a minimum investment of Rs 14,915. For Small Non-Institutional Investors (sNII), the minimum application size is 14 lots (266 shares), requiring an investment of Rs 2,08,810. Large Non-Institutional Investors (bNII) will need to apply for a minimum of 68 lots (1,292 shares), amounting to Rs 10,14,220. The Unimech Aerospace IPO will close on December 26, 2024. The allotment of shares is expected to be finalised on Friday, December 27, 2024. The shares are set to list on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on Tuesday, December 31, 2024GMP AND EXPECTED LISTING PRICE The latest Grey Market Premium (GMP) for Unimech Aerospace IPO is Rs 480 as of December 23, 2024. Based on the upper price band of Rs 785 per share, the estimated listing price is Rs 1,265. This represents a potential gain of 61.15% per share, making it an attractive proposition for investors. Incorporated in 2016, Unimech Aerospace and Manufacturing Limited specialises in manufacturing complex tools, mechanical assemblies, electro-mechanical systems, and components for aeroengine and airframe production. The company provides engineering solutions and operates with "build to print" and "build to specifications" models. Its services include machining, fabrication, assembly, testing, and creating custom products for clients in the aerospace, defence, energy, and semiconductor industries.OBJECTIVES OF THE IPO The funds raised through the fresh issue will be used for the following purposes: Capital expenditure: Expanding operations by purchasing machinery and equipment. Working capital: Funding the company’s working capital needs. Subsidiary investment: Supporting the material subsidiary by financing its machinery purchases, working capital needs, and repaying or prepaying some of its borrowings. General corporate purposes: Using funds for various other operational needs. The company will not receive any proceeds from the Offer for Sale (OFS), as the funds from this component will go directly to the selling shareholders. Anand Rathi Securities Limited and Equirus Capital Private Limited are the book-running lead managers for the IPO. KFin Technologies Limited is the registrar for the issue, handling the allotment process and investor queries.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024: What is it and how to avail it?Settle tax disputes easily under the Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024 by paying the disputed tax and avoiding penalties.
Content: The Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024, introduced in Budget 2024, provides taxpayers with an opportunity to settle pending disputes with the Income Tax Department. By paying the disputed tax amount along with a specified percentage, taxpayers can resolve disputes and avoid penalties and interest. If the payment and Form-1 submission are completed by December 31, 2024, the taxpayer can settle at a lower cost. Post this date, higher amounts apply.advertisementELIGIBILITY FOR THE SCHEMETaxpayers eligible for this scheme include: Taxpayers eligible for this scheme include: Those with pending appeals, writ petitions, or special leave petitions as of July 22, 2024. Individuals who filed objections before the Dispute Resolution Panel (DRP) before July 22, 2024, and await a decision. Cases where the DRP issued directions, but the assessment remains incomplete as of July 22, 2024. Taxpayers with revision applications under Section 264 pending on July 22, 2024.WHY CHOOSE THIS SCHEME? Experts highlight the benefits of resolving weaker cases and saving on litigation costs. Small disputes involving issues like capital gains, warranty claims, or unsecured loans can be settled efficiently. However, taxpayers are advised to evaluate their cases and seek professional guidance before opting in.APPLICATION PROCESS AND FORMS To apply, taxpayers need to submit: Form-1: Declaration and undertaking. Form-2: Acknowledgement certificate by the designated authority. Form-3: Payment intimation by the declarant. Form-4: Order for final settlement by the authority. Form 1 and 3 are submitted electronically on the Income Tax Department’s portal. This scheme is a valuable chance for taxpayers to settle disputes and avoid prolonged litigation. However, it is essential to assess the case’s merits with tax consultants before applying.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: F&O gamble: 5 reasons why options trading is a losing game for retail tradersOne of the biggest challenges retail traders face in India is the prohibitively high transaction costs. Unlike in the US, where brokerage fees are negligible and there are no transaction taxes, Indian traders face multiple layers of charges.
Content: India’s derivatives market has been witnessing unprecedented growth, with retail participation soaring from 5.1 million in FY22 to 9.6 million in FY24. The National Stock Exchange (NSE) recorded over 8.5 billion F&O contracts worth $1.1 trillion in April 2024 alone. However, beneath this surge lies a grim reality for retail investors. Dr. Jayatu Sen Chaudhury, Professor of Financial Analytics at Great Lakes Institute of Management, cited a recent study conducted by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) to highlight the fact that “for most retail traders, options trading is a losing game”. It may be noted that the Sebi study revealed the stark odds faced by retail traders, with 93% incurring net losses between FY22 and FY24, collectively losing over Rs 1.8 lakh crore ($21.6 billion) in three years. “Despite their enthusiasm and growing numbers, structural and systemic challenges in India’s options market have made consistent profitability elusive for retail participants,” Chaudhury said. In this article, Dr. Jayatu Sen Chaudhury highlights 5 major hurdles faced by retail investors.CRUSHING WEIGHT OF TRANSACTION COSTS One of the biggest challenges retail traders face in India is the prohibitively high transaction costs. Unlike in the US, where brokerage fees are negligible and there are no transaction taxes, Indian traders face multiple layers of charges: Securities Transaction Tax (STT): Levied at 0.125% of the premium on option sales, STT disproportionately affects small-scale, high-frequency trades. Brokerage Fees: Flat rates of Rs 20 per trade may seem minor but can represent a significant cost for low-value trades. Exchange Turnover Fees and GST: NSE/BSE turnover fees and an 18% GST on brokerage fees further inflate costs. For example, a Rs 100 premium option trade in India can incur Rs 37.67 (~4%) in transaction costs, compared to less than $1 (<1%) in the U.S. for a similar trade. Over three years, retail traders in India collectively spent Rs 50,000 crore ($6 billion) on transaction costs, creating an insurmountable break-even point for many.VOLATILITY AND LIMITED GAINS The Indian market’s inherent volatility adds another layer of complexity. While the Nifty Index’s average monthly return (2022–2024) was 1.2%, its standard deviation—a measure of risk—was two to three times that. This heightened variability makes both buying and selling index options risky propositions. Furthermore, options premiums plummet sharply just a few percentage points away from the current market price, leaving retail traders with minimal room for gains. In such a volatile environment, consistent profitability requires precise timing and advanced strategies, skills that most retail traders lack.KNOWLEDGE GAP A lack of understanding of options Greeks (Delta, Gamma, Theta, Vega) and advanced trading strategies like spreads or straddles hampers retail traders' ability to manage risk effectively. Instead of treating options trading as a strategic investment, many—particularly the younger demographic—approach it as speculation. The Sebi study found that 43% of retail traders were under 30 years old in FY24, up from 31% in FY23. Many of these young traders are swayed by "finfluencers," who often oversimplify options trading to sell courses, leaving inexperienced traders with unrealistic expectations.THE INSTITUTIONAL EDGE While retail traders struggle, institutional players thrive. Leveraging algorithmic trading systems, they execute high-frequency trades with precision, exploiting inefficiencies that retail traders cannot. In FY24 alone: Proprietary traders recorded gross trading profits of Rs 33,000 crore ($3.96 billion). Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) earned Rs 28,000 crore ($3.36 billion). A staggering 96–97% of these profits were attributed to algorithmic trading, highlighting the technological gap between retail and institutional players. Retail traders, lacking access to similar tools and data, are at a significant disadvantage.DEMOGRAPHIC DISADVANTAGE The Sebi report also highlighted that 75% of retail traders in the F&O segment had annual incomes below Rs 5 lakh ($6,000). For this demographic, trading beyond their financial capacity amplifies risks. Younger, inexperienced traders are particularly vulnerable, often enduring repeated losses in the hope of eventual success. Alarmingly, over 75% of losing traders persisted in trading despite consecutive losses, underscoring a dangerous cycle of overconfidence and lack of financial literacy.WHY RETAIL TRADERS RARELY WIN For retail traders, the odds of success are stacked against them due to: High Costs: Annual transaction costs per trader average Rs 26,000 ($310), significantly eroding potential profits. Time Decay (Theta): Options lose value as expiration nears, with over 70% expiring worthless. Wide Bid-Ask Spreads: These spreads further increase implicit trading costs. High Leverage Risks: While options provide leverage, they amplify losses, particularly in volatile markets. Lack of Education and Tools: Without sophisticated tools or a solid understanding of market dynamics, retail traders are at a perpetual disadvantage.WHAT NEEDS TO CHANGE? Recognising these challenges, Sebi has proposed measures to curb speculative trading and protect retail participants, including: Increasing minimum contract sizes: To deter small-capital speculative trades. Regulating weekly expiries: To reduce high-frequency trading pressure. While these steps are commendable, Dr. Jayatu Sen Chaudhury said robust investor education initiatives must complement these. “Retail traders need access to better tools, data, and training to navigate the complexities of options trading effectively," he said. "Unless structural reforms are implemented to reduce costs and level the playing field, options trading will continue to be a losing game for most retail investors in India. For now, the allure of quick riches remains a dangerous illusion for the average trader,” he added. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: GSTR-9 simplified: Filing, features, deadlines and other details GSTR-9 consolidates GST data for taxpayers exceeding Rs 2 crore turnover, ensuring accurate reconciliation and compliance.
Content: GSTR-9 is the annual return to be filed by taxpayers registered under Goods and Services Tax (GST), offering a comprehensive overview of sales, purchases, and the GST charged and paid during the financial year.KEY FEATURES OF GSTR-9 This return consolidates data from various monthly/quarterly returns, including GSTR-1, GSTR-2A, GSTR-2B, and GSTR-3B, for the entire financial year. It contains detailed information on both outward and inward supplies under different tax heads—CGST, SGST, IGST—along with cess and HSN codes. This thorough compilation allows for effective reconciliation, ensuring that taxpayers meet the necessary compliance standards.WHO NEEDS TO FILE GSTR-9? GSTR-9 is mandatory for GST taxpayers with an aggregate annual turnover exceeding Rs 2 crore for the financial year 2023-2024. However, the following categories are exempt from filing this return: Casual taxable persons Input service distributors TDS deductors TCS collectors Non-resident taxable persons The deadline for filing GSTR-9 for FY 2023-2024 is December 31, 2024.TYPES OF ANNUAL GST RETURNS There are various types of GST annual returns, depending on the taxpayer’s category: GSTR-9: For regular taxpayers filing GSTR-1 and GSTR-3B. GSTR-9A: For composition scheme taxpayers. GSTR-9B: For e-commerce operators who file GSTR-8. GSTR-9C: For taxpayers with an annual turnover of over Rs 5 crore, requiring audited accounts and a reconciliation statement.STEPS TO FILE GSTR-9 Ensure GSTR-1 and GSTR-3B are filed for FY 2023-24. Perform a detailed reconciliation of ITC and sales data. Address any discrepancies with vendors and customers. Use offline tools or cloud-based software like Clear for seamless filing. Settle any short tax payments or excess ITC claims using DRC-03. Submit GSTR-9 on the GST portal. Though filing GSTR-9 may seem complex, it plays a crucial role in ensuring compliance and transparency in GST filings. By carefully reconciling and filing on time, businesses can avoid penalties and stay on top of their tax obligations.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: Explained: Why India Cements share price surged 11% today Shares of India Cements rose after UltraTech Cement received a crucial approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI).
Content: Shares of India Cements Ltd surged 11% on Monday following news of UltraTech Cement receiving approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI) to acquire a majority stake in the company. UltraTech Cement plans to acquire 10,13,91,231 equity shares of India Cements, each valued at Rs 10. This represents a 32.72% stake in the company, held by its promoters, members of the promoter group, and another shareholder. In addition to the stake purchase, UltraTech Cement will make an open offer to acquire up to 8,05,73,273 equity shares from public shareholders. This open offer, which represents 26% of India Cements’ equity, is priced at Rs 390 per share. The offer price is a 15% premium over India Cements’ closing price of Rs 339 on Friday. The news sparked a rally in India Cements shares, which climbed 11% to reach Rs 376.30 during Monday’s trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). UltraTech Cement also saw a modest gain of 1.14%, with its shares trading at Rs 11,555 during the day. At the time the article was being written, India Cements shares were trading at Rs 368.50, up 8.65%.  The acquisition deal was first announced on July 28, 2024, with UltraTech Cement revealing plans to invest Rs 3,950 crore to acquire a significant stake in India Cements. UltraTech Cement had previously acquired a 23% stake in India Cements at Rs 268 per share. Market experts see this acquisition as a move that could lead to better price discipline in the cement industry. Consolidation in the sector is expected to improve profitability and enhance return ratios over the long term. For UltraTech Cement, the acquisition aligns with its growth strategy. The company aims to achieve a global production capacity of 200 million tonnes per annum (mtpa) by FY2027. UltraTech Cement's management reiterated its goal of double-digit volume growth for the second half of FY2025. This growth is expected to be driven by government spending on infrastructure projects, consistent demand from urban housing, and increased rural demand following good monsoons. Analysts have also highlighted UltraTech's continued focus on efficiency improvement, which supports its expansion plans. UltraTech Cement's acquisition of India Cements, along with its planned acquisition of Kesoram, is expected to be completed by the end of FY2025. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: From the world's richest to fifth: The ups and downs of Bernard Arnault Once the world's richest, Bernard Arnault lost $32 billion in 2024 but remains a luxury titan with LVMH's 75 iconic brands.
Content: Once the world’s richest person, Bernard Arnault, chairman and CEO of luxury goods giant LVMH, has seen his fortune take a dramatic hit in 2024. Despite his immense wealth, the French billionaire has slipped to fifth place on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, with a net worth of $176 billion after losing $32 billion year-to-date.advertisementTHE RISE AND FALL OF A LUXURY MOGULArnault first claimed the title of the world’s richest person in August 2021, fuelled by soaring luxury goods sales in Asia. Since then, his ranking has fluctuated, regaining the top spot briefly in 2022, 2023, and again in May 2024. Arnault first claimed the title of the world’s richest person in August 2021, fuelled by soaring luxury goods sales in Asia. Since then, his ranking has fluctuated, regaining the top spot briefly in 2022, 2023, and again in May 2024. However, a significant downturn followed in September 2024, when LVMH shares dropped 20%, translating to a $54 billion loss due to declining revenues. The company’s Chief Financial Officer, Jean-Jacques Guiony, attributed the revenue slump to geopolitical tensions affecting global markets. Arnault’s fall marks a stark contrast to the tech-dominated top billionaire list. He is the sole representative of the luxury goods industry in the top five, which is otherwise populated by tech tycoons like Elon Musk ($444 billion), Jeff Bezos ($244 billion), Mark Zuckerberg ($207 billion), and Larry Ellison ($190 billion). Even in the top 10, Warren Buffett, a non-tech mogul, is the only other exception.THE LEGACY OF LVMH Despite these setbacks, LVMH remains a powerhouse in the luxury market, with around 75 iconic brands spanning wines, spirits, fashion, leather goods, perfumes, cosmetics, watches, and jewellery. Some renowned names include Christian Dior, Bulgari, TAG Heuer, Hublot, Tiffany & Co., and Sephora. Even as geopolitical tensions and market challenges persist, Arnault’s empire continues to set the standard in luxury, proving that wealth, like luxury, often comes with its own ups and downs.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 23, 2024Trending Reel

Headline: Salted, pre-packed or caramelised? Popcorn gets stuck in GST mazeThe GST Council's decision to impose different tax rates on salted, pre-packaged, and caramelised popcorn has faced criticism, with economists, industry experts, and former government officials arguing that the new tax structure adds complexity for consumers.
Content: Popcorn, a timeless snack enjoyed at movie nights, parties, and as a casual treat, has recently found itself at the heart of a complicated tax debate that’s stirring confusion and frustration across the country. The GST Council’s decision to impose different tax rates on salted, pre-packaged, and caramelised popcorn has faced criticism, with economists, industry experts, and former government officials arguing that the new tax structure adds complexity for consumers while failing to make a significant contribution to the government’s coffers. The tax structure is as follows: 5% GST on salted popcorn, 12% on pre-packaged and labeled popcorn, and a hefty 18% on caramelised popcorn. At first glance, the distinction between these varieties seems straightforward, but critics are questioning the logic behind it, especially when the potential revenue impact appears to be negligible. Former Chief Economic Advisor Krishnamurthy Subramanian is among those who have raised concerns about the new tax rates. Subramanian, known for his outspoken views, pointed out that the revenue generated from this differentiation would be minimal and hardly worth the hassle it could cause to ordinary citizens. In a social media post on X, Subramanian explained, “Estimated popcorn sales in 2025 (estimated from GlobalData) = Rs 1700 crore. Assuming the entire amount is taxed at 18%, GST collection from popcorn = Rs 300 crore. Total GST collection (estimated 2025) = Rs 22,00,000 crore. Max revenue contribution of popcorn decision = 300/2200000 = 0.013%!” He went on to question, “What is the rationale for a decision that can max contribute 0.013% to revenue but inconvenience citizens?” The debate over the popcorn tax has since snowballed, with some prominent voices chiming in, criticising the move as both “silly and complex.” Former Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai was quick to weigh in, calling the new rates “silly and complex” and warning that they could lead to what he described as “tax terrorism.” Pai raised alarm over how such policies could affect ordinary citizens and called for a simplification of the GST system. “This is silly and complex. Will lead to tax terrorism. Citizens are becoming victims of bad policy which will make them hostages to rent-seeking officials and create disputes. GST needs to be simplified, not this,” Pai said. Arvind Subramanian, another former CFO, added his voice to the chorus of critics, calling the decision a “national tragedy” and arguing that it went against the very spirit of the Goods and Services Tax, which was originally designed to simplify taxation across the country. However, the finance ministry has clarified that the GST Council’s recommendation wasn’t introducing a new tax, but rather offering clarification to resolve disputes that had arisen from the interpretation of existing tax rates. Despite the clarification, the damage had already been done. What started as a seemingly harmless tweak to the tax structure has become a focal point for critics, highlighting the complexities of India’s taxation system. Social media has exploded with memes and jokes about how popcorn—of all things—has become a symbol of the country’s complicated GST framework. But beyond the memes and the public outrage, the popcorn tax sheds light on a far bigger issue: the struggle to maintain a tax system that is both simple and effective. While policymakers are pushing for clarity, the real question remains: will popcorn be the tipping point that forces a serious overhaul of India’s convoluted tax structure?Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: PM-JAY for senior citizens: How to register for free health insuranceAyushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana ensures senior citizens over 70 get free health insurance of Rs 5 lakh annually, with a simple enrolment process to make healthcare more accessible.
Content: The Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY) offers free health insurance of up to Rs 5 lakh every year to senior citizens. This initiative targets vulnerable sections of society, including senior citizens over 70, regardless of their income. The scheme, a flagship project by the Government of India, ensures that millions of senior citizens have access to quality healthcare without financial strain.advertisementENROLLING IN THE SCHEME: A SIMPLE PROCESSSenior citizens or their family members can begin the enrolment process by downloading the Ayushman Bharat app from the Google Play Store or the official website. Once downloaded, users can select their preferred language to navigate through the process smoothly. Senior citizens or their family members can begin the enrolment process by downloading the Ayushman Bharat app from the Google Play Store or the official website. Once downloaded, users can select their preferred language to navigate through the process smoothly. To start enrolment, users must click on the ‘Login as beneficiary’ option, entering the captcha and their mobile number. After receiving an OTP, the login is complete, and they can move on to the senior citizen’s enrolment section at the bottom of the home screen.AADHAAR VERIFICATION AND FINAL SUBMISSION A key step in the process is Aadhaar validation. After entering the Aadhaar number, users will receive an OTP on the registered mobile number for validation. They will then need to select their state of residence, after which a search option will confirm whether the senior citizen is already enroled. If not, fresh enrolment is required, followed by another OTP verification. The process also includes taking a live photo for identity verification. After providing all required details—such as address, city, state, ward information, and contact number—the application can be submitted. Upon approval, the beneficiary receives the Ayushman card, ready to avail of the benefits.A HEALTHIER FUTURE FOR SENIOR CITIZENS With over 36 crore beneficiaries already verified under the scheme, PM-JAY is transforming healthcare for India’s elderly population. By simplifying the enrolment process, this initiative empowers senior citizens with access to essential health services, making healthcare more accessible and affordable for all.Published By: Published On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: NSE, BSE to keep markets open on February 1 for Union Budget 2025The practice of keeping markets open during Budget Day is not new. In the past, trading was also allowed on non-working days to facilitate real-time market reactions to Budget announcements.
Content: The National Stock Exchange (NSE) and Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) have announced that the markets will remain open for live trading on February 1, 2025, coinciding with the presentation of the Union Budget. This decision was shared by the exchanges through a circular issued on December 23. The circular said, "On account of the presentation of the Union Budget, Exchange shall be conducting live trading session on February 1, 2025." This practice of keeping markets open during Budget Day is not new. In the past, trading was also allowed on non-working days, such as Saturday, February 1, 2020, and Saturday, February 28, 2015, to facilitate real-time market reactions to Budget announcements. The NSE has further clarified that the “T0” session, typically used for certain types of trading and settlements, will not be scheduled on February 1 due to the day being a settlement holiday. This means certain trades that require same-day settlement will not occur on that day. Budget Day is one of the most anticipated events in the financial calendar, as announcements made during the Union Budget often influence market trends and investor sentiment. Decisions related to taxation, government spending, and economic reforms have a direct impact on sectors across the economy, leading to heightened trading activity and volatility in the markets. The decision to keep trading open on February 1 allows investors and market participants to respond to the announcements in real-time. It also provides a platform for price discovery and facilitates smooth market operations during this significant economic event.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Should you subscribe? Check GMP, subscription Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders.
Content:
The Rs 582.11 crore initial public offering (IPO) of Senores Pharmaceuticals is set to close for bidding on Tuesday, December 24, 2024, after opening for subscription on Friday. The company is offering its shares in a price band of Rs 372 to Rs 391. Investors can apply for a minimum of 38 shares, with applications in multiples of this lot size. Senores Pharmaceuticals is a pharmaceutical company that develops and manufactures a variety of products for regulated markets such as the US, Canada, and the UK, as well as emerging markets. The IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders. The company plans to use the proceeds from the fresh issue for various purposes, including investments in subsidiaries, repayment of borrowings for itself and its subsidiaries, funding working capital needs, supporting inorganic growth through acquisitions and strategic initiatives, and for general corporate purposes. Before the public offering, Senores Pharmaceuticals raised Rs 260.6 crore from anchor investors by allocating 66.65 lakh shares at Rs 391 per share. Notable investors in the anchor book include Goldman Sachs, Societe Generale, Beacon Stone Capital, LC Pharos Multi Strategy Fund, Integrated Global Strategies, and Fortune Hands Growth Fund.GREY MARKET PREMIUM (GMP) The IPO’s grey market premium (GMP) has increased steadily in recent days. As of December 23, 2024, 12:01 PM, the GMP stood at Rs 220. Adding this premium to the upper price band of Rs 391, the estimated listing price is Rs 611 per share. This suggests a potential gain of 56.27% for investors. Strong GMP numbers align with the subscription status of the IPO. As of December 23, 2024, the IPO had been subscribed 11.08 times, with 30 times subscription in the retail category, 0.33 times in the qualified institutional buyers (QIB) category, and 19.73 times in the non-institutional investors (NII) category.SHOULD YOU SUBSCRIBE? Several brokerages have given a positive outlook on the IPO, citing the company’s strong financial performance and growth potential. Anand Rathi:
Anand Rathi has assigned a “Subscribe” rating to the IPO. It values the company at a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 55x, with a market capitalisation of Rs 18,006 million post-issue and a return on net worth (RoNW) of 23.6% based on FY24 data. The brokerage believes the company is fairly priced. SBI Securities:
SBI Securities has recommended subscribing for the long term. Senores Pharmaceuticals is valued at P/E and EV/EBITDA multiples of 57.2x and 36.8x, respectively, based on FY24 earnings. The company achieved a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 289.1% in revenue, 361.6% in EBITDA, and 474.5% in profit after tax (PAT) between FY22 and FY24. Canara Bank Securities:
Canara Bank Securities has also recommended subscribing. It highlighted the company’s strong return on equity (RoE) of 23.6%, significantly above the listed peer average of 16.96%. The brokerage noted that Senores is attractively valued at a P/E ratio of 28x based on FY24 earnings, compared to the peer average of 31x. The allotment of shares for the Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO is likely to be confirmed on Thursday, 26 December 2024. The company plans to debut on the stock exchanges BSE and NSE, with its tentative listing date set for Monday, 30 December 2024.
