Headline: Will DA rise again in 2025? All you need to knowCentral government employees await a potential DA hike in January 2025, which could offer modest relief amid rising costs
Content: As the new year approaches, central government employees eagerly await updates on the next dearness allowance (DA) revision. Scheduled for January 2025, this potential hike could bring welcome relief amid rising living costs. However, with the process hinging on the All-India Consumer Price Index (AICPI) numbers, the official announcement may face delays.HOW DA IS DETERMINED Dearness Allowance is revised biannually, reflecting the cost of living based on AICPI data. The Centre reviews the index for January-June and July-December periods, announcing revisions after evaluating the 12-month average AICPI. The DA percentage is based on a 12-month AICPI increase, concluding in June annually. Though revised biannually, announcements often lag. On October 16, 2024, the Union Cabinet approved a 3% DA hike to 53%, aiding over one crore employees and pensioners. Earlier, a 4% hike raised DA to 50% in January 2024, announced in March. The formula for calculating DA is straightforward. For general employees, DA Percentage = ((Average AICPI for the past 12 months - 115.76) / 115.76) x 100. Adjustments vary slightly for central public sector employees, but the basic principle remains consistent.EXPECTED DA HIKE IN JANUARY 2025 Projections suggest a further 3% increase in DA for January 2025, based on current AICPI trends. With the index reaching 144.5 in October 2024 and expected to rise further, the DA may climb to 56%. If approved, this will translate into significant financial benefits. For instance, an employee with a minimum salary of Rs18,000 would see an increase of Rs 540, while those earning the maximum salary of Rs 2,50,000 could gain Rs 7,500. Pensioners, too, stand to benefit, with hikes ranging from Rs 270 to Rs 3,750 depending on their pension.FUTURE PAY REFORMS While employee unions are pushing for the establishment of the 8th Pay Commission, the government has clarified there are no immediate plans. Minister of State Pankaj Chaudhary recently confirmed in Parliament that no proposals are under review, leaving employees and retirees uncertain about future reforms. The anticipated DA hike in 2025 offers much-needed financial relief, but the delay in establishing the 8th Pay Commission underscores the growing demands for a comprehensive overhaul of the pay structure.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 27, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty rise for 2nd straight day as auto stocks rally The S&P BSE Sensex settled 226.59 points higher at 78,690.07, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.20 points to end at 23,813.40.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices continued their rally for the second straight day, supported by gains in automobile stocks. The S&P BSE Sensex settled 226.59 points higher at 78,690.07, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.20 points to end at 23,813.40. Most of the broader market indices also ended the session with gains as volatility dipped. Nifty Auto and Nifty Pharma were the top gainers among sectoral indices.  The top five gainers on the Nifty50 were Dr Reddy's, IndusInd Bank, M&M, Tata Motors and Eicher Motors. On the other hand, the top losers were Hindalco, SBI, Coal India, ONGC and BEL.  Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services, said, "The Christmas week trading ended on a subdued note; a lack of major triggers and caution ahead of the swearing of US Republican Party administration continued to impact the sentiment." "While the rupee dropped to a new low, weighed down by the expectation of fewer Fed rate cuts, a widening trade deficit, and weak economic growth. The auto index outperformed, aided by an expectation of a pickup in volumes in December and comfort in valuation," he added. Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 27, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu revives debate on 70-hour work weekZoho CEO Sridhar Vembu weighs in on the 70-hour work week debate initiated by Infosys founder Narayana Murthy. Here's his perspective.
Content:
Zoho’s CEO, Sridhar Vembu, has reignited the long-standing debate on the 70-hour work week, a notion first proposed by Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy. Vembu recently shared his thoughts in a detailed post on X. He wrote, "The rationale behind the 70-hour work week is 'it is necessary for economic development' ".
 


 IS HARD WORK THE KEY TO ECONOMIC SUCCESS? Vembu referred to the work culture in East Asian countries like Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, and China, noting that their rapid economic development was driven by intense labour. However, he pointed out that these nations now face significant demographic challenges, with plummeting birth rates leading governments to incentivise families to have children. Vembu raised two critical questions: "Is hard work necessary for economic development? Is the price of such development, in terms of a lonely old age for many, worth it". He responded to the first question by acknowledging that only a small percentage of the population needs to push themselves hard for economic growth, suggesting that 2-5% of people can drive development while the rest enjoy a balanced work-life scenario. Regarding the second question, Vembu firmly stated that it’s not worth sacrificing personal well-being and demographic stability for the sake of economic success. THE DANGERS OF OVERWORK: A CAUTIONARY TALE Vembu expressed concern over India potentially mirroring China's economic success if it leads to a similar demographic decline. He warned against pushing India’s workforce to the same extreme work culture, stating the importance of balancing productivity with quality of life. "I do believe we can develop without needing to work ourselves to demographic suicide," Vembu concluded. Narayana Murthy’s controversial advocacy for a 70-hour work week has sparked debates about the need for productivity boosts to compete globally. While some agreed with his call for more hours, others warned of burnout and its long-term effects on society. On the other hand, Vembu's stance offers a reminder that development doesn’t have to come at the cost of personal and societal well-being. Balancing economic growth with a healthy demographic future could be the way forward.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 27, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Exclusive: Firm run by Russian national dupes Rs 800 crore from Indian investorsThe ED filed a second chargesheet against Octafx India, its operating company overseas, OctaMarkets, its founder Pavel Prozorov, OctaFX CEO, who handled India operations, Anna Rudaia, and nine other individuals accused apart from a total of 41 companies and entities. Read this IndiaToday Exclusive.
Content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a chargesheet in the alleged Rs 800 crore Ponzi scheme scam orchestrated by a forex firm run by a Russian national named Pavel Prozorov.  In the last four to five years, OctaFX, a Forex trading platform, was visible everywhere on social media, from advertisements to sponsoring IPL teams. Very few, or say, no one knew that OctaFx was an elaborate long-term Ponzi scheme launched in India to dupe people of their hard-earned money.  The ED recently filed a second chargesheet against Octafx India, its operating company overseas, OctaMarkets, its founder Pavel Prozorov, OctaFX CEO, who handled India operations, Anna Rudaia, and nine other individuals accused apart from a total of 41 companies and entities. WHY IS IT AN ELABORATE PONZI SCHEME?  According to the exclusive details accessed by IndiaToday, the predicate offence, on the basis of which the ED started investigating, was an FIR filed at Shivajinagar police station in Pune in 2021, against two to three brokers and agents who had duped deaf and dumb persons with a promise of doubling their savings through forex trade at OctaFx in five months and triple it in eight months.  The investors lost huge sums in crores, following which an FIR was filed against the brokers, who are also called 'introducers' by OctaFX. With aggressive online and social media advertising promotions by hiring area-wise influencers and TV personalities, and even top Bollywood actors to promote the platform, they managed to lure numerous investors.  OctaFx employed a number of brokers who helped people invest in the platform. They were called introducers and were paid handsomely for luring people, with gifts like luxury cars, bikes, gold coins and gold bars.  The firm also organised events at 5-star hotels in Goa and invited agents and brokers and felicitated them with hefty bonus amounts and gifts at these events.  According to sources, the platform also offered to invest huge amounts of crores in cash from select customers and investors, mostly bigger introducers, whose online history showed that they had been regular. These cash amounts were collected by their agents and handed over to cash couriers and then deposited into multiple accounts of shell entities.  Once the amount invested swelled to huge proportions, the investors started losing money. Unsuspecting investors in tier-2 or tier-3 cities were mostly targeted with the help of so-called introducers where cash movement in business markets was huge.  However, the forex firm denies any wrongdoing and stresses on the companies' good track record. "Since 2011, OctaFX has established a solid reputation in the financial industry, with hundreds of thousands of satisfied clients worldwide testifying to the quality and reliability of our services. We strongly refute any claims of money laundering, false promises of exorbitant returns, or engaging in practices that disadvantage traders," a spokesperson said.  "Contrary to the allegations, we have never promised quick riches or guaranteed profits. Instead, we consistently emphasise that forex trading requires a knowledgeable and conscious approach. To support this approach, we provide comprehensive educational resources, which are publicly available on our website, YouTube channel, and the Octa app, to help clients make informed decisions," he added. Contrary to the company's claims, the recent investigations by the ED have revealed that forex trading platform OctaFx collected Rs 800 crores as proceeds of crime in just nine months of operations in India. However, the investigation is still ongoing to determine the precise amount of profit that OctaFx has earned from its operation in India. Further, the OctaFX platform frequently changed its login URLs and web addresses in a deliberate strategy to obscure fraudulent activities by investors.  "Our team actively monitors the public activity of our partners and promptly addresses any misleading statements whenever and wherever they appear. Our partners are required, under the Introducing Broker Agreement, to provide fair and transparent information about the risks involved in forex trading. Whenever any infractions occur, we immediately take action, as with the case in Pune when unscrupulous IBs misrepresented our brand," the company further stressed.  During the investigation, OctaFx fully cooperated with authorities and provided all necessary information to assist in resolving the matter, it added. The platform is also accused of manipulating trade activities, resulting in substantial net losses for investors while diverting the defrauded funds into e-wallets and accounts of fictitious entities. Moreover, OctaFx utilised fintech workers to create mule accounts linked to shell companies and fake e-commerce websites. These entities were created to obtain payment gateway access, disguising investor funds as legitimate purchases, as per details exclusively accessed by IndiaToday.  The funds were then routed abroad under the pretext of fake imports and freight services. The platform has gained traction through aggressive promotions, including sponsoring an IPL team, and engaging various production agencies for influencer marketing. Payments to these production agencies were made as foreign inward remittances, through two Estonia-based companies. Both are related entities of OctaFx and controlled by Pavel Prozorov.MODUS OPERANDI  This Forex trading platform was widely promoted on social networking sites and followed referral-based incentive models for acquiring users to their platforms. The funds were collected from users, majorly through UPI/local bank transfers and channelised through dummy entities. These funds were credited to the bank accounts of various dummy entities and domestically transferred to other banks for the purpose of layering.  The multiple accounts of different Indian banks were being shown to investors/users on the OctaFx trading app for collecting funds in the guise of facilitating forex trading. The said accumulated funds, after defrauding these investors or users, were transferred to multiple e-wallet accounts or to bank accounts of dummy entities. The entire process of reflecting account numbers of dummy entities, managing the funds collected in these accounts and diversion of the same was managed and operated by the owners of OctaFx group entities.MONEY LAUNDERING WITH HELP OF DUMMY DIRECTORS, WHO WERE INDIAN NATIONALS, AND SHELL ENTITIES   The OctaFX India operations were run through multiple mule accounts where money was deposited from investors. These accounts belonged to some entities which had Indian directors who had been tutored by OctaFX officials to verify the Know Your Customer (KYC) details whenever needed. Further to legitimate the transactions, the funds from these accounts were transferred to Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) registered funds.  To send this money or launder it overseas, they claimed an import order for the import of services and payments were done for the same when actually no such services were offered or taken and eventually the money would be laundered in crores outside the country to various tax havens or smaller European countries. ROLE OF OCTAFX GROUP FOUNDER PAVEL PROZOROV  Pavel Prozorov, Director of OctaFx India Pvt. Ltd. (now Tauga Pvt. Ltd.), is the mastermind behind OctaFx's global Forex and CFD trading operations. He orchestrated a network designed to conceal the origin of illicit funds and facilitate money laundering through shell companies.  Prozorov’s exploitation of regulatory loopholes and the establishment of dummy entities in India exemplify his calculated approach to financial deception. He utilised these entities to manipulate records, allowing funds to be transferred overseas without raising suspicion. Additionally, Prozorov directed substantial promotional campaigns targeting Indian investors, including celebrity endorsements and sponsorships, further embedding OctaFx in the market.  Prozorov's actions constituted careful layering, placement, and integration of laundered funds as Foreign Direct Investment (FDI), misrepresenting their origins.  Despite multiple summons from the ED, Prozorov evaded compliance, indicating deliberate obstruction of legal processes. His direct involvement in establishing a complex web of entities and orchestrating financial flows under Section 3 of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), as he engaged in the concealment, possession, acquisition, and use of proceeds of crime. He is also liable for punishment under Section 4 of the PMLA for his role in facilitating large-scale financial fraud and evading regulatory oversight. ED has attached some palatial properties of Pavel in Spain worth Rs 41 crores through the Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT).  However, OctaFx denied any role of Prozorov and refuted accusations of him being the 'masterming' of any fraud, saying it lacked credible evidence. "We strongly reject these unfounded accusations and will take decisive action against any attempts to tarnish our reputation," it maintained.ROLE OF FORMER OCTAFX INDIA CEO ANNA RUDAIA  Anna Rudaia, also a Russian national and former CEO of OctaFx India Pvt. Ltd., was summoned last year and her statement was recorded once by the ED, but a day later, she didn't appear despite being summoned by the agency. A Look-Out Circular has already been issued in her name, but she managed to flee the country through illegal channels and has conveyed that she is presently outside India.  Rudaia played a crucial role in managing the Indian operations linked to illicit Forex trading and money laundering activities. Under her leadership, OctaFx organised events promoting unauthorised trading, violating regulatory frameworks mandated by the Reserive Bank of India (RBI) and SEBI.  Rudaia’s involvement included overseeing marketing strategies that attracted Indian investors and channelling illicit proceeds through complex layers to disguise their origins. Despite multiple summonses from the ED, she evaded compliance and fled India, indicative of her intent to escape accountability. After her departure, Rudaia continued to manage operations remotely and facilitated the formation of M/s APAC Stock Brokerage Operations Pvt. Ltd. to continue OctaFx’s activities under a different guise.  Rudaia's actions directly contributed to the laundering of proceeds of crime, fulfilling the requirements of Section 3 of the PMLA through the concealment, possession, acquisition, and use of illicit funds. Based on the evidence, Rudaia is implicated under Sections 3 and 4 of the PMLA for her active participation in promoting illegal Forex trading and laundering activities.ED CHARGESHEET AND ATTACHMENTS IN THE CASE  ED Mumbai had earlier filed a Prosecution Complaint (PC) against OctaFx and its associated entities under the provisions of the PMLA before the Special Court (PMLA), Mumbai on October 1 and a supplementary Prosecution Complaint on December 20. They took note of the prosecution complaint and supplementary prosecution complaint on December 24. The ED has conducted extensive search proceedings and has so far attached and seized assets worth approximately Rs 165 crore, including attachment of 19 immovable properties located in Spain. These properties are owned by the prime accused, Pavel Prozorov. ED officials said that further investigation in the alleged scam is underway.Published By: Vivek Published On: Dec 29, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Stocks to watch today: Ola Electric, Hero MotoCorp, JSW Energy, Reliance PowerSeveral stocks are in the spotlight due to key developments, such as Reliance Power, Ola Electric, Hero MotoCorp, JSW Energy, etc.
Content: The stock market witnessed consolidation last week, as investors remained cautious amid persistent selling by Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) and muted global cues during the year-end festive season. Today, several stocks are in the spotlight due to key developments such as Reliance Power, Ola Electric, Hero MotoCorp, JSW Energy, etc. RELIANCE POWER  Reliance Power Ltd's shares will be in focus on Monday morning following an announcement by the company. Its subsidiary, Rosa Power Supply Company, disclosed to stock exchanges BSE and NSE that it had finalised definitive agreements on December 27. These agreements pertain to securing a rupee term loan of up to Rs 3,760 crore from Power Finance Corporation Ltd (PFC). The loan will be disbursed in one or more tranches, contingent on the fulfilment of standard preconditions.advertisementOLA ELECTRIC Ola Electric has seen key resignations with Chief Marketing Officer Anshul Khandelwal and Chief Technology and Product Officer Suvonil Chatterjee stepping down, effective December 27. These exits may raise concerns and affect investor sentiment. ASTRAZENECA INDIA AstraZeneca India, the Indian subsidiary of the UK-based pharmaceutical company, has reportedly laid off over 125 employees from its biopharmaceutical business unit. This comes as part of restructuring efforts, according to a report by ET. Investors will be closely watching how this move impacts the company’s operational efficiency and stock performance.ALKYL AMINES Alkyl Amines reported a rupture in a residue tank at its derivatives plant located in Kurkumbh, Maharashtra, on December 28. While the company has not disclosed the financial impact, any production disruptions may influence its stock in the short term.IL&FS ENGINEERING IL&FS Engineering announced securing a Rs 302.82 crore project for Bhubaneswar Metro Phase-I. The contract, awarded by Ceigall India, could provide a boost to the company’s revenue and improve investor sentiment.SJVN SJVN has appointed Sanjay Kumar as its Chief Financial Officer (CFO), effective January 1, 2025. The leadership change comes at a time when the company is focusing on expanding its renewable energy portfolio.CAMS The Chief Technology Officer (CTO) of CAMS, Pullakurthi Srinivasa Reddy, has resigned with effect from December 27. This development may prompt investors to evaluate the company’s ongoing technological advancements and overall management strength.IOL CHEMICALS IOL Chemicals’ board has approved a stock split in the ratio of 1:5. This means each share will be subdivided into five shares. Stock splits are often aimed at improving liquidity and making the stock more affordable for retail investors.JSW ENERGY JSW Energy’s subsidiary, JSW Neo Energy, has signed an agreement to acquire O2 Power Midco Holdings Pte and O2 Energy SG Pte for $1.47 billion. The acquisition aligns with JSW Energy’s push into renewable energy and could positively impact its future growth prospects.UTKARSH SFB Utkarsh Small Finance Bank has approved the sale of non-performing assets (NPA) and written-off loans to an Asset Reconstruction Company (ARC). This includes stressed microfinance loans worth Rs 355 crore, a move aimed at cleaning up its balance sheet.HERO MOTOCORP Hero MotoCorp has extended its partnership with Harley-Davidson. The company plans to introduce new variants of the Harley-Davidson X440 and jointly develop a new motorcycle. This collaboration is expected to strengthen Hero MotoCorp’s presence in the premium motorcycle segment.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty start week lower; Adani Enterprises gain 3% in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 76.67 points to 78,623.40, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 35.25 points to 23,778.15 as of 9:23 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened marginally lower on Monday, dragged by a decline in auto, metal and energy sector stocks in early trade. Adani Enterprises gained over 2% in early trade.  The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 76.67 points to 78,623.40, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 35.25 points to 23,778.15 as of 9:23 AM.  Dr V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said the biggest concern for stock markets, globally, is uncertainty surrounding Trump 2.0.  The concern is that, since market valuations are high, any negative news might cause corrections. "The resilience of the US economy continues to surprise. The lower-than-expected jobless claims have pushed the US 10-year bond yield to 4.62%. This will be a headwind for stock markets globally and particularly for emerging markets where FIIs might continue to sell. Risk-free yield of 4.62% from the safest asset class in the world will continue to lure FIIs to sell in emerging markets like India and move the money to US bonds.In the recent market correction in India, IT and banking stocks have remained reasonably resilient, primarily due to their fair valuations. Investors should exercise caution as we move into the uncertainties of the New Year," he added.  Adani Enterprises Limited led the gainers on Nifty50 in early trade with a rise of 2.73%, followed by Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone which gained 1.47%. Apollo Hospitals Enterprise advanced 0.94%, while Shriram Finance Limited added 0.62%, and Bharti Airtel rounded out the top gainers with a 0.43% increase. On the declining side, Trent Limited led the losses with a drop of 1.32%, followed by Infosys which fell 0.84%. Mahindra & Mahindra declined 0.83%, while Titan Company slipped 0.79%, and JSW Steel Limited decreased by 0.72%. Nifty Auto dropped 0.56% seeing the biggest fall among sectoral indices in early trade. Nifty Oil & Gas fell 0.49%, followed by Nifty Media, which saw a decline of 0.45%. Nifty Metal declined 0.25%. Nifty Midsmall Financial Services decreased by 0.22%, and Nifty Consumer Durables fell 0.20%. Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom slipped 0.19%, Nifty IT declined 0.30%, Nifty PSU Bank lost 0.08%, and Nifty Private Bank edged down 0.02%. Nifty Bank declined 0.06%, while Nifty Pharma showed a marginal decline of 0.01%. On the positive side, Nifty FMCG led the gains with a 0.11% increase, followed by Nifty Financial Services 25/50 which rose 0.10%. Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank and Nifty Healthcare Index both gained 0.05%, while Nifty Financial Services added 0.03%. Nifty Midsmall Healthcare increased by 0.03%, and Nifty Realty showed a modest gain of 0.02%.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Vodafone Idea shares in focus today: 2 things to know about the telecom stockVodafone Idea shares closed at Rs 7.49 on Friday, down 0.93%. The stock has fallen 56% so far in 2024.
Content: Shares of Vodafone Idea Ltd (VIL) will be in the spotlight in Monday's trading session following two huge developments. The telecom operator has received a letter from the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) regarding a waiver on bank guarantees. Additionally, Vodafone Group, a promoter entity, has settled Rs 11,650 crore of its outstanding dues, releasing pledged shares in Vodafone Idea. Vodafone Idea shares closed at Rs 7.49 on Friday, down 0.93%. The stock has fallen 56% so far in 2024.advertisementBANK GUARANTEE WAIVER Vodafone Idea informed the stock exchanges that the DoT, in a communication dated 27 December 2024, has waived the requirement for Financial Bank Guarantees (FBGs) for spectrum acquired in auctions held in 2012, 2014, 2015, 2016, and 2021. However, this waiver is subject to certain terms and conditions. Before this decision, Vodafone Idea was required to provide bank guarantees worth Rs 24,800 crore for spectrum instalments. These guarantees had to be submitted 13 months before the instalments became due. According to Vodafone Idea, it will no longer need to provide bank guarantees for the auctions held in 2012, 2014, 2016, and 2021. However, a one-time partial shortfall will remain for the 2015 auction, where the net present value (NPV) of all payments made so far is less than the pro-rated value of spectrum used. Vodafone Idea is currently discussing the final amount of this shortfall with the DoT.VODAFONE GROUP SETTLEMENT In a separate development, Vodafone Group has settled Rs 11,650 crore of outstanding dues secured against its shares in Vodafone Idea. These dues were owed by the group's Mauritius and India-based entities, with the pledge held by HSBC Corporate Trustee Company (UK). According to a regulatory filing, the settlement has resulted in the release of a pledge on 15.72 billion shares held by Vodafone Promoter Shareholders. This accounts for 22.56% of Vodafone Idea’s equity capital on a fully diluted basis.TARIFF HIKE AND FINANCIAL OUTLOOK Vodafone Idea recently implemented a tariff hike, which has slightly increased its average revenue per user (ARPU). However, revenue growth remains marginal. The company expects the impact of the tariff hike to reflect in its ARPU and revenue figures over the next two quarters. Geojit Financial Services noted that Vodafone Idea anticipates subscriber growth driven by the expansion of its 4G coverage and the rollout of 5G services in key regions starting from Q4FY25. Additionally, the telecom operator’s fundraising efforts through equity issuance or convertible securities are expected to support its expansion plans and help reduce debt. Geojit Financial has maintained a "Hold" rating on Vodafone Idea’s stock, with a revised target price of Rs 8.60, based on 11.9 times FY26 estimated EV/Ebitda.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024

Headline: Ventive Hospitality, Carraro: GMPs of 2 IPOs ahead of D-Street debut todayAllotment of shares for the IPOs of Ventive Hospitality and Carraro was completed on December 26, 2024.
Content: Ventive Hospitality and Carraro India are set to make their debut on the stock exchanges on Monday after garnerbing decent responses from investors. The two companies collectively raised over Rs 2,800 crore through their initial public offerings (IPOs), which opened for subscription on December 20 and closed on December 24. Allotment of shares for the IPOs of Ventive Hospitality and Carraro was completed on December 26, 2024. advertisementVENTIVE HOSPITALITY Ventive Hospitality, offered its shares in the price range of Rs 610-643 per share. Investors were required to apply for a minimum of 23 shares or in multiples thereof. The IPO was entirely a fresh issue of 2,48,83,358 equity shares, enabling the company to raise Rs 1,600 crore. The IPO garnered decent interest, with overall subscription levels reaching 9.80 times. Retail investors and qualified institutional buyers showed strong demand for the shares. In the grey market, Ventive Hospitality's premium (GMP) has experienced a slight dip in recent days. After peaking at Rs 85 following the allotment of shares, the GMP settled at Rs 70, indicating a potential listing gain of over 10% for investors. The company plans to use the proceeds from the IPO to expand its operations, repay certain debts, and invest in technology to enhance customer experience.CARRARO INDIA Carraro India, also based in Pune, offered its shares in the price band of Rs 668-704 per share. The minimum lot size for this IPO was 21 shares. Unlike Ventive Hospitality, the Carraro India IPO was entirely an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 1,77,55,680 equity shares, raising Rs 1,250 crore. The IPO received a muted response from investors, with overall subscriptions reaching just 1.12 times. Most of the demand came at the last minute, driven by institutional investors. Retail and high-net-worth individual (HNI) participation was relatively weak. Carraro India's grey market premium has been negligible throughout the IPO process. The GMP remained at zero even after the allotment, suggesting that the stock might list at or near its issue price. Proceeds from the offer-for-sale will not go to the company but will benefit the selling shareholders.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO listing: Does GMP suggest strong market debut? Senores Pharmaceuticals share price: The IPO got a very strong response during its three-day bidding period from December 20 to December 24.
Content: Senores Pharmaceuticals shares are set to make their market debut on Monday after the allotment was finalised on December 26, 2024.  Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO got a very strong response during its three-day bidding period from December 20 to December 24. The price band for the IPO was set between Rs 372 and Rs 391 per share, with a minimum lot size of 38 shares. Retail investors needed to invest at least Rs 14,876 to participate in the issue. The public offering was subscribed an impressive 97.86 times overall. The portion reserved for qualified institutional buyers (QIBs) saw 97.84 times the subscription, while the non-institutional investors (NIIs) segment was booked 100.35 times. Retail investors subscribed 93.16 times, and employees accounted for 19.92 times.  Several brokerages, including Anand Rathi, Canara Bank Securities, SBI Securities, gave a positive outlook on the IPO, citing the company’s strong financial performance and growth potential.GREY MARKET PREMIUM (GMP) Senores Pharmaceuticals has been performing well in the grey market, and has surged just before its market debut.  The IPO was commanding a premium of Rs 284 in the unofficial market as of December 30, 05:04 AM. Based on the upper price band of Rs 391, this indicates a potential listing price of Rs 675, suggesting a gain of around 72.63% for investors. The GMP has remained stable, reflecting strong investor interest. Incorporated in December 2017, Senores Pharmaceuticals specialises in developing and manufacturing pharmaceutical products for highly regulated markets such as the US, Canada, and the UK. The company also supplies to emerging markets and has launched 55 products in key therapeutic areas like antibiotics and anti-fungal treatments as of September 30, 2024.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024

Headline: Ventive Hospitality share price lists at Rs 718.15 on BSE at 12% premium Ventive Hospitality listing: On the National Stock Exchange (NSE), the stock opened at Rs 716, reflecting an 11.35% premium.
Content: Shares of Ventive Hospitality made a decent debut on the stock exchanges on Monday, listing at Rs 718.15 on the BSE, which is 12% higher than the IPO issue price of Rs 643. On the NSE, the stock opened at Rs 716, reflecting an 11.35% premium. The allotment of shares for Ventive Hospitality's IPO was finalised on December 26, 2024. The IPO, which closed on December 24, witnessed good demand from investors, with an overall subscription of 10.33 times. Retail investors subscribed 6.19 times the shares allocated to them, while qualified institutional buyers showed solid interest with 9.58 times subscription. Non-institutional investors displayed the highest enthusiasm, subscribing to 14.6 times the shares reserved for them. The Rs 1,600 crore public offering was open for bidding from December 20 to December 24. The company offered shares in a price range of Rs 610-643 each, with investors required to bid for a minimum of 23 shares. The grey market premium (GMP) for Ventive Hospitality was recorded at Rs 80 before the listing, indicating a possible premium of 12.44% over the issue price of Rs 643. This closely aligned with the actual listing price on the exchanges. The entire Rs 1,600 crore raised through the IPO came from the fresh issuance of equity shares. The company has stated that the funds will be used primarily to repay debt, including the accrued interest. There was no offer-for-sale component in the IPO. Ventive Hospitality, formerly known as ICC Realty, is a joint venture between the US-based Blackstone Group and Pune-based Panchshil Realty. Panchshil holds a 60% stake in the company, while Blackstone owns the remaining 40%. The company focuses on owning hospitality assets in India and the Maldives, catering to the luxury and upscale segments in both business and leisure markets. As of September 2024, Ventive Hospitality’s portfolio includes 11 operational properties, with a total of 2,036 keys across luxury, upper upscale, and upscale categories. All the properties are managed or franchised by renowned global hospitality brands such as Marriott, Hilton, Minor, and Atmosphere.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024

Incorporated in December 2017, Senores Pharmaceuticals specialises in developing and manufacturing pharmaceutical products for highly regulated markets such as the US, Canada, and the UK. The company also supplies to emerging markets and has launched 55 products in key therapeutic areas like antibiotics and anti-fungal treatments as of September 30, 2024Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024

Headline: JSW Energy share price gains 6%. Why are brokerages bullish on the stock? JSW Energy stock: Brokerages are bullish on the shares of JSW Energy after the company's wholly-owned subsidiary, JSW Neo Energy signed a major deal.
Content:
Shares of JSW Energy jumped by over 6% in early trade on December 30 after the company’s wholly-owned subsidiary, JSW Neo Energy, signed a definitive agreement to acquire O2 Power. O2 Power is a renewable energy platform set up by Swedish asset manager EQT Partners and Singapore’s Temasek Holdings. The acquisition, valued at Rs 12,468 crore ($1.47 billion) after adjusting for net current assets, has been positively received by market experts, who see it as a strong step towards enhancing JSW Energy’s renewable energy portfolio and boosting its future growth prospects. O2 Power is a big player in the renewable energy sector with a total capacity of 4,696 MW. Of this, 2,259 MW is expected to be operational by June 2025, while 1,463 MW is under construction. Additionally, 974 MW is in the pipeline, targeted for completion by June 2027. The assets are spread across seven resource-rich states in India and have a tariff of Rs 3.37 per kilowatt hour (KWh). The facilities have an average remaining life of 23 years, which adds long-term value to JSW Energy’s portfolio. This acquisition increases JSW Energy’s locked-in generation capacity by 23% to 24,708 MW, bringing the company closer to its target of reaching 25 GW capacity by FY27/28. Following the announcement, JSW Energy shares were trading at Rs 663.3, up 6% compared to the previous session’s closing price of Rs 629.85 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE). The company’s market capitalisation now stands at Rs 1.09 lakh crore. Over the last year, JSW Energy's stock has climbed by 53%, reflecting the company’s efforts to expand its renewable energy portfolio and strengthen its market position. Several brokerage firms have praised the acquisition and shared optimistic outlooks for JSW Energy. Global brokerage Investec highlighted the deal as a major step for JSW Energy, as it significantly enhances the company's renewable energy capabilities. Investec noted that the transaction includes approximately 2.4 GW of operational assets with an estimated run-rate EBITDA of Rs 1,500 crore. However, the brokerage retained a "hold" rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 675 per share. Domestic brokerage Motilal Oswal reiterated its "buy" recommendation for JSW Energy, raising the target price to Rs 810 per share. It emphasised that acquiring 4.7 GW of high-quality renewable assets at a valuation of 7x EV/EBITDA is favourable, especially when compared to listed renewable energy companies that trade at nearly 15x EV/EBITDA. Motilal Oswal highlighted key positives from the deal:
O2 Power’s competitive interest cost of 8.8% aligns well with JSW Energy’s financial strategy.
O2 Power’s receivable days stand at 43, significantly lower than JSW Energy’s 68 days.
A majority (87%) of O2 Power’s portfolio is secured by utilities such as SECI, NTPC, and SJVN, while the remainder is backed by highly rated commercial and industrial issuers.
The portfolio is diversified across solar, wind, and niche renewable segments.
 Before the acquisition news, JSW Energy shares had closed 1% lower at Rs 629.85 on December 27. Despite this, the company’s stock has delivered strong returns over the past year, gaining 53%.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024

Headline: Explained: Why DAM Capital share price fell over 7% todayDAM Capital stock price: The sell-off is attributed to profit booking, a common trend after sharp initial gains. Analysts had previously offered mixed views on the company's shares.
Content: Shares of DAM Capital Advisors fell 7.35% to Rs 384.60 during early trade on Monday, following profit booking by some retail investors after its stellar stock market listing on Friday.  The company's shares had listed at a premium of nearly 39% over its issue price of Rs 283 per share. It may be noted that the stock made its debut at Rs 393 on the NSE, reflecting a 38.87% premium, while it debuted at Rs 392.90 on the BSE, showcasing a 38.83% premium. The listing gains aligned with market expectations, as analysts and the grey market premium (GMP) had predicted a 40-50% premium fuelled by strong demand and positive sentiment.PROFIT BOOKING AFTER BUMPER LISTING The sell-off on Monday is being attributed to profit booking, a common trend after sharp initial gains. Analysts had previously offered mixed views on the company’s shares, highlighting both its strong market positioning and potential valuation concerns. Prashanth Tapse, Senior Vice President (Research) at Mehta Equities, attributed the robust listing gains to reasonable valuations and positive market sentiment. He advised conservative investors to book profits on higher-than-expected returns, while suggesting long-term investors prepared for volatility could continue holding their shares. Shivani Nyati, Head of Wealth at Swastika Investmart, pointed out DAM Capital’s strong growth in investment banking services, including equity capital markets, mergers and acquisitions, and private equity advisory. She also emphasized the company’s fully priced valuation, recommending partial profit booking and a stop-loss strategy at â‚¹390. DAM Capital Advisors holds a 12.1% market share in IPOs and QIPs as of FY24, underscoring its strong market presence. The company’s solid debut has reinforced its position as a prominent player in India’s equity markets. However, analysts advise investors to carefully evaluate the company’s long-term performance and broader market conditions before making further investment decisions, especially following Monday’s pullback. Despite the dip, DAM Capital’s strong fundamentals and market positioning continue to attract interest from both retail and institutional investorsPublished By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 30, 2024

Headline: Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens tomorrow: Check GMP, price band, key datesIndo Farm Equipment IPO: The price band is fixed at Rs 204-215 per share, with a lot size of 69 shares. The issue will close on Thursday, January 2.
Content: The Indo Farm Equipment IPO is set to open for subscription on Tuesday offering investors a chance to participate in the growth story of a well-established agricultural equipment manufacturer. The IPO price band is fixed at Rs 204-215 per share, with a lot size of 69 shares. The issue will close on Thursday, January 2.LATEST GMP The grey market premium (GMP) for Indo Farm Equipment IPO is currently at Rs 80, suggesting a listing price of Rs 295, which is 37.21% above the upper end of the price band.  The GMP has shown a slight downward trend over the past few sessions.IMPORTANT IPO DETAILS The IPO comprises a fresh issue of 8.6 million equity shares and an offer for sale (OFS) of up to 3.5 million shares by promoter Ranbir Singh Khadwalia. The company aims to raise funds to expand its production capacity for Pick & Carry Cranes, repay specific loans, and invest in its NBFC subsidiary, Barota Finance. The remaining funds will be allocated for general corporate purposes.COMPANY FINANCIALS Indo Farm Equipment reported a total income of â‚¹3,759.53 million in FY24, with a profit after tax of â‚¹155.95 million. Over the past three years, the company has maintained steady growth, reflecting its position as a profit-generating entity with over two decades of operational experience.LISTING AND ALLOTMENT DATES The IPO has reserved 50% of the shares for qualified institutional buyers, 15% for non-institutional investors, and 35% for retail investors. Allotments will be finalised on Friday, January 3, with shares credited to demat accounts on Monday, January 6. The listing is scheduled for Tuesday, January 7, on the NSE and BSE.WHAT DOES THE COMPANY DO? The company’s facilities include advanced equipment like induction furnaces, automated molding lines, and a metallurgy laboratory, underscoring its robust manufacturing capabilities. Indo Farm Equipment also manufactures tractors, cranes, and agricultural machinery like harvester combines and rotavators.COMPARISON WITH PEERS In terms of valuation, the company's listed peers include Escorts Kubota (P/E 36.79) and Action Construction Equipment (P/E 47.42). Analysts believe Indo Farm Equipment's consistent financial performance positions it as an attractive investment opportunity.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 30, 2024

Headline: Carraro India share listing: Stock list at Rs 660 vs IPO price of Rs 704Carraro India share price: On the NSE, the shares began trading at Rs 651, a discount of Rs 53 or 7.53%.
Content: Carraro India made a muted debut on the stock exchanges as its shares listed at a discount on the Dalal Street. The stock opened at Rs 660 on the BSE, down by Rs 44 or 6.25% compared to its upper IPO price of Rs 704. On the NSE, the shares began trading at Rs 651, a discount of Rs 53 or 7.53%. After the initial listing, Carraro India's share price showed some recovery, climbing to an intraday high of Rs 682 on both exchanges. However, the stock failed to sustain the gains and slipped below its opening levels. As of 10:04 AM, the share price was Rs 636.75 on the BSE and Rs 640.75 on the NSE. The IPO of Carraro India was open for subscription from December 20 to December 24, 2024. By the close of bidding, the IPO had been subscribed only 1.12 times. The segment reserved for qualified institutional buyers (QIBs) was subscribed 2.21 times, while the retail individual investor (RII) category saw a subscription rate of 71%. Non-institutional investors (NIIs) subscribed to 60% of their reserved portion. Carraro India offered its shares at a price band of Rs 668-704 per share. The company reserved not more than 50% of the public issue for QIBs, not less than 15% for NIIs, and at least 35% for retail investors. Founded in 1997, Carraro India Ltd specialises in manufacturing components for industrial and agricultural machinery. The company produces a wide range of products, from small gears to fully assembled tractors, catering to both domestic and international markets. According to the red herring prospectus (RHP), Carraro India competes with several listed peers, including Escorts Kubota, which has a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 43.21, Schaeffler India at 74.22, Sona BLW Precision Forgings at 76.93, Ramakrishna Forgings at 42.82, Happy Forgings at 47.08, and Action Construction Equipment at 50.56. The book-running lead managers for Carraro India's IPO were Axis Bank Limited, BNP Paribas, and Nuvama Wealth Management Limited. Link Intime India Private Ltd acted as the registrar for the issue.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024

Headline: Unimech Aerospace IPO listing: Check latest GMP and share price predictionUnimech Aerospace IPO listing: In the grey market, Unimech Aerospace shares are commanding a robust premium of Rs 715, reflecting strong demand.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Unimech Aerospace and Manufacturing Limited garnered an overwhelming response, with a subscription rate of 174.93 times by the final day of bidding.  The three-day window for the IPO, open from December 23 to December 26, saw substantial interest from various investor categories. The issue was subscribed 317.63 times by qualified institutional buyers (QIBs), 263.40 times by non-institutional investors (NIIs), and 56.16 times by retail investors.advertisementLATEST GMP AND LISTING PRICE PREDICTION In the grey market, Unimech Aerospace shares are commanding a robust premium of Rs 715, reflecting strong demand. This indicates a potential listing price of around Rs 1,500 per share, combining the upper price band of Rs 785 with the grey market premium. Such a listing would represent a gain of more than 90% over the issue price. The grey market premium (GMP) often serves as an early indicator of investor sentiment and can hint at the stock's potential performance on its debut day. However, it’s essential to note that GMP trends may not always translate directly into actual listing performance, as broader market dynamics also play a role. Headline: ITR filing simplified: 5 updates you should knowUpdated tax rules, including pre-filled forms and flexible return filing, aim to reduce errors and ensure seamless compliance for taxpayers.
Content: Filing income tax returns often feels like a daunting task, but recent changes in tax rules aim to turn this challenge into a smoother experience. With enhanced transparency, simplified processes, and increased flexibility, taxpayers now have more tools at their disposal to file returns accurately and efficiently. Whether it’s the revamped Form 26AS or the introduction of pre-filled ITRs, these updates are designed to make compliance less stressful. Let’s explore five key changes that are making tax filing easier than ever.ENHANCED TRANSPARENCY WITH FORM 26AS The revamped Form 26AS now offers taxpayers a detailed view of their tax transactions. It includes tax deductions, collections, payment details, demands, refunds, and specified financial transactions (SFTs). This transparency helps taxpayers monitor their financial activities, ensuring accurate income disclosure.PRE-FILLED ITRS FOR HASSLE-FREE FILING Pre-filled ITRs now ease the process by automatically populating data like salary income, bank interest, and dividends. This reduces manual effort, minimises errors, and makes tax filing more efficient for individuals.FILING FLEXIBILITY WITH UPDATED RETURNS Under Section 139(8A) of the Income-tax Act, taxpayers can file updated returns within two years of the relevant assessment year. This allows individuals to voluntarily correct mistakes or omissions by paying additional taxes. The e-verification scheme also streamlines reporting of unreported income.SIMPLIFIED PERSONAL TAX REGIME The alternative tax regime, introduced in 2020 and further refined in 2024, offers lower tax slabs for those who opt to forgo specific exemptions and incentives. This aims to make the tax structure more straightforward for individual taxpayers.EXPANDED SCOPE OF TDS AND TCS The tax base has widened with the inclusion of transactions like large cash withdrawals, luxury car purchases, foreign remittances, e-commerce sales, and virtual asset transfers under TDS (tax deducted at source) and TCS (tax collected at source). This ensures greater compliance and accountability. These reforms make tax compliance more seamless and transparent, empowering taxpayers with tools and options to stay on track with their filings while reducing complexities in the process.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 30, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: When was the last major income tax relief given? The last Union Budget did not make changes to the old tax regime but introduced modifications to the new tax regime to make it more appealing.
Content: The Union Budget 2025 is scheduled to be presented on February 1, 2025 as expectations are high among salaried individuals for income tax relief. Rising inflation and the increased cost of living have led to hopes that the government will announce measures to ease the financial burden on taxpayers. Economists have also called on the government to cut income tax rates and implement reforms to boost savings and economic growth in the Union Budget 2025, as per media reports. During a pre-budget meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, experts discussed ways to address economic challenges. A key suggestion was reducing income tax rates, as it could raise disposable income, encourage savings, and stimulate spending on essentials, potentially reviving demand in sectors hit by sluggish consumption. The last Union Budget did not make changes to the old tax regime but introduced modifications to the new tax regime to make it more appealing. Two income tax slabs were widened, and the standard deduction under the new regime was raised from Rs 50,000 to Rs 75,000. The standard deduction is a fixed amount subtracted from taxable salary income, helping employees manage common work-related expenses. India first abolished the standard deduction in 2005, which previously allowed employees to deduct Rs 30,000 or 40% of their salary, depending on income levels. It was reinstated in Budget 2018 at Rs 40,000, then increased to Rs 50,000 in the interim Budget 2019. In the 2023 Budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman expanded the scope of the standard deduction. Individual taxpayers in the new tax regime could claim Rs 50,000, while family pensioners could deduct up to Rs 15,000. Salaried individuals earning Rs 15.5 lakh or more received a tax benefit of Rs 52,500.PREVIOUS MAJOR INCOME TAX RELIEF Ajinkya Gunjan Mishra, Tax Partner at S&R Associates said, “The last significant income tax relief for individual taxpayers was announced in the Union Budget for the financial year 2020-21, which introduced a new and optional personal income tax regime.” This optional regime introduced lower tax rates but required taxpayers to forgo common exemptions and deductions, such as those under Sections 80C and 80D. Mishra explained that the primary goal was to simplify the tax system and provide relief to middle-income earners. Mishra added, “The introduction of reduced tax rates under the optional regime has particularly benefited middle-income taxpayers who do not claim deductions or exemptions.” He also noted that India’s income tax structure is moderate compared to global standards. For instance, India’s basic exemption limit of Rs 3.5 lakh is lower than Singapore’s Rs 6-7 lakh equivalent but higher than many European nations. Dipesh Jain, Partner at Economic Laws Practice, highlighted that the Finance Act 2024 brought additional relief for taxpayers. Jain said, “The new tax regime expanded the basic tax-free income slab limits, reduced tax rates at certain income levels, and increased the standard deduction from Rs 50,000 to Rs 75,000.” Another major change was the reduction in the long-term capital gains tax rate from 20% to 12.5%. However, Jain said, “This change may not always be beneficial due to the removal of the indexation clause, which in some cases increases the tax burden.” Both Mishra and Jain agreed that these tax changes have positively impacted disposable income and consumer spending. The simplified options under the new tax regime have increased liquidity for middle-class taxpayers, enhancing their purchasing power. India’s top marginal tax rate under the new tax regime is 39%, which is in line with global averages. For comparison, the UK has a top tax rate of 45%, while the US imposes up to 37%. Countries like Australia, Germany, and Japan also have top rates of around 45%. “To increase purchasing power and boost the economy, the government could consider rationalising effective tax rates along with other measures," said Jain. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Stock markets in 2025: What's next for Sensex and Nifty in the new year?Can Indian equities continue their upward climb, or will a mix of global and domestic hurdles create a rocky road ahead? Here is all you need to know.
Content: As the curtains close on 2024, Dalal Street reflects on a year of steady gains and record-breaking moments. The Sensex climbed 8.24% while the Nifty rose 8.84%, with both indices reaching historic peaks—Sensex touching 85,978 and Nifty scaling 26,277 on September 27. Despite the milestones, the journey wasn’t without hurdles. Now, as 2025 approaches, all eyes are on what’s next. Can Indian equities continue their upward climb, or will a mix of global and domestic hurdles create a rocky road ahead? Experts believe the year could bring fresh opportunities for investors, thanks to policy shifts, government spending, and innovation-driven growth across key sectors. "Indian equities were buoyant amidst a challenging and eventful year with higher volatility. The markets were volatile with multiple global events, a slowdown in the Indian economy, tighter liquidity conditions and delayed government spending," notes Deepak Ramaraju, Senior Fund Manager at Shriram AMC. However, recent policy changes could set a positive tone for the coming year. Ramaraju points out that "a recent cut in CRR is expected to ease the liquidity conditions followed by a pickup in government spending. These two factors are expected to improve overall consumption and pickup in industrial output." The focus in 2025 will likely shift to several key sectors. According to Ramaraju, "The stock market in 2025 is set to ride on strong economic growth and government efforts to boost infrastructure and digital innovation. Sectors like capital goods, technology, financial services, consumption, and healthcare are expected to shine, with emerging areas such as semiconductors, electronic and manufacturing, renewable energy and electric mobility grabbing more attention." Government spending will play a crucial role in market movement. Capital expenditure until October 2024 stood at Rs 4,66,545 crores, representing only 42% of the budgeted Rs 11,11,111 crore for FY25. This slower pace of spending compared to the previous year suggests potential for increased activity in the latter half. Looking at global factors, Neeraj Chadawar, Head of Research at Axis Securities, identifies key areas to watch: "The market will closely monitor the global developments around the following events: 1) Policies in the US government during the Trump presidency, 2) Trade policy, 3) Further rate cut by the US FED in 2025, and 4) The direction of Currency and Oil prices in 2025." On the domestic front, Chadawar expects market volatility to continue, particularly in the first half of 2025. "These events are expected to keep the Indian equity market volatile, and it could respond in either direction based on the developments. However, we expect the first half of 2025 to be more volatile. More concrete developments are expected in the second half." The investment approach for 2025 might need to be more calculated. As Chadawar suggests, "With current valuations offering limited scope for further expansion, an increase in corporate earnings will be the primary driver of the market returns moving forward. Hence, bottom-up stock picking with a focus on 'Growth at a Reasonable Price' and 'Quality' would be keys to generating satisfactory returns in the next one year." While opportunities exist across sectors, investors might need to maintain a balanced approach, considering both the growth potential and associated risks in what promises to be an eventful year for stock markets. Headline: Are fixed deposits still the best bet for Indian investors?Fixed deposits are safe but face risks like limited protection, reinvestment challenges, and low post-tax real returns.
Content: Fixed deposits (FDs) have long been a preferred investment option for Indians, offering a sense of security, especially with public sector banks. Despite the rising popularity of mutual funds and equities, nearly 15% of household savings still find their way into FDs. However, the perceived safety of FDs comes with its share of risks and limitations that investors must consider before making decisions.advertisementTHE REALITY OF SAFETY AND RISKSThe Indian banking system is well-regulated, fostering confidence in the safety of bank FDs. However, regulatory protection is limited to Rs 5 lakh per person per bank under RBI guidelines. Deposits exceeding this limit are theoretically at risk. The Indian banking system is well-regulated, fostering confidence in the safety of bank FDs. However, regulatory protection is limited to Rs 5 lakh per person per bank under RBI guidelines. Deposits exceeding this limit are theoretically at risk. FDs with PSU banks are considered the safest, followed by private scheduled banks and small finance banks, which offer higher interest rates but carry greater risks. Instances like the moratoriums on Yes Bank and Global Trust Bank serve as cautionary tales. Similarly, corporate FDs demand careful scrutiny of credit ratings, reputation, and lock-in periods to avoid defaults.RETURNS THAT BARELY KEEP UP While FDs provide fixed interest rates, their real returns often fail to keep pace with inflation and taxes. For example, an 8% return on an FD for a high-income individual can shrink to a post-tax yield of 4.88%, which, when adjusted for 6% inflation, results in negative real returns. This scenario is even worse for ultra-high-net-worth individuals. Additionally, FDs lack the compounding advantage of equity mutual funds or stocks, where returns are taxed only upon realisation, allowing for wealth accumulation over time.CHOOSE WISELY FOR WEALTH CREATION  While FDs offer a safe harbour, their limited growth potential makes them unsuitable for long-term wealth creation. Investments in equity-oriented products, when held for 7–10 years, tend to mitigate risks and provide significantly higher returns. Safety, though important, should not come at the cost of wealth erosion. By understanding the hidden risks of FDs, investors can make informed choices, balancing security and growth for a financially prosperous future.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 30, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Stock market in January 2025: Will investors face a tough start to the year? Historically, January has often been a challenging month for equity markets, with the NSE Nifty 50 index recording losses in 13 out of the past 20 years.
Content: Stock markets have seen a downward trend in the latter part of December 2024 and Dalal Street's performance in January 2025 is under close watch as a series of major global and domestic events are expected to influence investor sentiment. Historically, January has often been a challenging month for equity markets, with the NSE Nifty 50 index recording losses in 13 out of the past 20 years. Since 2019, the index has experienced a losing streak in January for six consecutive years. Adding to the uncertainty, the swearing-in of Donald Trump as the US president on January 20 is anticipated to impact global markets. Meanwhile, the US Federal Reserve’s potential delay in rate cuts and India’s Union Budget, set to be announced on February 1, are key factors that could shape market dynamics.INVESTOR CAUTION AHEAD OF MAJOR EVENTS Market experts are advising caution for January 2025, given the confluence of global and domestic events. Jathin Kaithavalappil, Assistant Vice President at Choice Broking, said, “Domestic equity markets are expected to be cautious in Q1FY2025. The domestic Union Budget: fiscal measures to be released for the year on February 1, 2025, and the unemployment reports out of the US, as they almost always signal winds of changing trends in inflation in the USA. Finally, creeping inflation in our country in different areas will certainly be one of the issues.” G Chokkalingam, Founder of Equinomics Research, expects a weak start to 2025 for Indian markets. “A weak rupee, possible delay in aggressive rate cuts by the US Fed, and the forthcoming Budget would delay the return of FIIs’ investments in Indian equity,” he said. Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) poured Rs 3,459 crore into equities in 2024 until December 26, but they offloaded over Rs 1.15 lakh crore worth of shares in October and November. This follows significant buying activity in 2023, during which FIIs invested Rs 1.71 lakh crore.2024: A MIXED YEAR FOR EQUITY MARKETS Despite heavy outflows by FIIs in the last quarter of 2024, the overall year was positive for the stock market. The NSE Nifty 50 gained nearly 10% year-to-date until December 27, 2024. Meanwhile, the Nifty Midcap 150 and Nifty Smallcap 250 indices surged by 23% and 26%, respectively, during the same period. Ajay Garg, Director and CEO of SMC Global Securities, believes there is room for optimism in 2025. “Nifty 50 is expected to cross the 28,000 mark in 2025, but the growth may remain non-linear. The current market downturn, in turn, poses a good opportunity to pick some high-quality stocks at a lower price. Taking the ‘buy low sell high’ approach can provide fruitful returns in 2025,” he said.SECTORS TO WATCH IN 2025 Certain sectors are expected to drive market growth in 2025, particularly BFSI (Banking, Financial Services, and Insurance), FMCG (Fast-Moving Consumer Goods), and infrastructure. BFSI: The sector saw its total income rise by 16% year-on-year in the July-September 2024 quarter. Garg noted, “BFSI will experience sharp growth in 2025 with improved asset quality, growth in loans, higher investment participation, and higher financial literacy.” FMCG: The sector faced challenges in 2024 due to lower consumer demand. However, Garg believes it could recover strongly in 2025. “The FMCG sector is one of the stable sectors that can revive with rising consumption, quick commerce push, and higher premiumisation,” he added. Infrastructure: This sector posted a 12.9% year-on-year growth in total income in the July-September 2024 quarter. Garg highlighted the role of government spending and public-private partnerships in driving the sector’s growth, along with improvements in logistics and housing development. Headline: Adani Enterprises to sell entire Adani Wilmar stake in $2 billion dealAdani Enterprises and its wholly-owned subsidiary, Adani Commodities LLP (ACL), have entered into an agreement with Lence Pte Ltd, a fully-owned subsidiary of Wilmar International.
Content: Adani Enterprises Ltd (AEL) announced on Monday its decision to completely exit its 44% stake in Adani Wilmar Ltd (AWL). The stake sale will be executed in two phases: the first involves selling shares to Wilmar International’s subsidiary, Lence Pte Ltd, while the second entails a partial divestment to meet minimum public shareholding requirements. Adani Enterprises and its wholly-owned subsidiary, Adani Commodities LLP (ACL), have entered into an agreement with Lence Pte Ltd, a fully-owned subsidiary of Wilmar International. Under the agreement, Lence Pte Ltd will acquire up to 31.06% of AWL’s paid-up equity shares through a call or put option mechanism. Additionally, Adani Enterprises will divest around 13% of its shares in AWL to meet public shareholding norms. Together, these steps will mark Adani Enterprises’ complete exit from its stake in the fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) business. As of December 27, 2024, Adani Wilmar had a market capitalisation of Rs 42,785 crore (approximately $5 billion). Following the announcement, shares of Adani Enterprises surged by 7% to close at Rs 2,585 on Monday. However, Adani Wilmar’s stock declined by 1.81%, settling at Rs 323.25 per share. In line with the agreement, the nominee directors of Adani Commodities LLP on AWL’s board will step down. Furthermore, the parties have decided to rebrand Adani Wilmar under a new name. Options under consideration include "AWL Limited," "AWL Agri Business Limited," or "Fortune Agri Business Limited." The final name will require approval from the Ministry of Corporate Affairs. Adani Enterprises has indicated that funds from this stake sale will be channelled into its core business sectors, such as energy, utilities, transport, logistics, and other industrial verticals. This aligns with the company’s strategy to strengthen its position in critical infrastructure areas. The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals and other customary conditions. Once completed, it will mark a restructuring of the ownership in AWL, which was a joint venture between the Adani Group and Wilmar International.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024Must Watch
