Headline: Greaves Cotton share price surges 13% to hit 52-week high today. Here's why Greaves Cotton share price hit 52-week high. The share which had closed at Rs 281.83 on Friday, opened at Rs 288.70 on Monday.
Content: Greaves Cotton’s share price jumped over 13% on Monday, reaching its 52-week high and hit a market capitalisation of Rs 6,909.59 crore. The share, which had closed at Rs 281.83 on Friday, opened at Rs 288.70 on Monday, reflecting strong investor interest. The significant rise in Greaves Cotton’s stock price is attributed to multiple factors, including developments in its subsidiary, Greaves Electric Mobility (GEML), and increased investor confidence. Greaves Electric Mobility, a subsidiary of Greaves Cotton, recently filed a draft prospectus for a Rs 1,000 crore Initial Public Offering (IPO). The public issue will include a fresh issue worth Rs 1,000 crore and an Offer for Sale (OFS) of up to 18.94 crore shares by existing promoters and shareholders. This announcement has boosted optimism about the company’s growth prospects. Veteran market investor Vijay Kedia recently acquired 12 lakh shares of Greaves Cotton, amounting to a 0.52% stake in the company, for Rs 25 crore through a block deal on December 9. This marks the first time Kedia has invested in the company, a move that has further enhanced market sentiment. His investment came shortly after the GEML IPO received approval, highlighting confidence in the company’s direction. Greaves Cotton has a current market capitalisation exceeding Rs 7,200 crore, with its shares doubling in value during 2024. The company is undergoing a significant transformation, moving from its traditional role as an engine manufacturer to becoming a provider of fuel-agnostic mobility solutions. This transition is supported by diversified revenue streams and a focus on electric and multi-fuel vehicles. In the second quarter of FY25, Greaves Cotton reported consolidated revenue of Rs 705 crore. Its retail arm, Greaves Retail, continues to lead in the three-wheeler motor and parts segment while also expanding into the electric three-wheeler category.  The company’s management has set a target to achieve Rs 15,000 crore in revenue by 2030. This goal is underpinned by its strategy to diversify revenue streams and focus on multi-fuel and electric mobility solutions, aligning with global trends in sustainable transportation.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 30, 2024

Headline: Budget 2025: Will the old tax regime face the axe?With Budget 2025 approaching, debates intensify over the potential scrapping of the Old Tax Regime amidst tax reforms.
Content: With the Union Budget 2025 around the corner, speculation is rife about the fate of the Old Tax Regime. The government has taken steps to simplify taxation through the New Tax Regime, but concerns remain over the potential elimination of the old system, which offers extensive deductions and exemptions. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, addressing these concerns after Budget 2024, stated that no decision has been finalised, and any changes would follow a thorough evaluation.advertisementCOMPARING OLD AND NEW TAX REGIMESThe Old Tax Regime, a longstanding system, encourages savings through exemptions like those under Section 80TTB, especially benefiting senior citizens. Tax rates range from 5% to 30%, with various deductions available. The Old Tax Regime, a longstanding system, encourages savings through exemptions like those under Section 80TTB, especially benefiting senior citizens. Tax rates range from 5% to 30%, with various deductions available. In contrast, the New Tax Regime introduces lower tax rates (0% to 30%) but reduces exemptions, simplifying the filing process and catering to those in lower income brackets. Key changes in the New Tax Regime include raising the tax-free limit to Rs 3 lakh, introducing a 5% tax for incomes between Rs 3 lakh and Rs 7 lakh, and increasing the standard deduction for salaried employees to Rs 75,000. Additionally, employer contributions to the National Pension System (NPS) now enjoy enhanced tax benefits. These changes aim to save taxpayers up to Rs 17,500 annually under the New Tax Regime.WHAT'S NEXT? The progressive tax slabs under the revised New Tax Regime offer simplicity but come at the cost of fewer savings incentives. For instance, while the New Tax Regime benefits individuals in lower tax brackets, it lacks the robust exemptions that the Old Tax Regime provides. As the government continues its push for a streamlined tax system, the question remains: will the Old Tax Regime be scrapped entirely? While no final decision has been announced, taxpayers must evaluate which system aligns with their financial goals. The future of taxation lies in striking a balance between simplicity and incentivising savings, ensuring a fair and efficient framework for all.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 30, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Stocks to watch today: Adani Enterprises, Adani Wilmar, EaseMyTrip, ITC, ZomatoShares of Adani Enterprises, Adani Wilmar, Zoamto, EaseMyTrip, etc will be in the spotlight today due to various developments when markets open for trading.
Content: Stock markets showed signs of resistance on Monday, with the benchmark indices closing in the red after initial gains. Benchmark stock market indices closed in red on Monday due to profit booking and a subsequent rise in volatility. The S&P BSE Sensex ended 450.94 points lower at 78,248.13, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 168.50 points lower at 23,644.90. Most of the broader market indices also fell during the session due to uncertainty heading into the New Year. Shares of Adani Enterprises, Adani Wilmar, EaseMyTrip, etc will be in the spotlight today due to various developments when markets open for trading. ADANI ENTERPRISES AND ADANI WILMAR Adani Enterprises has decided to exit its 44% stake in Adani Wilmar as part of its strategy to focus on its core infrastructure platforms. The exit will occur in two stages: the first involves a stake sale to Lence Pte Ltd, a subsidiary of Wilmar International, and the second is a partial divestment to comply with minimum public shareholding norms. This decision has brought both companies into the spotlight, with analysts watching for further details on how the exit will impact their operations and share performance.ZOMATO Magicpin, a hyper-local e-commerce platform backed by Zomato, is preparing for an initial public offering (IPO) in 2025, reported Moneycontrol. The reports mentioned that Magicpin has started discussions with investment banks and legal advisors to facilitate the IPO process. This development could strengthen Zomato’s portfolio and open new opportunities in the e-commerce sector.ITC ITC is set to transfer Rs 1,500 crore to its demerged hotel business, ITC Hotels, to support its planned growth and contingency needs. According to a shareholder presentation, ITC Hotels will allocate 8-10% of its revenue for ongoing projects and renovations. The demerger will take effect on January 1, 2025, with January 6 designated as the record date to determine the shareholders eligible for equity shares in the new hotel entity.EASEMYTRIP Nishant Pitti, promoter and co-founder of EaseMyTrip, is expected to sell his remaining 14.21% stake in the company today via a block deal. The stake sale, estimated at Rs 780 crore, will involve 50 crore shares priced at Rs 15.6 each. Reports suggest institutional investors, including CRAFT Emerging Market Fund PCC - Citadel Capital Fund, Multitude Growth Funds Limited, and Eminence Global Fund, may participate in the deal. Pitti had previously sold a 14% stake in September for Rs 920 crore through open market transactions.MAZAGON DOCK SHIPBUILDERS Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders signed a contract worth Rs 19.9 billion (approximately $233 million) with the Ministry of Defence. The deal is for advanced submarine technology, enabling longer underwater endurance. The development is seen as a boost to India’s defence manufacturing capabilities.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 31, 2024

Headline: Sensex, Nifty drop as IT stocks weigh on markets in last session of 2024The S&P BSE Sensex lost 392.61 points to 77,855.52, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 107.80 points to 23,537.10 as of 9:28 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices tanked in early trade on Tuesday, dragged by a plunge in IT stocks in the last trading session of 2024.  The S&P BSE Sensex lost 392.61 points to 77,855.52, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 107.80 points to 23,537.10 as of 9:28 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that December has been weak for equity markets globally. S&P 500 is down by 2.34% and Nifty is down by 2.6%. "Markets are preparing to move into the New Year with caution since uncertainty is high and valuations are stretched. The high U.S. bond yield and strong dollar will ensure that FIIs will continue to sell on every rise. DII buying will not be strong enough to take the market much higher. The fact is that even the DIIs and HNIs don’t have the conviction to accumulate stocks, except in certain pockets of fair value. Conviction to accumulate stocks will emerge only when macro indicators suggest recovery in growth and earnings. Watch out for the Q3 results starting from January 10th to identify companies reporting good numbers despite the growth slowdown," he added.  In today's early trading session, technology stocks faced pressure while banking and energy stocks showed strength. Among the gainers, Kotak Mahindra Bank led the pack with a rise of 1.65%, followed by Bharat Electronics Limited which gained 1.53%. Oil and Natural Gas Corporation advanced 1.33%, while Bajaj Auto added 0.50%, and State Bank of India moved up by 0.49%. On the declining side, Tech Mahindra witnessed the steepest fall of 2.23%, while both Infosys and Tata Consultancy Services dropped 2.07%. HCL Technologies declined by 1.85%, and Wipro Limited fell 1.55%, highlighting a challenging day for the IT sector. Most sectoral indices on the Nifty faced declines, with only a few managing to stay in positive territory. Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom witnessed the steepest fall of 1.65%, followed by Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank which dropped 1.09%. Nifty Realty declined 0.84%, while Nifty Consumer Durables fell 0.76%. Nifty IT decreased by 1.81%, and Nifty Midsmall Financial Services slipped 1.03%. Other declining sectors included Nifty Bank (-0.40%), Nifty Financial Services 25/50 (-0.37%), Nifty Private Bank (-0.34%), Nifty Financial Services (-0.31%), Nifty Media (-0.27%), Nifty FMCG (-0.23%), Nifty Auto (-0.13%), and Nifty Metal (-0.04%). Only three sectors managed gains: Nifty Midsmall Healthcare rose 0.10%, while both Nifty Healthcare Index and Nifty Oil & Gas edged up by 0.08%. Nifty PSU Bank also showed resilience with a gain of 0.12%.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 31, 2024

Headline: Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens for bidding: Check GMP, price band, issue sizeThe IPO is a book-built issue valued at Rs 260.15 crore. It includes a fresh issue of 86 lakh shares, amounting to Rs 184.90 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 35 lakh shares, valued at Rs 75.25 crore.
Content: Indo Farm Equipment Limited's initial public offering (IPO) opens for bidding on Tuesday, marking the last public issue of 2024. Indo Farm Equipment's IPO is expected to draw attention from investors, given the company’s position in the agriculture and construction equipment sectors. The IPO is a book-built issue valued at Rs 260.15 crore. It includes a fresh issue of 86 lakh shares, amounting to Rs 184.90 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 35 lakh shares, valued at Rs 75.25 crore. The price band has been set between Rs 204 and Rs 215 per share. Retail investors can apply for a minimum of one lot, which consists of 69 shares, requiring an investment of Rs 14,835. Small non-institutional investors (sNII) need to apply for a minimum of 14 lots (966 shares) at an investment of Rs 2,07,690. For large non-institutional investors (bNII), the minimum size is 68 lots (4,692 shares), requiring an investment of Rs 10,08,780. Aryaman Financial Services Limited is the book-running lead manager for the IPO, while Mas Services Limited is acting as the registrar. Founded in 1994, Indo Farm Equipment Limited manufactures tractors, pick-and-carry cranes, and other harvesting equipment. The company operates under two brands, Indo Farm and Indo Power, and exports its products to countries like Nepal, Syria, Sudan, Bangladesh, and Myanmar.LATEST GMP  The grey market premium (GMP) for the Indo Farm Equipment IPO is currently at Rs 80, suggesting a potential listing price of Rs 295 per share. This represents an expected gain of approximately 37.21% over the upper price band. Indo Farm has been steadily growing its footprint, especially in the agriculture and construction equipment industries. The company plans to further enhance its market presence using the proceeds from the IPO. The company has set out specific objectives for raising funds. A chunk of the IPO will be used to increase the production capacity of pick-and-carry cranes. Additionally, the funds will help repay select loans and be invested in the company’s NBFC subsidiary, Barota Finance. The remaining amount will be allocated for general corporate purposes. The share allotment for the IPO is likely to be finalised on January 3, 2025. The company is expected to list its shares on the BSE and NSE on January 7, 2025. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 31, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Unimech Aerospace IPO GMP declines: Will it make strong market debut today? The initial public offering (IPO) of Unimech Aerospace and Manufacturing Limited garnered an overwhelming response, with a subscription rate of 174.93 times by the final day of bidding.
Content: Shares of Unimech Aerospace IPO are scheduled to make their market debut as the stock will list on the Dalal Street on Tuesday. The allotment of shares for Unimech Aerospace IPO was completed on Friday, December 27, 2024.  The initial public offering (IPO) of Unimech Aerospace and Manufacturing Limited garnered an overwhelming response, with a subscription rate of 174.93 times by the final day of bidding. The three-day window for the IPO, open from December 23 to December 26, saw substantial interest from various investor categories. The public listing was subscribed 317.63 times by qualified institutional buyers (QIBs), 263.40 times by non-institutional investors (NIIs), and 56.16 times by retail investors. Unimech Aerospace IPO has been commanding a good grey market premium and reached Rs 715 on December 29, 2024, but has since seen a gradual decline in the unofficial market.  The Grey Market Premium (GMP) for the Unimech Aerospace IPO was last reported at Rs 625 as of December 31, 2024, at 5:04 AM. Considering the IPO's price band of Rs 785, the anticipated listing price for Unimech Aerospace shares is estimated at Rs 1,410. This figure is derived by adding the cap price of Rs 785 to the current GMP. If this estimate holds true, investors could potentially see a gain of approximately 79.62% per share. The IPO received positive ratings from 18 brokerages, many of which recommended subscribing due to the company’s strong growth prospects. Analysts believe that Unimech Aerospace is well-positioned to meet the increasing demand from global original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and capitalise on the growing aerospace market. The grey market premium (GMP) often serves as an early indicator of investor sentiment and can hint at the stock's potential performance on its debut day. However, it’s essential to note that GMP trends may not always translate directly into actual listing performance, as broader market dynamics also play a role. Unimech Aerospace and Manufacturing Limited specialises in high-precision engineering solutions for sectors like aerospace, defence, energy, and semiconductors. With its expertise in complex manufacturing, the company is well-positioned to cater to high-demand, high-tech industries. Content: Shares of Dam Capital Advisors rebounded on Tuesday, climbing sharply in early trade after a steep decline in the previous session. Headline: Explained: Why Easy Trip Planners shares tanked 10% today The shares hit a low of Rs 15.42 on the NSE, a decline of 9.51%. The stock saw a turnover of Rs 127.43 crore on the NSE during the session.
Content: Shares of Easy Trip Planners Ltd, also known as EaseMyTrip, fell sharply in early trade today, dropping 10% amid reports that its co-founder and promoter, Nishant Pitti, is planning to sell his remaining 14% stake in the company. The shares hit a low of Rs 15.42 on the NSE, a decline of 9.51%. The stock saw a turnover of Rs 127.43 crore on the NSE during the session. As per a report by Moneycontrol Pitti intends to sell 50,37,21,910 shares at Rs 15.60 per unit, which is an 8.45% discount to the stock's previous closing price. This move follows his earlier stake sales in the company over the past few months. In September, Pitti sold 1 crore shares at Rs 38.28 each, 16.91 crore shares at Rs 37.22 each, and 6.73 crore shares at Rs 37.42 each, totalling 24.65 crore shares, or 14% of the company, for Rs 920 crore. Before this, in June 2023, he sold 6.25 crore shares at Rs 42.60 per share. The continuous stake reduction by the promoter has raised concerns among investors, contributing to the sharp decline in the stock price. The stock has fallen 16.56% in 2024 so far and has seen a 23.78% drop from its 2024 highs. Additionally, the stock turned ex-bonus in a 1:1 ratio on November 29, which has also impacted its trading pattern. Institutional investors are expected to participate in the fresh block deal. Reports indicate that CRAFT Emerging Market Fund PCC - Elite Capital Fund, Multitude Growth Funds Limited, CRAFT Emerging Market Fund PCC - Citadel Capital Fund, Nexpact Limited, and Eminence Global Fund are among the interested buyers. The company’s recent financial performance has also been a factor in the stock’s declining value. For the September quarter, Easy Trip Planners reported a 45.16% drop in profit, posting Rs 25.87 crore compared to Rs 47.18 crore in the same period last year. Revenue for the quarter showed a modest growth of 2.1%, reaching Rs 144.67 crore compared to Rs 141.69 crore in the previous year. The company’s EBITDA for the quarter fell to Rs 42.29 crore, down from Rs 67.65 crore year-on-year, with the EBITDA margin dropping to 28.2% from 46.8%. However, the company’s gross booking revenue (GBR) for the quarter stood at Rs 2,075.64 crore, with its non-air business segments acting as the key growth drivers. The hotels segment saw significant growth, with a GBR of Rs 241.40 crore, marking a 178.4% year-on-year increase.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 31, 2024

Headline: Income Tax extends Vivad Se Vishwas deadline to January 31. Key penalty detailsThe Income Tax Department has extended the Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme deadline to January 31, 2025, offering taxpayers a chance to settle disputes at reduced rates.
Content: The Income Tax Department has extended the deadline for the Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024, giving taxpayers a fresh opportunity to settle disputes at lower tax rates. The new deadline, January 31, 2025, provides much-needed relief for those still evaluating the scheme. Initially set for December 31, 2024, the extension avoids a 10% additional tax, ensuring a smoother resolution process.advertisementKEY BENEFITS OF THE EXTENDED DEADLINEThe Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme, announced in Budget 2024, allows taxpayers to settle pending disputes by paying a lower amount of disputed tax along with specified percentages. Applications filed by January 31, 2025, will follow reduced rates under column (3) of the scheme’s table. However, applications submitted from February 1, 2025, will incur a 10% higher tax rate. The Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme, announced in Budget 2024, allows taxpayers to settle pending disputes by paying a lower amount of disputed tax along with specified percentages. Applications filed by January 31, 2025, will follow reduced rates under column (3) of the scheme’s table. However, applications submitted from February 1, 2025, will incur a 10% higher tax rate. The Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme simplifies dispute resolution by allowing taxpayers to settle cases with reduced financial liability. Applications submitted by January 31, 2025, will be charged rates under column (3) of the scheme's table. For instance, new appellants must pay 100% of disputed tax and 25% for disputed penalties or interest, if filing by the deadline. However, from February 1, 2025, these rates increase to 110% and 30%, respectively.STREAMLINED PROCESS AND SIMPLIFIED COMPLIANCE Key forms under the scheme include Form-1, which taxpayers use to declare their intent to settle disputes, and Form-2, issued by the Income Tax Department after successful payment. Taxpayers must complete payments within 15 days of receiving Form-2 to avoid penalties. This streamlined approach reflects the government’s commitment to reducing litigation, fostering compliance, and promoting a dispute-free tax system. Chartered Accountant Himank Singla, partner, SBHS and Associates, while speaking to The Economic Times, stated that the extension encourages higher participation and aligns with the government’s objective to resolve disputes effectively. The scheme ensures that taxpayers benefit from reduced penalties and costs, promoting peace of mind.A WINDOW OF OPPORTUNITY The extension underscores the government’s proactive approach to simplifying tax compliance and dispute resolution. Taxpayers are urged to seize this chance to settle disputes, avoid additional taxes, and contribute to a transparent, litigation-free tax environment.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 31, 2024Trending Reel

Headline: ITR filing deadline extended for belated/revised return. Check all detailsUnion Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary recently revealed in Parliament that only 6.68% of India's population filed ITRs in the fiscal year 2023-24.
Content:
The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has extended the deadline for resident individuals to file their belated or revised Income Tax Returns (ITR) for the Assessment Year (AY) 2024-25. The original deadline of December 31, 2024, has now been pushed to January 15, 2025. This extension gives taxpayers an additional two weeks to complete or revise their filings. The CBDT shared this update via an announcement on X, and said, “CBDT extends the last date for furnishing Belated/ Revised return of income for AY 2024-25 in the case of Resident Individuals from December 31, 2024 to January 15, 2025.” The change has been made using the board’s powers under section 119 of the Income-tax Act, 1961.

 



ITR deadline extended
 This extension applies to two specific cases. Firstly, it benefits individuals who missed the initial deadline of July 31, 2024, to file their ITR and had until December 31 to file a belated return. Secondly, it allows taxpayers who need to make corrections to previously filed returns an extended window to submit their revised filings. Under current rules, taxpayers filing belated returns must pay a late fee. If the taxable income is below Rs 5 lakh, the fee is Rs 1,000. For those with taxable income above Rs 5 lakh, the late fee increases to Rs 5,000. Taxpayers often make errors or omissions when filing their ITR, such as missing income details or claiming incorrect deductions. A revised return allows individuals to rectify these mistakes. Filing a corrected ITR ensures compliance with tax regulations and can help avoid penalties or additional scrutiny. Despite repeated efforts to encourage tax compliance, a small portion of India’s population files income tax returns. Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary recently revealed in Parliament that only 6.68% of India’s population filed ITRs in the fiscal year 2023-24. “In FY 2023-24, the percentage of population that filed Income Tax Return is 6.68%. The total number of persons filing income tax returns is 8,09,03,315,” he informed the Rajya Sabha on December 17. The new deadline aims to provide relief to taxpayers who may have faced difficulties meeting the December 31 deadline. It also ensures that those needing to correct or update their returns have sufficient time to do so without unnecessary haste.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 31, 2024Trending Reel

Headline: Looking to invest in stocks in 2025? 9 picks for your portfolio this New YearThe year 2024 has been decent for Indian stock markets. Both key market indices - the NSE Nifty 50 and the S&P BSE Sensex - went up by 9% during the year.
Content:
As we step into 2025, many investors are looking for good stocks to add to their investment portfolio. Stock markets have proven to be a good place to invest and grow money over the long term, as shown by the market's performance in recent years. The year 2024 has been decent for Indian stock markets. Both key market indices - the NSE Nifty 50 and the S&P BSE Sensex - went up by 9% during the year. This marks their ninth straight year of making money for investors. The Sensex reached its all-time high at 85,978 points, while the Nifty touched 26,277 on September 27, 2024. What's really worth noting is how well the smaller and medium-sized company stocks did. In the last five years, mid-cap stocks shot up by 234% and small-cap stocks rose by 221%. This shows that investors who picked these stocks made much more money than those who stuck to just big company stocks. Looking ahead to 2025, Axis Securities Limited has shared their top nine stock picks in a report.  Their top pick is Shriram Finance Ltd, trading at Rs 2,930 (at the time the report was being curated). They think it can go up to Rs 3,825, which means it could grow by 31%. Second on their list is Fortis Healthcare Ltd. The stock cost Rs 672 (at the time the report was being curated), and they expect it to reach Rs 860, giving a possible gain of 28%. Third is Prestige Estates Projects Ltd, at Rs 1,748 (at the time the report was being curated). They predict it will rise to Rs 2,195, offering a 26% return. City Union Bank Ltd came in fourth, at Rs 174 (at the time the report was being curated). The target price is Rs 215, suggesting a 24% upside. Fifth is Ambuja Cements Ltd, trading at Rs 550 (at the time the report was being curated). They expect it to hit Rs 675, giving investors a 23% return. DOMS Industries Ltd is sixth on the list. At Rs 2,553 (at the time the report was being curated), they think it could reach Rs 3,120, offering a 22% gain. Seventh is Ethos Ltd, currently at Rs 3,112 (at the time the report was being curated). Their target price is Rs 3,750, suggesting a 21% rise. Bharti Airtel Ltd is eighth, trading at Rs 1,600 (at the time the report was being curated). They expect it to reach Rs 1,880, giving an 18% return. Last but not least is Cipla Ltd, at Rs 1,489 (at the time the report was being curated). They think it could go up to Rs 1,735, offering a 17% gain. Axis Securities is quite hopeful about India's growth in 2025. They say India's economy is doing better than other growing countries and should keep doing well. "Nifty 50 EPS is projected to grow by 7.6% in FY25, with growth expected to accelerate to 13.7% in FY26 and 11% in FY27, reflecting a robust 14% CAGR over the FY23–27 period. This growth will be supported by the real estate cycle, private capex recovery, and strong
construction activity during this period. Risks include global macro uncertainties, inflation pressures, and potential earnings downgrades post-Q3," Axis Securities said.  However, they say investors should keep an eye on a few things in 2025: what happens in US government policies after Doanld Trump takes oath as President, any changes in trade rules between countries, whether the US central bank cuts interest rates, and how oil prices and currency rates move. In India, they suggest watching for the upcoming budget and possible interest rate cuts by the Reserve Bank of India. Headline: Sensex and Nifty in 2025: Will Dalal Street's turbulent run continue?Following a volatile 2024 that saw significant gains in the first half before moderating, market experts anticipate single-digit returns in the coming year.
Content: As India's financial markets enter 2025, analysts are advising investors to temper their expectations amid global uncertainties and stretched valuations. Following a volatile 2024 that saw significant gains in the first half before moderating, market experts anticipate single-digit returns in the coming year.The previous year’s journey was particularly noteworthy. Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research) at Mehta Equities Ltd, reflects: "The year 2024 has been a challenging yet rewarding one for the markets. Nifty steadily climbed from January to September, reaching a historic high of 26,277.35, before giving up some gains to still close the year with an impressive 8% rise."advertisementThis performance is especially remarkable considering the substantial foreign institutional investor (FII) outflows. As Tapse notes, Nifty achieved its "ninth consecutive year of positive returns, despite FIIs selling shares worth Rs 3,03,000 crore."CAUTION AND UNCERTAINTY REMAIN  As India's financial markets enter 2025, analysts are advising investors to temper their expectations amid global uncertainties and stretched valuations. Following a volatile 2024 that saw significant gains in the first half before moderating, market experts anticipate single-digit returns in the coming year. The previous year’s journey was particularly noteworthy. Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research) at Mehta Equities Ltd, reflects: "The year 2024 has been a challenging yet rewarding one for the markets. Nifty steadily climbed from January to September, reaching a historic high of 26,277.35, before giving up some gains to still close the year with an impressive 8% rise." This performance is especially remarkable considering the substantial foreign institutional investor (FII) outflows. As Tapse notes, Nifty achieved its "ninth consecutive year of positive returns, despite FIIs selling shares worth Rs 3,03,000 crore."CAUTION AND UNCERTAINTY REMAIN  The market sentiment entering 2025 remains cautious, with several global factors weighing on investor confidence. Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, points to ongoing challenges: "Markets are preparing to move into the New Year with caution since uncertainty is high and valuations are stretched. The high US bond yield and strong dollar will ensure that FIIs will continue to sell on every rise." Several other analysts expect 2025 to be a year of modest returns, with geopolitical issues and US Federal Reserve decisions playing crucial roles in market direction. The change in US government, ongoing geopolitical tensions, and anticipated Fed rate cuts are contributing to market volatility.WHAT'S IN FOCUS?  The first half of 2025 could see muted earnings due to tepid demand, according to market experts. Analysts believe stock markets are likely to remain range-bound in the first half of the year, with recovery expected later in the year driven by underlying earnings growth. Vijayakumar highlighted the importance of corporate performance: "Conviction to accumulate stocks will emerge only when macro indicators suggest recovery in growth and earnings. Watch out for the Q3 results starting from January 10 to identify companies reporting good numbers despite the growth slowdown." Despite the cautious outlook, some analysts maintain optimistic targets. According to a Business Today report, Choice Broking's Jathin Kaithavalappil projects the Sensex to reach 90,000 and Nifty to hit 28,000 by year-end, citing India's strong domestic consumption and investment cycle. Meanwhile, Religare Broking's Ajit Mishra provides a more conservative estimate, with Nifty potentially reaching 26,000 by the end of 2025. As markets navigate through these challenging times, Tapse's closing remarks capture the sentiment perfectly: "Sentiments are volatile, and caution is advised as we enter the new year."Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 31, 2024

Headline: What is Kekius Maximus? Elon Musk's new identity on XBy adopting the name 'Kekius Maximus' on X, Musk sent the KEKIUS memecoin soaring 500%, sparking renewed interest in the crypto market.
Content:
In his signature unpredictable style, Tesla CEO Elon Musk created a buzz by changing his name on social media platform X to 'Kekius Maximus.' This surprising move caught the attention of millions of his followers and also caused a stir in the cryptocurrency market. 
 


 The memecoin KEKIUS, sharing its name with Musk’s new persona, surged over 500% in just a few hours, reigniting enthusiasm in the volatile world of memecoins.WHAT IS KEKIUS MAXIMUS? Kekius Maximus, which goes by the ticker, KEKIUS, is a meme-inspired cryptocurrency token that blends humour with decentralised finance (DeFi). KEKIUS is influenced by internet culture, particularly the Pepe the Frog meme and the Maximus character from Gladiator. According to CoinGecko, the token operates across multiple blockchain platforms like Ethereum and Solana, with a current market capitalisation of over $85 million. KEKIUS tokens are actively traded on both centralised and decentralised exchanges, with Gate.io being the most popular platform for transactions. The token’s highest recorded price was $0.09274 on December 31, 2024, while its lowest price of $0.0006923 was seen just 13 days earlier. The sudden surge in KEKIUS’s value is a testament to the power of social media and Musk’s unparalleled influence in the tech and crypto realms.THE MUSK EFFECT ON MEMECOINS Musk, a well-known fan of memes and cryptocurrency, further amplified the hype by resharing posts about his new identity. One such post joked about journalists addressing him as “Kekius Maximus,” to which Musk replied, “This will be priceless.” While he hasn’t clarified his reasons for adopting the new name, his tweets have once again demonstrated their market-moving potential.
 


 The surge in KEKIUS has also revived interest in other Kekius-themed memecoins, some of which have soared by over 200% within hours of launch. Experts believe this could signal the return of the 'memecoin season,' where humour and speculation drive unprecedented gains in the crypto market. Musk’s playful antics continue to blur the lines between internet culture and high-stakes financial markets, leaving everyone guessing what he’ll do next.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 31, 2024

Headline: Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower in last trading session of 2024The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 109.12 points to settle at 78,139.01, while the Nifty50 edged down by 0.10 points, closing at 23,644.80.
Content:
Benchmark indices closed slightly lower on the final trading session of 2024, primarily due to a significant decline in information technology (IT) stocks. The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 109.12 points to settle at 78,139.01, while the Nifty50 edged down by 0.10 points, closing at 23,644.80. Among the sectoral indices, Nifty IT emerged as the top loser, declining by 1.44% by the end of the session. This downturn in IT stocks, which derive a substantial portion of their revenue from the US market, is attributed to the US Federal Reserve's recent indication of fewer rate cuts in 2025 than previously anticipated. The stance has led to a rise in Treasury yields, diminishing the appeal of emerging markets like India for foreign institutional investors (FIIs). Consequently, FIIs have been net sellers for ten consecutive sessions, offloading shares worth approximately $2.8 billion. In terms of individual stock performance on the Nifty50, the top gainers included Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL), Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC), Kotak Mahindra Bank, Trent, and Coal India. Conversely, the leading losers were Adani Enterprises, Tech Mahindra, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Infosys, and SBI Life Insurance. The mixed performance across broader market indices, coupled with rising volatility during the session, suggests a cautious investor sentiment as the year concludes. Market participants are now looking ahead to 2025, closely monitoring global economic indicators and policy decisions that could influence market dynamics in the coming year. Aditya Gaggar, Director of Progressive Shares, said, "Today's market action exhibited a V-shaped recovery, with a subdued opening followed by a sharp decline led by weakness in the Mid and Smallcap stocks. However, a strong recovery across sectors helped the Index close the session at 23,644.80." "A Spinning Top candlestick pattern appeared on the chart, suggesting indecisiveness but also raising the possibility of a positive divergence in the RSI, which could signal a change in momentum. In terms of technical levels, the immediate resistance is seen at 23,700, and a confirmation of trend reversal would see the next resistance level at 23,880. On the downside, 23,470 remains a key support level," he added. 
Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 31, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Stock market today: Sensex, Nifty open flat in first trading session of 2025The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 33.99 points to 78,173.00, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 1.85 points to 23,646.65 as of 9:31 AM.
Content:
Benchmark stock market indices opened flat on Wednesday in the first trading session of 2025 after having seen a decline in the latter part of December 2024.  The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 33.99 points to 78,173.00, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 1.85 points to 23,646.65 as of 9:31 AM.  Dr V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that the New Year begins on a sombre note for the Indian equity market. "The near-term trend appears weak with the macro construct dominated by weak GDP and earnings growth. The headwinds from a strong dollar ( $ index is at 108.5%) and high U.S. bond yields will impact the market through more FII selling, at least in the early days of 2025. Even though FII selling is matched by DII buying, in this tug of war, in the near-term, sentiments are on the side of FIIs since valuations continue to be elevated and growth and earnings are yet to show signs of recovery," he added.  A trend reversal may happen if the Q3 corporate results indicate recovery in earnings. But an across the board sharp recovery appears unlikely. Positive cues can come from a growth-stimulating Budget followed by a rate cut by the MPC in February.
Investors should be cautious and watch for potentially market moving macro data. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 1, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 2: Check latest subscription, GMPThe IPO is a book-built issue valued at Rs 260.15 crore. It includes a fresh issue of 86 lakh shares, amounting to Rs 184.90 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 35 lakh shares, valued at Rs 75.25 crore.
Content: The second day of bidding for Indo Farm Equipment Limited's initial public offering (IPO) resumed on Wednesday, the first day of 2025. Indo Farm Equipment's IPO is expected to draw attention from investors, given the company’s position in the agriculture and construction equipment sectors. The IPO is a book-built issue valued at Rs 260.15 crore. It includes a fresh issue of 86 lakh shares, amounting to Rs 184.90 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 35 lakh shares, valued at Rs 75.25 crore. The price band has been set between Rs 204 and Rs 215 per share. Retail investors can apply for a minimum of one lot, which consists of 69 shares, requiring an investment of Rs 14,835. Small non-institutional investors (sNII) need to apply for a minimum of 14 lots (966 shares) at an investment of Rs 2,07,690. For large non-institutional investors (bNII), the minimum size is 68 lots (4,692 shares), requiring an investment of Rs 10,08,780. The Indo Farm Equipment IPO has received a strong response, with an overall subscription of 20.39 times by the second day. Within specific investor categories, the retail portion was subscribed 20.97 times, indicating high interest among individual investors. The Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) segment saw a subscription of 8.11 times, reflecting moderate participation from institutional investors. Meanwhile, the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) category recorded the highest demand, with a subscription of 35.42 times by 10:09 AM on January 1, 2025.LATEST GMP  The grey market premium (GMP) for the Indo Farm Equipment IPO has been steadily increasing. As of January 1, 2025, at 8:23 AM, the GMP was recorded at Rs 95. Given the IPO's price band of Rs 215, the estimated listing price is Rs 310, calculated by adding the GMP to the upper price band. This suggests a potential gain of approximately 44.19% per share upon listing, reflecting strong investor interest in the offering. Aryaman Financial Services Limited is the book-running lead manager for the IPO, while Mas Services Limited is acting as the registrar. Founded in 1994, Indo Farm Equipment Limited manufactures tractors, pick-and-carry cranes, and other harvesting equipment. The company operates under two brands, Indo Farm and Indo Power, and exports its products to countries like Nepal, Syria, Sudan, Bangladesh, and Myanmar. The share allotment for the IPO is likely to be finalised on January 3, 2025. The company is expected to list its shares on the BSE and NSE on January 7, 2025.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 1, 2025

Headline: Are BSE, NSE closed on January 1 for New year 2025?In India, the stock markets operate from Monday to Friday and remain closed on weekends, i.e., Saturdays and Sundays.
Content: While most of the world welcomes the New Year with a laid-back holiday mood, sipping coffee and lounging in pyjamas, the Indian stock markets seem to march to a different beat.  The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and National Stock Exchange (NSE) are operating as usual on January 1, 2025, despite it being New Year’s Day. Unlike many international stock markets that observe January 1 as a holiday, Indian stock exchanges are open for trading today. The official holiday calendar issued by NSE India does not include New Year’s Day as a non-trading day. Consequently, trading activities began at their regular times, with the pre-open session starting at 9:00 am and the full-day trading session running from 9:15 am to 3:30 pm. Investors can carry out their transactions just like on any other regular trading day. In India, the stock markets operate from Monday to Friday and remain closed on weekends, i.e., Saturdays and Sundays. The pre-open session, which allows for price discovery and order matching, begins at 9:00 am and lasts until 9:15 am. The main trading session runs from 9:15 am to 3:30 pm.Are US stock markets closed today? Yes, US stock markets are closed today, January 1, 2025, in observance of New Year’s Day. According to the Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association, trading will resume on January 2. On December 31, US markets closed early to allow traders to welcome the New Year. Additionally, the US stock markets will remain closed on January 9, 2025, for a national day of mourning to honour former President and Nobel Laureate Jimmy Carter. The London Stock Exchange (LSE) is also closed today for New Year’s Day. Trading will resume on January 2, 2025. The LSE’s next scheduled closure will occur on April 18, 2025, for Good Friday. Several key international indices, including the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong, Euronext Paris, Tokyo Stock Exchange, and Shanghai Stock Exchange, are observing a holiday today. These markets will resume operations on January 2, 2025.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 1, 2025

Headline: IREDA share price: Multibagger stock jumps 8% today. Here's why IREDA's share price touched an intraday high of Rs 227.65 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a 5.76% increase from its previous close.
Content: Shares of Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) rose on January 1, 2025, following major business updates. The stock gained nearly 8% during intraday trading, driven by strong growth in loan disbursements and sanctions during the December quarter. IREDA’s share price touched an intraday high of Rs 227.65 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a 5.76% increase from its previous close. This rise comes as the state-owned firm reported a 41% year-on-year (YoY) growth in loan disbursements for the third quarter of the financial year. According to provisional figures shared by the company, IREDA disbursed loans worth Rs 17,236 crore in the December quarter, up from Rs 12,220 crore during the same period last year. The company also recorded a 129% YoY jump in loan sanctions, which stood at Rs 31,087 crore compared to Rs 13,558 crore in the corresponding quarter of FY24. In its official statement, IREDA attributed this growth to increased confidence among stakeholders and the growing demand for green energy projects in India. "IREDA’s outstanding performance reflects our unwavering commitment to driving India’s renewable energy transition. The 129% growth in loan sanctions underscores the increasing confidence of stakeholders in our capabilities and our pivotal role in supporting green energy projects," said Pradip Kumar Das, Chairman and Managing Director of IREDA. IREDA’s shares, which were listed on the stock exchanges in 2023 following a successful IPO, have been a consistent performer for investors. Despite experiencing some corrections due to broader market pressures, including selling by foreign institutional investors, IREDA shares have delivered multibagger returns. In 2024, the stock rose by 105%, making it a good wealth generator for its investors. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 1, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why SJVN share price rose 8% today SJVN shares were trading at Rs 110.33 as of 11 AM on the National Stock Exchange (NSE). The sharp rise in the stock was accompanied by heavy trading volumes, with over two crore shares changing hands.
Content: Shares of SJVN Limited jumped by 8% in early trading on January 1, 2025, following the announcement of a new project in Bihar. The surge in share price of SJVN came after the company signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Bihar government for a pumped storage power project valued at Rs 5,663 crore. At 11:00 am, SJVN shares were trading at Rs 110.33 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE). The sharp rise in the stock was accompanied by heavy trading volumes, with over two crore shares changing hands. This is notably higher than the one-month daily average of 67 lakh shares, indicating heightened interest from investors. The agreement involves the development of the 1,000 MW Hathidah Durgawati Pumped Storage Project (PSP) in Bihar. This project will operate with a levelised tariff of Rs 9.39 per kWh, calculated at February 2024 prices, with a pumping energy rate of Rs 3 per kWh. The pumped storage facility, which will be built on the Durgawati River in Kaimur district, is designed to provide a peak energy output of 6.325 million units (MU) per day and an annual peak energy generation of 2,308.65 MU. In addition to boosting energy production, the project is expected to generate employment for approximately 5,000 people, both directly and indirectly. It is also set to attract an investment of around Rs 10,000 crore to Bihar, marking a significant milestone in the state’s energy development plans. In August 2022, the Ministry of Power designated SJVN as the nodal agency for developing Pumped Storage Projects (PSPs) in Bihar. The company was tasked with overseeing the development of four PSPs in the state ,which are - Telharkund PSP (400 MW), Sinafdar PSP (345 MW), Panchgotia PSP (225 MW), Hathidah Durgawati PSP (1,600 MW).  The Hathidah Durgawati project is the largest among these and is expected to boost the company’s renewable energy portfolio. SJVN is actively developing around 12,000 MW of energy storage projects across various Indian states, including Maharashtra, Karnataka, Mizoram, Himachal Pradesh, and Bihar. These initiatives align with the company’s vision of becoming a key player in India’s clean energy transition.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 1, 2025

Headline: Adani Wilmar stocks recover as share price rises 5% in ealry tradeAdani Wilmar share price: The recovery follows a sharp decline of 7% on Tuesday after Adani Enterprises Ltd (AEL) announced its decision to sell its entire 44% stake in Adani Wilmar Ltd (AWL).
Content: Shares of Adani Wilmar rebounded in early trading on Wednesday, climbing nearly 5% to reach a high of Rs 323.50 after having closed at Rs 308.25 in the previous session. This recovery follows a sharp decline of 7% on Tuesday after Adani Enterprises Ltd (AEL) announced its decision to sell its entire 44% stake in Adani Wilmar Ltd (AWL). Adani Enterprises, the flagship company of the Adani Group, revealed on Monday that it would completely exit its joint venture with Singapore’s Wilmar International. The divestment will occur in two phases. In the first phase, up to 31.06% of AWL’s paid-up equity shares will be sold to Lence Pte Ltd, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Wilmar International, using a call or put option mechanism. The remaining stake will be sold later to meet public shareholding requirements. The announcement initially caused Adani Wilmar shares to fall, closing nearly 7% lower on December 31. However, by January 3, investor sentiment appeared to stabilise, with the stock regaining momentum and rising 5% in early trading. As of the latest update, shares were trading 4.19% higher at Rs 320.95. Adani Enterprises is expected to raise over $2 billion from the stake sale. This deal, which includes both an Offer for Sale (OFS) and the stake transfer to Wilmar International’s subsidiary, is expected to conclude by March 2025. The funds generated will help Adani Enterprises focus on other growth initiatives, such as green hydrogen, data centres, digital ventures, and consumer services under its airport business. In its statement announcing the exit from AWL, Adani Enterprises highlighted its strategy to focus on infrastructure and macroeconomic sectors driving India’s growth. The company has positioned itself as an incubator for ventures supporting this growth. Earlier in October, Adani Enterprises secured $500 million in funding. Other group companies, including Adani Energy Solutions, Adani Green Energy, and Ambuja Cement, have collectively raised $4.5 billion in recent months, strengthening the group’s financial standing and investment capabilities.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 1, 2025

Headline: Nishant Pitti resigns as Easy Trip Planners CEO after divesting stakeIn a stock exchange filing, Nishant Pitti cited personal reasons for stepping down as the CEO of Easy Trip Planners.
Content: Nishant Pitti, the co-founder and CEO of Easy Trip Planners, has resigned from his position, effective January 1, 2025. The announcement follows his recent decision to divest a 1.4% stake in the company, which operates the online travel platform EaseMyTrip. In a stock exchange filing, Pitti cited personal reasons for stepping down. "I, Nishant Pitti, Chairman and CEO of Easy Trip Planners Limited, hereby tender my resignation from the position of CEO due to personal reasons with effect from January 1, 2025. Kindly accept this resignation and relieve me from being the CEO of the company and acknowledge the receipt of this resignation," Pitti said in his resignation letter. Following Pitti's resignation, Rikant Pittie has been appointed to lead the company as CEO, starting from the same date. On December 31, Nishant Pitti sold 4.99 crore shares, representing a 1.41% stake in Easy Trip Planners, for Rs 78 crore in an open market transaction. The shares were sold at an average price of Rs 15.68 apiece. This transaction has reduced Pitti’s personal stake in the company from 14.21% to 12.8%. The combined stake of the promoters has also declined from 50.38% to 48.97%. Meanwhile, Arunaben Sanjaykumar Bhatiya acquired 2.40 crore shares of the company at an average price of Rs 15.86 per share, amounting to Rs 38.06 crore. The identities of other buyers involved in the transaction were not disclosed in the available bulk deal data.Previous stake sale This is not the first time Nishant Pitti has sold a portion of his stake in Easy Trip Planners. In September 2023, he had offloaded a 14% stake for Rs 920 crore through open market transactions.Market reaction Shares of Easy Trip Planners reacted negatively to the news of Pitti’s stake sale and resignation. The stock declined by 6.98% on Tuesday, closing at Rs 15.85 per share on the National Stock Exchange (NSE).Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 1, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Should Nirmala Sitharaman focus on boosting consumption? India's GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in the second quarter of the current fiscal year, marking an 18-month low. This was primarily due to weak consumption.
Content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman faces a challenging economic backdrop as she prepares to present Budget 2025-26 on February 1. With inflation driven by high food prices and a slowdown in economic growth, the government is under pressure to revive private consumption, which is critical for sustaining economic momentum. India’s GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in the second quarter of the current fiscal year, marking an 18-month low. This was primarily due to weak consumption. The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) also lowered its real GDP growth forecast for 2024-25 to 6.6%, citing global uncertainties, volatile commodity prices, and fragmented economic conditions. Experts, including Deloitte, have highlighted the need for measures in the upcoming Budget to address these challenges. Boosting private consumption, particularly among the middle class, is seen as essential to prevent further delays in the recovery of the private investment cycle.MIDDLE-CLASS RELIEF & CONSUMPTION REVIVAL Anand Ramanathan, Partner and Leader for the Consumer Products and Retail sector at Deloitte India, said that India’s GDP growth is likely to moderate to 6.3% in FY25 due to fiscal consolidation and tighter global credit conditions. While core inflation stands at a manageable 4.8%, food inflation remains a concern at 5.1%. “The country’s current account deficit is projected at 1.9 per cent of GDP, supported by a 13 per cent rise in services exports, mainly IT services, which contribute $325 billion annually. This economic backdrop underscores the need for prudent fiscal policies that prioritise consumption revival, infrastructure development and innovation-driven growth," said Ramanathan.DELOITTE'S KEY EXPECTATION FROM BUDGET 2025 Deloitte has outlined three main expectations for Budget 2025 that could help boost private consumption and address economic concerns: Higher income tax exemptions - Deloitte suggests raising the basic income tax exemption limit under the old tax regime from Rs 2.5 lakh to Rs 3.5 lakh. Additionally, it recommends increasing the standard deduction under the new regime from Rs 50,000 to Rs 75,000. The consultancy firm estimates that this could increase disposable income for middle-income households by 5-7%, leading to a 6% rise in consumer spending on essential goods and a 0.7% boost to GDP. Lower GST rates on mass-consumption FMCG products - Deloitte recommends reducing the Goods and Services Tax (GST) on mass-consumption FMCG products, such as personal care items and packaged foods, from 18% to 12%. This move could result in an 8% increase in volume sales of these products, leading to higher tax collections and a 0.5% GDP growth. It would also make essential goods more affordable and support small-scale FMCG manufacturers. Targeted tax incentives for rural markets and innovation - To enhance rural demand, Deloitte proposes a Rs 10,000 crore FMCG Rural Growth Fund to improve distribution networks and offer tax rebates for affordable rural product lines. The firm also suggests a 150% weighted tax deduction on research and development (R&D) expenses for FMCG companies focusing on sustainable packaging and health-related products. Deloitte estimates that a 10% growth in rural FMCG sales could add Rs 50,000 crore in annual revenue for the industry.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 1, 2025Must Watch

Headline: WhatsApp Pay's UPI services to cover all Indian users. Check details NPCI's decision allows WhatsApp Pay to serve over 500 million WhatsApp users in the country, a huge leap from earlier restrictions.
Content: WhatsApp Pay, the payment feature of the popular messaging platform, has been given the green light to extend its Unified Payments Interface (UPI) services to all its users in India. This major development comes as the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has lifted the cap on user onboarding for WhatsApp Pay. In a press release, NPCI announced, "National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has removed the UPI user onboarding limit for WhatsApp Pay (Third Party App Provider), with immediate effect. With this development, WhatsApp Pay can now extend UPI services to its entire user base in India." This decision allows WhatsApp Pay to serve over 500 million WhatsApp users in the country, a huge leap from earlier restrictions.  When WhatsApp Pay was introduced, NPCI imposed strict limits on the number of users it could onboard. This cautious approach was designed to ensure the payment service could handle the large-scale demands of India's digital payments ecosystem while maintaining security and performance standards. Initially, WhatsApp Pay was allowed to onboard only a small percentage of UPI users. The cap was gradually raised as NPCI monitored its performance and ensured compliance with the UPI framework. In November 2022, NPCI increased the cap for WhatsApp Pay to 100 million users. This phased rollout allowed WhatsApp Pay to fine-tune its operations and address any scalability or security concerns before reaching a wider audience. The decision to lift the cap comes after NPCI assessed that WhatsApp Pay has met all necessary operational, security, and compliance standards required for UPI payment services. By removing the limit, NPCI aims to enable broader access to digital payment platforms, which aligns with India’s push for a cashless economy. With this update, WhatsApp Pay will still need to comply with all existing UPI guidelines applicable to third-party app providers (TPAPs). This move is expected to reshape India’s UPI ecosystem. WhatsApp, with over 500 million users in the country, can now actively promote its payment feature to a much larger audience. This could challenge existing UPI leaders like PhonePe, Google Pay, and Paytm, which currently dominate the market. The decision to remove the onboarding limit coincides with NPCI's extension of the market cap deadline for UPI service providers. According to the earlier NPCI rule issued in 2021, no single UPI app was allowed to handle more than 30% of the total UPI transactions. However, NPCI has now extended the compliance deadline for this rule by two years, until 31 December 2026. This gives existing players like PhonePe and Google Pay, which currently exceed the 30% cap, more time to align with the guidelines.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 1, 2025

Headline: Sensex jumps over 600 points: 2 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 470.08 points to 78,609.09, while the NSE Nifty50 added 138.85 points to 23,783.65 as of 2:20 PM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices erased the losses made in early trade and witnessed a rally in the afternoon session on the first trading day of 2025 as Sensex gained over 600 poinst whereas Nifty managed to jum over 200 points. The S&P BSE Sensex was up 470.08 points to 78,609.09, while the NSE Nifty50 added 138.85 points to 23,783.65 as of 2:20 PM.  The overall market sentiment stayed upbeat, with 2,566 stocks on the BSE recording gains, outpacing the 1,238 stocks that declined, while 160 stocks saw no change. Additionally, 128 stocks reached their 52-week highs during the session, significantly more than the 34 stocks that touched their 52-week lows.  The stock market rally was fuelled by a rise in auto, banking, media and FMCG sector stocks which helped both Sensex and Nifty reverse their losses in early trade. STRONG AUTO SALES DATA  Auto sector stocks particularly gained as many automakers released sales data on Wednesday.  "In December 2024, Maruti Suzuki India Limited sold a total of 178,248 units. Total sales in the month include domestic sales of 132,523 units, sales to other OEM of 8,306 units and the highest ever monthly exports of 37,419 units," said Maruti Suzuki in a press release.  Hyundai Motor India Limited (HMIL) recorded its highest ever yearly domestic sales of 6,05,433 units in CY 2024. HMIL achieved total sales of 7,64,119 units (Domestic + Export) in CY 2024. In December 2024, HMIL reported total monthly sales of 55,078 units (Domestic: 42,208 units and Export: 12,870 units). Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. (M&M Ltd.), one of India’s leading automotive companies, today announced that its overall auto sales for the month of December 2024 stood at 69768 vehicles, a growth of 16%, including exports. In the Utility Vehicles segment, Mahindra sold 41424 vehicles in the domestic market, a growth of 18% and overall, 42958 vehicles, including exports. The domestic sales for Commercial Vehicles stood at 19502. In today's trading session, Maruti Suzuki India led the advances with a strong gain of 2.92%, followed by Mahindra & Mahindra which rose 2.31%. IndusInd Bank and Larsen & Toubro both showed significant strength, gaining 1.86% and 1.85% respectively, while Eicher Motors rounded out the top gainers with a 1.52% increase. On the declining side, Dr. Reddy's Laboratories faced the steepest fall of 1.83%, followed by Hindustan Aluminium Company Limited which dropped 1.40%. Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone declined 0.83%, while Bajaj Auto fell 0.78%, and Tata Steel Limited decreased by 0.76%.SECTORAL STRENGTH Broad market indices showed strength on January 1, 2025, with Nifty Smallcap100 gaining 0.92% and Nifty Midcap100 rising 0.33%. Nifty Auto led the advances with a robust gain of 1.29%, followed by Nifty Media which rose 0.81%. Nifty Private Bank advanced 0.71%, while Nifty Consumer Durables gained 0.74%. Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank increased by 0.65%, and Nifty Bank added 0.67%. Nifty Financial Services gained 0.62%, while Nifty Financial Services 25/50 rose 0.52%.
