Headline: Budget 2025: Mohandas Pai calls for revised tax slabs, relief for middle-classFormer Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai calls for Budget 2025 reforms to ease middle-class tax burdens, simplify slabs, resolve disputes, and boost spending.
Content:
As the 2025 Union Budget approaches, former Infosys CFO TV Mohandas Pai has outlined his recommendations for substantial tax reforms. In a post on X, Pai urged the government to prioritise middle-class taxpayers who are grappling with rising costs, inflation, and stagnant incomes. His wishlist for the upcoming Budget aims to ease financial burdens and stimulate economic activity.
 



 


advertisementPROPOSED TAX REFORMS Pai highlighted the sharp increase in individual tax collections, which rose from Rs 4.87 lakh crore in FY21 to Rs 10.45 lakh crore in FY24—a 114% jump in three years. He proposed new tax slabs with no tax for income up to Rs 5 lakh, 10% for Rs 5-10 lakh, 20% for Rs 10-20 lakh, and 30% for income above Rs 20 lakh. Pai highlighted the sharp increase in individual tax collections, which rose from Rs 4.87 lakh crore in FY21 to Rs 10.45 lakh crore in FY24—a 114% jump in three years. He proposed new tax slabs with no tax for income up to Rs 5 lakh, 10% for Rs 5-10 lakh, 20% for Rs 10-20 lakh, and 30% for income above Rs 20 lakh. He suggested removing most deductions, except under Sections 80D (health insurance) and 80G (charitable donations), and introducing these slabs as an optional scheme to replace the current complex structure. For senior citizens, Pai recommended taxing income above Rs 7.5 lakh for those over 60 and Rs 10 lakh for those over 70. He also advocated exempting individuals earning up to Rs 5 lakh from filing income tax returns unless they are claiming refunds.ADDRESSING TAX DISPUTES AND HOUSING LOAN CONCERNS Pai raised concerns over rising tax disputes, with pending amounts exceeding Rs 12.5 lakh crore. He urged the government to declare 2025-26 as the ‘Year of Tax Dispute Resolution’ and streamline processes within the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT). Additionally, he emphasised the need for housing loan reforms, as only 1.2 crore taxpayers benefit from deductions due to limited home loan uptake.RELIEF FOR THE MIDDLE CLASS Calling for an end to ‘tax terrorism', Pai criticised the lack of relief for middle-class taxpayers, who shoulder the bulk of the tax burden. He highlighted that while over Rs 9 lakh crore in subsidies support the bottom 60% of the population, the middle class is often overlooked. Pai’s recommendations reflect the growing frustrations of India’s middle class, urging the government to deliver meaningful reforms. With economic pressures mounting, these measures could offer much-needed relief and restore confidence amongst taxpayers.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 2, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: Will Nirmala Sitharaman address TDS-TCS challenges? As Budget 2025-26 approaches, FICCI and industry bodies advocate simplifying TDS-TCS rates and tax processes to reduce complexity, boost compliance, and enhance taxpayer confidence.
Content: As the Union Budget 2025-26 draws near, discussions intensify on simplifying India’s tax system. Industry bodies, including the Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI), have shared their recommendations with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, advocating tax reforms to boost the ease of doing business and reduce complexity. Amongst the key proposals is streamlining the Tax Deducted at Source (TDS) and Tax Collected at Source (TCS) regimes to provide relief to businesses and taxpayers alike.advertisementSIMPLIFYING TDS-TCS RATESFICCI has proposed reducing the numerous TDS/TCS rates to a simplified two- or three-tier system, a move expected to minimise confusion and disputes over tax classifications. FICCI has proposed reducing the numerous TDS/TCS rates to a simplified two- or three-tier system, a move expected to minimise confusion and disputes over tax classifications. This would also improve compliance and reduce administrative burdens. A Deloitte survey found strong support amongst taxpayers for simpler Individual Tax Returns (ITRs), straightforward incentive calculations, and a unified TDS framework based on a "one rate, one section" principle. Additionally, the Income-Tax Policy Survey suggested eliminating Form 16A, as TDS details are already available in recipients' Form 26AS and Annual Information Statements (AIS). Such measures could significantly ease compliance and streamline processes for businesses and individuals.TDS-TCS REFORMS SO FAR In Budget 2024, some steps were taken toward simplifying the tax structure. The TDS rate on rents exceeding Rs 50,000 was reduced from 5% to 2%, and buyers of properties above Rs 50 lakh were required to deduct TDS only on the amount exceeding the threshold, regardless of the number of sellers involved. Recent changes also allow parents to claim TCS collected from a minor child’s income, making the process more family-friendly. From October 2024, employers will be required to factor in TDS/TCS deducted on non-salary income when calculating tax deductions on salaries, reducing double taxation. Updates to the TDS software, implemented in December 2024, now ensure accurate TDS calculations for Q4 of FY 2024-25.A STEP TOWARD TAXPAYER CONFIDENCE With the 2025 Budget on the horizon, stakeholders hope for bolder reforms to simplify the tax regime further. Streamlining TDS-TCS processes could enhance compliance, ease financial stress, and boost confidence amongst taxpayers, paving the way for a fairer and more efficient system.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 2, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Can unregistered small businesses receive GST notices?The annual turnover threshold for GST registration is Rs 40 lakh for businesses supplying goods and Rs 20 lakh for service providers. Businesses below these limits are exempt, but exceeding them triggers registration and compliance requirements.
Content: A recent report highlighted that the Gujarat State GST department has intensified its focus on business-to-consumer (B2C) sectors, aiming to close tax compliance gaps. Industries such as ice-cream parlours, salons, coaching classes, and mobile phone dealers are under the scanner for potential tax evasion and non-compliance.Recent raids across Gujarat exposed tax evasion worth Rs 20 crore, reported The Times of India. Officials revealed that while many registered traders underreport income, a large number of unregistered businesses exceed the GST registration threshold without complying.advertisementThis raises an important question: can unregistered small businesses receive GST notices? A recent report highlighted that the Gujarat State GST department has intensified its focus on business-to-consumer (B2C) sectors, aiming to close tax compliance gaps. Industries such as ice-cream parlours, salons, coaching classes, and mobile phone dealers are under the scanner for potential tax evasion and non-compliance. Recent raids across Gujarat exposed tax evasion worth Rs 20 crore, reported The Times of India. Officials revealed that while many registered traders underreport income, a large number of unregistered businesses exceed the GST registration threshold without complying. This raises an important question: can unregistered small businesses receive GST notices? Under the Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST) Act, 2017, GST authorities are empowered to scrutinise, audit, and assess businesses regardless of their registration status. Supreme Kothari, Partner at Economic Laws Practice, states: “GST laws allow authorities to issue notices to unregistered businesses whose turnover exceeds the prescribed threshold. Sections 65 and 67 enable audits, inspections, and searches.” The annual turnover threshold for GST registration is Rs 40 lakh for businesses supplying goods and Rs 20 lakh for service providers. Businesses below these limits are exempt, but exceeding them triggers registration and compliance requirements. The department employs several methods to monitor unregistered dealers, including analyzing e-way bills, tracking transactions in personal accounts, and identifying income discrepancies. SR Patnaik, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, explains: “While issuing notices to small businesses is legally valid, enforcement may depend on socio-economic and political factors.” GST compliance can be challenging for small businesses that lack organized operations. Record-keeping, filing returns, and hiring professionals can be resource-intensive. However, registered businesses gain access to input tax credits, reducing overall costs over time. Umesh Goel, Partner at Ved Jain & Associates, suggests: “Small businesses can leverage schemes like the composition scheme, which simplifies compliance processes.” Experts recommend that small businesses monitor their turnover, maintain accurate records, and register promptly once thresholds are crossed. Proactive compliance is essential, as the GST department can cross-reference bank transactions and other data sources to detect non-compliance. As the tax net expands, awareness and adherence to GST regulations are critical for small businesses. With proper guidance and compliance, businesses can benefit from a structured tax framework while avoiding penalties and scrutiny.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 3, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Stocks to watch today: Zee, DMart, IRFC, ITC, Bharti Airtel, Hero MotoCorpAs markets open today, several companies such as Zee, DMart, IRFC, ITC, Bharti Airtel, Hero MotoCorp are expected to grab attention due to key updates.
Content: Stock markets saw a strong session on Thursday, with benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty rallying nearly 2%. Gains were supported by robust performances in the auto, financial, and IT sectors. Auto stocks led the surge, buoyed by positive December sales data, while IT stocks rose on favourable brokerage predictions ahead of the Q3 earnings season. As markets open today, several companies such as Zee, DMart, IRFC, ITC, Bharti Airtel, Hero MotoCorp are expected to grab attention due to key updates. Zee Entertainment Enterprises is under focus after Sebi dismissed settlement applications filed by the company and its Managing Director, Punit Goenka. The regulator has referred the case for further investigation, which could influence investor sentiment towards the stock. Avenue Supermarts, the operator of retail chain DMart, reported a 17% year-on-year rise in standalone revenue for the quarter ending December 2024. This strong performance may drive movement in its stock price. Meanwhile, ITC is in the spotlight as today is the last trading day to qualify for receiving ITC Hotels shares. The record date for the de-merger is set for January 6. Hero MotoCorp reported a 17% drop in its total sales for December, with sales standing at 3.24 lakh units. Domestic sales were down 22% year-on-year, which could weigh on the stock. Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) has entered into an agreement with REMCL to collaborate on financing renewable energy projects. This initiative aligns with the government’s focus on clean energy and may offer long-term benefits for the company. Biocon Pharma, a subsidiary of Biocon, has received approval from China’s National Medical Products Administration for its Tacrolimus capsules. This medication is used to prevent organ rejection in transplant patients, and this development is expected to enhance Biocon’s global footprint. NHPC has received a payment of Rs 250 crore under its mega insurance policy for business interruption losses caused by a flash flood in October at the Teesta-V Power Station. This update reflects the company’s progress in addressing the challenges posed by natural disasters. Bharti Airtel has announced an acquisition of a 26% stake in AMP Energy Green Three for Rs 37.89 crore. The company is moving towards renewable energy by forming a captive power plant under a special-purpose vehicle. This investment highlights Airtel’s commitment to sustainable energy solutions. Varun Beverages, the bottler for PepsiCo, invested Rs 413 crore in its South African arm, The Beverage Company Proprietary. This move strengthens its presence in international markets and may influence its stock performance. Pricol’s board approved the divestment of its wiping business division to Auto Ignition for Rs 20 crore, marking a strategic shift in its operations. Wockhardt has gained approval for its new oral antibiotic Miqnaf from the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation. The drug is used to treat bacterial pneumonia, and this development could improve the company’s pharmaceutical offerings. Other updates include RITES securing a work order worth Rs 69.78 crore for repairing locomotives over three years. PB Fintech has set up a new subsidiary named PB Healthcare Services, signalling diversification into the healthcare sector. Allcargo Logistics liquidated its step-down subsidiary in Mexico, CELM Logistics SA de CV, effective December 12, 2024. Swan Energy has renamed its Reliance Naval and Engineering division to Swan Defence and Heavy Industries, reflecting a broader focus on defence. Additionally, state-run MOIL achieved its best-ever quarterly performance for Q3 and the first nine months of the financial year ending December 2024Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 3, 2025

Headline: Kabeer Biswas may call it quits as Dunzo battles cash crisis: Report The Bengaluru-based quick commerce platform has faced a challenging period over the last 12–18 months, marked by cash flow issues and difficulties in raising fresh funds.
Content: Kabeer Biswas, the last remaining cofounder and current CEO of Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo, may leave the company, according to a report by The Economic Times. Discussions regarding his exit have reportedly taken place with investors amid the company’s ongoing financial struggles. The Bengaluru-based quick commerce platform has faced a challenging period over the last 12–18 months, marked by cash flow issues and difficulties in raising fresh funds. These challenges come as rivals like Zomato’s Blinkit, Swiggy’s Instamart, and Zepto continue to grow rapidly, and the entry of e-commerce giants such as Flipkart, Amazon, further intensifying competition in the quick commerce sector.  According to sources cited in the report, Biswas has expressed interest in moving on from Dunzo, though a consensus among stakeholders is yet to be reached. Some investors are reportedly open to the idea, considering the company’s current state. “There have been talks from him (Kabeer) about moving on from Dunzo, and a consensus needs to be reached. Some investors have not opposed the idea given the state of affairs at the firm,” said a person familiar with the matter. “There have been talks from him (Kabeer) about moving on from Dunzo, and a consensus needs to be reached. Some investors have not opposed the idea given the state of affairs at the firm” one person familiar with the matter said as quoted in the report. Another source mentioned in the report said that discussions around what happens to Biswas’s remaining stake in the company are ongoing. However, Reliance Retail, which holds a 25.8% stake in Dunzo, has not yet approved the proposal but continues to engage in discussions. Dunzo, once a pioneer in hyperlocal deliveries, has raised over $450 million in funding, including debt. Its most significant investment came from Reliance Retail in January 2022, when the conglomerate invested Rs 200 crore as part of a Rs 240 crore funding round. At the time, Reliance’s backing was seen as a strong endorsement of both Dunzo and the quick commerce sector. Google, another key investor, owns just under 20% of the company. Despite these investments, Dunzo has faced a severe cash crunch since 2023. The company has undergone multiple rounds of layoffs and salary delays as it scaled back operations significantly. While Dunzo managed to secure debt financing to keep its daily operations afloat, creditors have since taken the company to the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) over unpaid dues. “They are facilitating some courier delivery services, but nothing much is left there anymore,” said one of the sources cited in the report. The situation has also prompted former Dunzo executives to explore new ventures in the quick commerce space, as the company’s dominance in the sector diminishes. The future of Biswas’s role at Dunzo, along with the direction the company will take, is now largely dependent on Reliance Retail’s decision. While neither Reliance Retail nor Biswas has confirmed the developments, the report suggests that some shareholders, who have already written off their investments in Dunzo, are willing to allow Biswas to move on.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 3, 2025

Headline: Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Check allotment status, GMP and listing dateIndo Farm Equipment IPO allotment: Investors who wish to check Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment can do so by visiting the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the registrar's online portal, which is Mas Services Limited.
Content: Allotment of shares for Indo Farm Equipment IPO will be finalised on Friday after the public listing received massive subscription at the end of its 3-day bidding process.  Indo Farm Equipment IPO opened for bidding on December 31, 2024 and closed for subscription on January 2, 2025.  The Indo Farm Equipment IPO saw bumper investor interest, achieving one of the highest subscription rates in recent times on its final day. This performance stands out alongside other notable IPOs, such as Vibhor Steel Tubes in February 2024, which was subscribed over 320 times, and Manba Finance in September 2024, with a subscription of 224 times. Indo Farm Equipment IPO was subscribed 227.67 times overall. In the retail category, it received 101.79 times the bids, while the Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) segment was subscribed 242.4 times. The Non-Institutional Investors (NII) category saw exceptional demand, with a subscription rate of 501.75 times.HOW TO CHECK ALLOTMENT STATUS Investors who wish to check Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment can do so by visiting the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the registrar's online portal, which is Mas Services Limited.  BSE WEBSITE Visit the BSE allotment status page. Under "Issue Type," select Equity. From the dropdown menu, choose 'Indo Farm Equipment Limited' under Issue Name. Enter your application number and PAN card details. Complete the captcha and click 'Search.' REGISTRAR ONLINE PORTAL  Go to the IPO allotment section on the official website of Mas Financial Services Ltd. From the dropdown menu, select 'Indo Farm Equipment.' Provide your details, such as your PAN or DP/Client ID. Click the ‘Submit’ button to view your allotment status.INDO FARM EQUIPMENT LATEST GMP  On the allotment day, the grey market premium (GMP) for the Indo Farm Equipment IPO peaked in the unofficial market. As of January 3, 2025, at 6:58 AM, the latest GMP stood at Rs 96. With the IPO's price band set at Rs 215, the estimated listing price is Rs 311, calculated by adding the cap price and the current GMP. This suggests a potential gain of 44.65% per share. The IPO had a price band of Rs 204-215 per share and aimed to raise Rs 260.15 crore. It offered 84,70,000 shares but has received bid for 1,92,83,39,964 shares, raking in Rs 41,459.31 crore.  Indo Farm Equipment, established in 1994, manufactures tractors, cranes, and harvesting equipment under its brands Indo Farm and Indo Power. The company exports its products to markets including Nepal, Sudan, Bangladesh, and Myanmar, among others. Indo Farm Equipment shares are scheduled to list on the NSE and BSE on January 7, 2025.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 3, 2025

Headline: DMart share price jumps 14% in early trade: Should you buy?DMart share price: The stock, which closed at Rs 3,617.75 in the previous session, rose to a high of Rs 4,165.00 during intraday trading.
Content: Shares of Avenue Supermarts Ltd., the operator of retail chain DMart, surged over 14% in early trade on Friday after the company shared a positive business update for the October-December period of FY2024-25. The stock, which closed at Rs 3,617.75 in the previous session, rose to a high of Rs 4,165.00 during intraday trading. Despite this strong performance, the stock remains far below its 52-week high of Rs 5,484.00, recorded on 24 September 2024. At the time of writing, DMart’s market capitalisation stood at Rs 2,66,800.56 crore and the shares were trading at Rs 4,134, up 14.27%.  DMart reported standalone revenue from operations of Rs 15,565.23 crore for the December quarter, reflecting a 17.5% year-on-year growth compared to Rs 13,247 crore in the same period last year. The company’s total store count stood at 387 as of 31 December 2024, marking an increase in its retail presence. By 9:20 am, Avenue Supermarts’ stock price was up 10% at Rs 3,972.2 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE).BROKERAGE VIEWS The revenue growth has drawn mixed reactions from brokerage firms, with some maintaining cautious outlooks while others remain optimistic. Morgan Stanley retained its bearish view, pointing out that the growth rate is below DMart’s historical 20% top-line growth. However, the brokerage acknowledged that standalone Q3 revenue was 1% higher than its expectations. The growth was attributed to a 12% increase in store count, while the implied same-store sales growth (SSSG) was around 5.5%, exceeding its estimate of 4%. Morgan Stanley reiterated a target price of Rs 3,702 per share, indicating a modest upside of 4%. Macquarie echoed concerns about competitive pressures from the quick commerce sector, which it believes are weighing on DMart’s growth. The brokerage also noted that Q3 typically sees an improvement in gross margins due to a better product mix. While DMart’s addition of 10 stores during the quarter was in line with estimates, Macquarie continues to adopt a cautious stance. On the other hand, Hong Kong-based CLSA remains optimistic about Avenue Supermarts’ performance. The brokerage has maintained its “outperform” rating, with a target price of Rs 5,360 per share, suggesting a 50% upside. CLSA highlighted that DMart’s standalone revenue exceeded its expectations and reiterated confidence in the company’s strategy of focusing on private labels. These in-house brands are seen as a key factor in countering competition and boosting profitability. In Q2FY25, Avenue Supermarts reported a net profit of Rs 659.6 crore, a 5.8% increase compared to Rs 623.6 crore in the same quarter last year. Revenue for the quarter rose 14.4% year-on-year to Rs 14,444.5 crore, up from Rs 12,624.4 crore. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 3, 2025

Headline: Sensex drops 400 points; Nifty slips below 24,100 in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 452.52 points to 79,491.29, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 93.25 points to 24,095.40 as of 9:42 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices fell on Friday in early trade after witnessing a rally in the previous session. IT, pharma, and banking stocks dragged the indices lower.  The S&P BSE Sensex lost 452.52 points to 79,491.29, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 93.25 points to 24,095.40 as of 9:42 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that the uncanny ability of the market to surprise was evident in yesterday’s massive 445 point rally in Nifty. "Even though FII buying helped in the rally, at Rs 1506 crores net buying it was not good enough to trigger such a massive 1.8% rally in Nifty. Short covering in certain beaten down fundamentally strong stocks like the Bajaj Twins and sharp spurts in auto stocks assisted by better-than-expected December sales numbers have contributed to the rally. Largecaps outperforming smallcaps is a positive signal and may continue," he added.  In today's early market action, Oil and Natural Gas Corporation emerged as the top gainer, surging 2.55%, followed by Trent Limited with a gain of 1.68%. Titan Company advanced 1.29%, while Maruti Suzuki India rose 1.04%, and Tata Motors rounded out the top gainers with a 0.91% increase. On the declining side, Hero MotoCorp Limited faced the steepest fall of 2.19%, followed by Tech Mahindra which dropped 1.66%. Wipro Limited declined 1.53%, while HDFC Bank fell 1.42%, and Tata Consultancy Services decreased by 1.26%. "It is too early to conclude that FIIs will continue to buy. With dollar index at 109.25 and the U.S. 10-year yield at 4.56% the macro construct is not favourable for sustained FII buying. Impressive pick up in deposit growth augurs well for banking stocks which are fairly priced," said Vijayakumar.  In a largely bearish session today, several key sectors faced selling pressure while a few managed to stay in the green. Nifty IT took the biggest hit, falling 1.09%, while Nifty Bank declined 0.55%. The financial pack showed weakness with Nifty Financial Services dropping 0.63%, Nifty Private Bank falling 0.57%, and Nifty Financial Services 25/50 declining 0.30%. Nifty Healthcare Index slipped 0.59%, while Nifty Pharma lost 0.72%. Other declines included Nifty Realty (-0.31%), Nifty FMCG (-0.34%), Nifty Auto (-0.17%), and Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom (-0.26%). However, some sectors provided relief to investors, with Nifty Media leading the gains with a jump of 1.57%, followed by Nifty PSU Bank which rose 1.13%. Nifty Consumer Durables showed strength with a 0.82% increase, while Nifty Oil & Gas gained 0.62%. Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank added 0.25%, Nifty Midsmall Financial Services rose 0.28%, and Nifty Metal edged up by 0.08%, while Nifty Midsmall Healthcare barely stayed positive with a 0.01% gain.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 3, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO: Check price band, GMP today  Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO last day: The initial public offering (IPO) of Leo Dry Fruits and Spices will close for bidding on Friday after having opened for subscription on January 1, 2025.
Content: The IPO of Leo Dry Fruits and Spices is set to close for bidding on Friday. This SME IPO, aiming to raise Rs 25.12 crore, is a book-built issue and consists entirely of a fresh issue of 48.30 lakh shares. The bidding for Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO began on January 1, 2025 and will end on January 3, 2025. Investors eagerly await the allotment date, expected on Monday, January 6, 2025. The company's shares are set to list on the BSE SME platform, with the tentative listing date scheduled for Wednesday, January 8, 2025. The price band for the IPO is set between Rs 51 and Rs 52 per share. Retail investors can apply for a minimum lot size of 2,000 shares, requiring an investment of Rs 1,04,000. For High Net Worth Individuals (HNIs), the minimum investment is two lots (4,000 shares), amounting to Rs 2,08,000. Shreni Shares Limited is the book-running lead manager for the issue, while Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd is the registrar. The market-making activities for the IPO are being handled by Rikhav Securities Limited.SUBSCRIPTION & GMP By the morning of Day 3, the Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO had been subscribed 25.5 times overall. The retail portion saw significant interest, with a subscription of 36.59 times, while the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) category was subscribed 31.48 times. The Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) category, however, showed more moderate interest, with a subscription of 1.01 times. As of 3 January 2025, the latest GMP for the Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO is Rs 18. Based on the upper price band of Rs 52 per share, the estimated listing price is Rs 70 per share. This translates to an expected gain of 34.62% on listing. Leo Dry Fruits and Spices is a well-known name in the dry fruits and spices market, offering a range of high-quality products. The funds raised through the IPO will be used for working capital requirements, expansion plans, and other corporate purposes.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 3, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: 5 top expectations of senior citizens Budget 2025 can ease senior citizens' burdens with higher tax exemptions, simpler processes, and targeted benefits for financial security.
Content: As the Union Budget 2025 approaches, taxpayers are eager to see what Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has in store. While much attention is often directed towards the salaried class, senior citizens face unique financial challenges that demand attention. With rising medical expenses and inflation eating into their savings, targeted tax benefits and simplified processes could significantly ease their burden. Here are five potential measures that could make a meaningful difference for senior citizens.advertisementEASIER TAX FILING PROCESSES Senior citizens aged 75 and above currently enjoy exemptions from filing income-tax returns if their income comes solely from pensions and interest from specific banks. Lowering the age threshold for this exemption and introducing simplified tax return forms for those with diverse income sources would reduce compliance complexities.INCREASED TAX EXEMPTION LIMITS The basic exemption limit for senior citizens has remained unchanged for some time. Increasing these limits under the newer tax regime could provide significant relief and encourage more seniors to adopt the simplified tax framework, ensuring better financial security.ADJUSTED TDS THRESHOLDS Banks and financial institutions deduct tax at source on interest income above a certain limit. Aligning this threshold with basic exemption limits would help reduce unnecessary deductions and the need for filing refunds, easing the financial strain on seniors.ENHANCED SAVINGS SCHEME BENEFITS Interest earned from senior citizens’ savings schemes and post-office savings accounts forms a critical part of their income. Increasing tax exemptions on these sources would directly alleviate financial stress, providing much-needed relief to this demographic.BETTER DEDUCTIONS FOR MEDICAL COSTS Healthcare expenses form a significant portion of senior citizens’ spending. By enhancing deductions for health insurance premiums and out-of-pocket medical expenses, the Budget could address this concern, ensuring seniors have access to necessary medical care without undue financial strain. The Union Budget 2025 offers a crucial opportunity to address senior citizens’ financial needs. By introducing higher exemptions, streamlined compliance processes, and targeted tax benefits, the government can provide much-needed relief to ensure a secure and dignified life for India’s elderly population.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 3, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Explained: Why Jai Corp share price hit 52-week low todayThe steep decline in Jai Corp's share price over two sessions stems from a significant capital reduction proposal involving Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL), where Jai Corp holds a 32% equity stake.
Content: Shares of Jai Corp Ltd extended their losses on Friday, hitting a 52-week low in early trade. The stock, which plunged 20% in the previous session, fell another 16% to touch an intraday low of Rs 207.60 before recovering slightly to trade 8% lower at Rs 228.10 around 12 pm. The steep decline in Jai Corp’s share price over two sessions stems from a significant capital reduction proposal involving Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL), where Jai Corp holds a 32% equity stake. On Thursday, the company informed stock exchanges that UIHPL plans to hold an extraordinary general meeting (EGM) to seek shareholder approval for the proposed capital reduction. The move is subject to clearance from the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) and other regulatory bodies. Once approved, Jai Corp is expected to receive approximately Rs 364 crore from the process. The announcement follows a recent transaction involving Dronagiri Infrastructure Private Limited (DIPL), a subsidiary of UIHPL. DIPL sold a 74% equity stake in Navi Mumbai IIA Private Limited to Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) for Rs 1,628.03 crore, with the City and Industrial Development Corporation (CIDCO) retaining a 26% stake. This deal materialised after CIDCO waived its rights of first refusal earlier in December. As part of the capital reduction process, UIHPL is set to receive at least Rs 1,492.50 crore from DIPL, a figure that may increase with interest earnings on surplus funds. Additionally, UIHPL anticipates Rs 682 crore from redeeming optionally fully convertible debentures in Vinamra Universal Traders Private Limited, bringing the total funds to a minimum of Rs 3,772 crore. UIHPL plans to reduce 99.76% of its share capital, comprising equity and fully compulsorily convertible preference shares, distributing Rs 3,746.87 crore proportionately among its shareholders. This restructuring has raised investor concerns, leading to heightened selling pressure on Jai Corp shares, which have plunged nearly 27% in just three trading sessions. Investors remain cautious as they await further clarity on the restructuring process and its implicationsPublished By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 3, 2025

Headline: 5 tax-saving tips for young professionals in 2025Proactive financial planning helps young professionals save taxes, build wealth, and reach goals with strategies like early planning, goal-based investing, and health insurance, etc.
Content: As a young professional stepping into the world of earnings, navigating the complexities of income tax can be overwhelming. While seasoned employees often know the ropes of tax-saving strategies, fresh earners may find themselves confused or make hasty decisions. Proactive financial planning is the key to maximising savings and ensuring a secure future. Here are five essential strategies to help you save on taxes and achieve your financial goals.advertisementLEVERAGE EQUITY-LINKED SAVINGS SCHEMES (ELSS)ELSS mutual funds offer a dual advantage of tax savings and investment growth. These schemes allow you to invest in diversified equity markets while enjoying tax deductions under the relevant provisions of the Income Tax Act. They are an ideal option for long-term wealth creation and tax efficiency. SECURE HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFITS ELSS mutual funds offer a dual advantage of tax savings and investment growth. These schemes allow you to invest in diversified equity markets while enjoying tax deductions under the relevant provisions of the Income Tax Act. They are an ideal option for long-term wealth creation and tax efficiency. SECURE HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFITS Health insurance is not just a safeguard against rising medical costs but also a valuable tax-saving tool. Paying premiums for yourself and your family allows you to claim deductions and lower your taxable income, offering a dual benefit for your health and finances.PLAN YOUR FINANCES EARLY Tax-saving should begin with a comprehensive financial plan, even if your income falls below the taxable limit. Filing income tax returns, regardless of liability, helps create a documented financial history. This record becomes invaluable when applying for loans or credit products in the future.SET CLEAR INVESTMENT GOALS Every investment should have a defined objective. Whether it’s buying a car, saving for a home, or building a retirement corpus, align your investments with your targets. Opt for instruments that offer both tax benefits and potential returns to maximise value.STAY PROACTIVE IN TAX PLANNING Avoid the last-minute scramble by starting your tax planning early in the financial year. This approach gives you ample time to explore suitable options and make informed decisions. Timely filing of income tax returns is equally important to avoid penalties and ensure compliance. Tax-saving is more than a compliance exercise; it’s an opportunity to secure your financial future. By adopting these strategies, young professionals can make smarter decisions, reduce their tax burden, and confidently navigate their journey toward financial independence.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 3, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex tumbles 600 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatilityThe downturn highlights the persistent volatility on Dalal Street, with investors uncertain about the short-term market trajectory. While auto and IT stocks had propelled a rally just a day ago, profit booking amid prevailing uncertainty appears to have weighed heavily on sentiment.
Content: Benchmark indices in the Indian stock market saw a sharp decline on Friday, reversing the bullish momentum from the previous session. At 10:50 am, the S&P BSE Sensex dropped by 608.97 points, settling at 79,334.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 174.40 points, trading at 24,014.25.The downturn highlights the persistent volatility on Dalal Street, with investors uncertain about the short-term market trajectory. While auto and IT stocks had propelled a rally just a day ago, profit booking amid prevailing uncertainty appears to have weighed heavily on sentiment. Here are three key factors contributing to today’s decline:IT AND FINANCIAL STOCKS DIPadvertisementAfter rallying strongly in the previous session, IT and financial stocks faced significant profit booking in early trade on Friday. Market experts attributed the dip to investor caution ahead of the corporate earnings season, which typically brings heightened market fluctuations. Benchmark indices in the Indian stock market saw a sharp decline on Friday, reversing the bullish momentum from the previous session. At 10:50 am, the S&P BSE Sensex dropped by 608.97 points, settling at 79,334.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 174.40 points, trading at 24,014.25. The downturn highlights the persistent volatility on Dalal Street, with investors uncertain about the short-term market trajectory. While auto and IT stocks had propelled a rally just a day ago, profit booking amid prevailing uncertainty appears to have weighed heavily on sentiment. Here are three key factors contributing to today’s decline:IT AND FINANCIAL STOCKS DIP After rallying strongly in the previous session, IT and financial stocks faced significant profit booking in early trade on Friday. Market experts attributed the dip to investor caution ahead of the corporate earnings season, which typically brings heightened market fluctuations. The Nifty IT index plunged nearly 2%, making it the biggest loser among sectoral indices. Similarly, the Nifty Bank and Nifty Financial Services indices fell by almost 1% each, dragging down the broader market. This retreat followed a robust performance in the previous session, where the Nifty IT and Nifty Financial indices rose by 2.3% and 1.6%, respectively. Aditya Gaggar, Director at Progressive Shares, had forecasted a pullback in IT stocks and the benchmarks following the sharp rally, cautioning investors against over-optimism.DECLINE IN HDFC BANK, ICICI BANK AND TCS  Declines in heavyweight stocks exacerbated the fall in major indices. Shares of HDFC Bank, Infosys, TCS, and ICICI Bank all fell by over 1% during the session. Other notable losers included Wipro, Tech Mahindra, Hero MotoCorp, and Cipla. These large-cap stocks, which hold significant weight in the indices, were critical in dragging down the market, indicating a broader sell-off among blue-chip companies.Q3 EARNINGS ANXIETY Growing concerns over the upcoming Q3 corporate earnings season further dampened investor sentiment. Following a weak performance in the second quarter, analysts had highlighted that the Q3 results could set the tone for the market in the coming months. Although there is optimism that the Q3 earnings may show improvement, concerns persist that an earnings slowdown could extend for another couple of quarters. Analysts also pointed out that the trajectory of the stock market will likely hinge on announcements in the Union Budget 2025. A potential increase in government capital expenditure could drive new orders for companies, bolstering their earnings and improving stock performance over time. Today’s market decline underscores the heightened uncertainty and cautious sentiment among investors. As the corporate earnings season approaches and the Union Budget draws nearer, market participants will be closely watching for signs of stability and growth. For now, volatility continues to dominate the Indian stock market. Headline: Tata Motors share price rises 4%. Is it a good time to invest?Tata Motors stock: Over the past five trading sessions, Tata Motors has gained more than 6%. However, the stock has seen a decline of 18.36% in the last six months.
Content: Tata Motors share price surged by 4% during Friday’s afternoon session, reaching the day’s high of Rs 800.50. The stock had closed at Rs 764.95 in the previous session and opened at Rs 767.95. At the time of writing, the stock was trading at Rs 796.75, marking a gain of 4.16%. Tata Motors market capitalisation stood at Rs 2,93,201.60 crore. Despite today’s rise, the stock is below its 52-week high of Rs 1,179.05, recorded on July 30, 2024. Over the past five trading sessions, Tata Motors has gained more than 6%. However, the stock has seen a decline of 18.36% in the last six months. In the long term, Tata Motors has delivered an impressive return of 316.91% over the last five years.  The rise in Tata Motors’ share price on Friday marked its fourth consecutive session of gains. This momentum was partly influenced by global brokerage firm CLSA, which added Tata Motors to its India focus portfolio. CLSA noted that the stock’s 35% drop from its peak has already factored in potential risks, including a slowdown in the commercial vehicle segment and challenges in its Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) portfolio.BROKERAGE VIEWS Several brokerages have shared their views on Tata Motors, reflecting a mix of optimism and cautiousness. Nomura India: The brokerage has set a target price of Rs 990, suggesting a positive outlook for the stock. DAM Capital: It maintains a ‘buy’ call with a target price of Rs 870. The firm expects JLR’s volumes to grow at a CAGR of 6.5% between FY2025 and FY2027. However, DAM Capital’s bear case scenario targets a lower price of Rs 675, indicating a potential correction of 9% from Thursday’s closing price. Sharekhan: The firm has a bullish price target of Rs 1,099, citing expectations of continued improvement in JLR, passenger vehicle (PV), and commercial vehicle (CV) businesses, along with reduced automotive debt. Sharekhan noted that the stock trades at a P/E multiple of 12.2x and EV/EBITDA multiple of 5.3x for its FY2027 estimates. LKP Securities: The brokerage considers Tata Motors a ‘value buy’ at current levels. It has a price target of Rs 970, citing recovery in domestic CV demand and the impact of recent product launches. LKP also highlighted the stock’s correction of approximately 40% from its 52-week high, making it an attractive investment opportunity. Headline: Budget 2025: 5 key announcements India is waiting forBudget 2025 holds the potential to bring much-needed relief to the economy, addressing both long-term growth and immediate concerns like inflation.
Content: As the Union Budget 2025 approaches, anticipation is building across India. With a slowing GDP and rising inflation, all eyes are on Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to deliver bold strategies that will address these challenges and steer the country towards sustainable growth. The upcoming Budget is crucial, not just for long-term economic development, but for immediate relief to struggling sectors. Here's a look at the five key expectations from Budget 2025.advertisementTAX RELIEF FOR INDIVIDUALS A significant expectation is income tax relief to boost disposable income. Proposals include raising the exemption limit for individuals, which would encourage higher consumption and stimulate economic activity. Such a measure could provide immediate relief to the middle class, particularly as inflation and living costs continue to rise.REDUCTION IN EXCISE DUTY ON FUEL Despite global crude prices dropping, fuel prices have not decreased due to high excise duties. Industry experts believe that lowering these duties could alleviate inflationary pressures, increase disposable income, and improve consumption, particularly in lower-income households. This could significantly reduce the financial burden on the public.SUPPORT FOR EMPLOYMENT-INTENSIVE SECTORS To address unemployment, there’s a push to focus on employment-heavy industries such as garments, footwear, tourism, and MSMEs. By stimulating growth in these sectors, the government could generate jobs, boost domestic production, and position India as a stronger player in global markets.BOOSTING RURAL CONSUMPTION AND FOOD SECURITY With rural areas showing signs of recovery, boosting rural consumption remains a priority. Proposals include increasing daily wages under employment schemes, enhancing direct benefit transfers, and offering consumption vouchers for low-income families to increase purchasing power and demand in rural markets.ADDRESSING DUMPING BY CHINA China’s practice of dumping excess goods in the global market has hurt Indian industries. Industry bodies are calling for protective measures to safeguard domestic businesses from unfair competition, ensuring that local industries can thrive without external distortions. With India eagerly awaiting Budget 2025, these proposed measures have the potential to boost economic growth, ease inflation, and create jobs. Bold interventions in key areas could help India overcome its current economic challenges and pave the way for a more prosperous future.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 3, 2025Must Watch

Headline: ITI share price soars over 12%, hits all-time high. Know whyITI stock price: Earlier, some analysts had advised investors to book profits as it was approaching a critical resistance zone. However, it has now surpassed the resistance zone and is likely to continue its upward momentum.
Content: ITI Ltd saw its stock surge over 12% to hit an all-time high of Rs 432.45 on January 3, 2025. At 12:53 pm, shares of the company were up 12.20% to Rs 427.55 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).  It may be noted that the company's shares have delivered a solid 37% return over the past year, outperforming the benchmark indices. The stock has gained 30% in the past 5 trading sessions and 49% over the past month. Earlier, some analysts had advised investors to book profits as it was approaching a critical resistance zone. However, it has now surpassed the resistance zone and is likely to continue its upward momentum.  From a technical perspective, ITI’s stock remains strong, trading above its 5-day, 10-day, 20-day, 50-day, 100-day, and 200-day simple moving averages (SMAs). Its 14-day relative strength index (RSI) stands at 66.27, indicating that the stock is nearing overbought territory. However, the stock’s fundamentals present a mixed picture. It has a negative price-to-equity (P/E) ratio of 74 and a price-to-book (P/B) value of over 24. Earnings per share (EPS) are negative at (-)5.22, with a return on equity (RoE) of (-)31.60, reflecting challenges in profitability. ITI is a central public sector undertaking under the Ministry of Communication, with the government holding a 90% stake in the firm. Headline: Oil India, ONGC shares jump 5% today. What's fuelling the rally?The rally can be attributed to global policy measures aimed at economic revival, which investors believe could boost fuel demand and enhance earnings for upstream oil companies.
Content: Shares of Oil India Ltd and ONGC (Oil & Natural Gas Corporation Ltd) surged up to 5% on Friday, buoyed by a sharp rise in crude oil prices, which reached their highest levels in over two months. The rally can be attributed to global policy measures aimed at economic revival, which investors believe could boost fuel demand and enhance earnings for upstream oil companies. Oil India’s stock climbed 4.88% to Rs 486.15 on the BSE at 12:33 pm, while ONGC’s shares advanced 4.67% to Rs 257.50. The surge in ONGC’s share price was further supported by a report from Jefferies, which set a target price of Rs 375, arguing that the recent 30% correction in ONGC’s stock price over the past three months appears excessive. The report highlighted that recent regulatory developments could drive profitability improvements. Despite the recent rally, upstream companies are expected to post subdued operating profits in Q3 due to a decline in net crude realisations. According to YES Securities, ONGC’s oil production may fall 4.7% year-on-year (YoY) in Q3, though gas production is likely to remain flat. Similarly, Oil India’s oil production is expected to be flat YoY, while gas production could see a marginal increase of 0.5% YoY. For the December quarter, YES Securities projects a net crude oil realisation of $73.2 per barrel for ONGC and $73.7 per barrel for Oil India. It also anticipates APM gas realisation at $6.5 per mmBtu for both companies. ONGC’s gas volumes are expected to remain flat YoY but rise 1.2% quarter-on-quarter (QoQ), while Oil India’s gas volumes may grow 0.5% YoY and 3.4% QoQ. However, the outlook for the current quarter appears brighter. Brent crude futures edged up 22 cents to $76.15 per barrel, marking their highest close since late October. Similarly, US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude rose 25 cents to $73.38 per barrel, hitting a two-month high. YES Securities noted that the oil and gas sector’s core performance in Q3FY25 could be mixed, with oil marketing companies and refiners potentially benefitting from stronger gross refining margins and improved marketing profits.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 3, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Date, time, and what to expectThe countdown to India's Union Budget 2025 has begun, with Nirmala Sitharaman set to present key policies and reforms on February 1.
Content: The countdown to India’s most significant financial event has begun. With the Union Budget 2025 on the horizon, the nation eagerly awaits the announcement of key policy changes, tax reforms, and welfare measures. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is all set to present the Union Budget, and the day is bound to set the stage for economic growth and governmental strategies. Here's everything you need to know about the Budget presentation and what to expect.advertisementDATE AND TIMING OF THE UNION BUDGET PRESENTATION This year, the Union Budget is most likely to be presented on February 1, 2025, continuing the long-standing tradition of presenting the budget on the first day of February. There were concerns about the date since February 1 falls on a Saturday this year. However, several precedents in the past show that the Union Budget has been presented on a Saturday. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will likely take the floor at 11:00 am, continuing her tradition of presenting the budget at this iconic time. This will mark her eighth presentation of the Union Budget, consisting of six full budgets and two interim budgets.STOCK MARKET OPERATIONS ON BUDGET DAY In a rare occurrence, the stock market will remain open for trading on Saturday, February 1, 2025. Both the National Stock Exchange (NSE) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) will function as usual from 9:15 am to 3:30 pm. Historically, this has been the case for Union Budget presentations falling on weekends, with markets remaining open to monitor any immediate market reactions to the Budget announcements.EXPECTATIONS FROM THE BUDGET The Union Budget 2025 will be crucial in shaping India’s economic landscape in the coming years. The Union Budget is expected to focus on the theme of 'Viksit Bharat' under Amrit Kaal. As the country strives for sustainable growth, the budget will be keenly observed for key fiscal policies, tax reforms, and steps towards boosting various sectors of the economy.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 3, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why KPI Green Energy shares are down 36% on some trading appsKPI Green Energy stock price: The stock declined 4.44% to trade at Rs 547 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at Rs 1:40 pm after hitting an intraday low of Rs 548.
Content: KPI Green Energy shares began trading on an ex-bonus basis on Friday following the company’s 1:2 bonus share issue. The stock declined 4.44% to trade at Rs 547 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at Rs 1:40 pm after hitting an intraday low of Rs 548. In an exchange filing, the company noted, “Pursuant to Regulation 42 of Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, and relevant provisions of the Companies Act, 2013 and Rules made thereunder, the Company has fixed Friday, January 03, 2025, as the ‘Record Date’ for determining the eligibility of Shareholders entitled for issuance of Bonus Equity Shares in the proportion of 1 (One) Equity Share for every 2 (Two) existing Equity Shares." The sharp 36% drop shown on some trading apps likely stems from a recalibration of the stock price post-bonus issue. This adjustment accounts for the increased number of outstanding shares while keeping the company’s overall market capitalisation unchanged. Such price corrections are standard following bonus issues and do not signal any fundamental shift in the company’s financial position. The record date is crucial as it determines which shareholders qualify for the bonus shares. To be eligible, investors must own the stock at least one day before the ex-date since trades settle on a T+1 basis. Shares bought on the ex-date do not qualify for dividends, splits, or bonus issues. This marks the company’s third bonus share issuance in recent years. KPI Green Energy issued bonus shares in a 1:2 ratio in 2024 and a 1:1 ratio in 2023, according to Trendlyne. Despite the current dip, KPI Green Energy shares have surged 80% over the past year, underscoring their strong performance.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 3, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: 5 reforms that could make new tax regime a better deal for youThe government is expected to focus on boosting consumption, given the low GDP for the second quarter, which could lead to tax relief measures aimed at increasing disposable income for salaried taxpayers.
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is expected to present the Union Budget 2025 on February 1, 2025. Taxpayers are eagerly awaiting potential changes to ease their financial burden, especially as inflation has raised the cost of living. The government is expected to focus on boosting consumption, given the low GDP for the second quarter, which could lead to tax relief measures aimed at increasing disposable income for salaried taxpayers. The new tax regime is expected to take centre stage in the budget, with reforms designed to make it a more attractive alternative to the traditional tax structure.POSSIBLE REFORMS IN THE NEW TAX REGIME The upcoming budget could include several changes to the new tax regime to simplify compliance and reduce the tax burden for individual taxpayers. According to tax experts, one significant proposal is raising the income exemption threshold from Rs 7 lakh to Rs 8 lakh or higher. There is also speculation about increasing the standard deduction for salaried individuals from Rs 75,000 to Rs 1 lakh. Tushar Kumar, an advocate at the Supreme Court of India, said, “The government might rationalise income tax slabs or reduce tax rates for middle-income earners. This would boost disposable income and encourage economic activity. Introducing deductions for contributions to the National Pension Scheme (NPS) or interest on housing loans could incentivise taxpayers further." Additionally, family-centric tax reliefs, such as deductions for educational expenses or medical insurance premiums, might be introduced. The government is also considering recalibrating concessional tax rates for income brackets between Rs 7 lakh and Rs 15 lakh. This could provide significant relief to middle-income taxpayers and encourage more people to switch to the new regime. Although the focus is on modernising the new tax regime, the old tax structure is unlikely to be overlooked. Many taxpayers still prefer the traditional system due to its established deductions and exemptions. Experts suggest that the government could increase the Section 80C deduction limit from Rs 1.5 lakh to Rs 2 lakh and raise the ceiling on housing loan interest deductions under Section 24(b) from Rs 2 lakh to Rs 3 lakh. Additional changes might include higher deductions under Section 80D for medical insurance premiums and more relief for individuals with dependents who have disabilities under Section 80DD. These measures would ensure that the old tax regime remains a viable option for those who benefit from its provisions. Some experts believe the new tax regime is unlikely to introduce many additional deductions, as it aims to keep taxation straightforward. Sudhir Kaushik, Co-Founder and CEO of Taxspanner, said, “The focus is on offering straightforward taxation with reduced rates. Taxpayers who prioritise deductions for savings or expenses may prefer the old tax regime.” Others are optimistic about provisions that could benefit specific sectors. Kunal Savani, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, said, “While the new tax regime offers broader slabs, it comes with restrictive deductions by default. However, we can expect welcoming provisions, especially for the real estate segment, which is growing significantly. This could include an increase in home loan deductions and a rationalisation of House Rent Allowance (HRA).”Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 3, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty fall nearly 1% as IT, banking stocks tumble in volatile day The S&P BSE Sensex plunged 720.60 points to end at 79,223.11, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 199.60 points to end at 23,989.05.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices saw a volatile session as Sensex, Nifty ended the week falling nearly 1% on Friday. The major laggards that pulled the market down were shares in the IT, banking, financials and pharma sectors.  The S&P BSE Sensex plunged 720.60 points to end at 79,223.11, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 183.90 points to end at 24,004.75.  Trivesh, COO Tradejini, said that the much-anticipated Santa Claus rally didn’t materialise this year, but the New Year's rally did make a brief appearance, lasting for just a day.  "Today’s decline can be attributed to profit booking in the IT and financial sectors, where selling pressure was evident after the index tested resistance near 24,196. While major banks continued to display resilience with steady inflows, broader market sentiment reflected caution. Additionally, global cues played a role, with the US markets’ five-day consecutive fall impacting sentiment, even as Asian markets showed resistance," he added.  In today's choppy trading session, Oil and Natural Gas Corporation delivered a stellar performance, surging 5.11%, while Tata Motors showed strong momentum with a rise of 3.13%. SBI Life Insurance Company advanced 1.95%, followed by Titan Company which gained 1.80%, and Nestle India Limited which added 1.40%. On the losing side, technology and banking stocks faced pressure, with Wipro Limited leading the declines, dropping 2.83%. HDFC Bank fell 2.53%, while Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone declined 2.30%. Tech Mahindra slipped 2.11%, and Cipla rounded out the top losers with a decrease of 1.98%. Most sectoral indices ended in the red, though a few sectors managed to buck the trend. The banking pack faced significant pressure, with Nifty Bank dropping 1.26% and Nifty Private Bank falling 1.00%. Nifty Financial Services lost 1.25%, while its counterpart Nifty Financial Services 25/50 declined 0.61%. Headline: GST on vouchers and gift cards: All you need to knowGift vouchers are exempt from GST, but commissions and services linked to them remain taxable under GST rules.
Content:
Gift vouchers and prepaid cards have become popular payment tools for consumers, but their tax implications often raise questions. The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) classifies these as prepaid instruments, and the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has clarified their treatment under the Goods and Services Tax (GST) framework. Here’s a breakdown of how GST applies to vouchers, along with insights for businesses.advertisementPREPAID VOUCHERS: TREATED AS ‘MONEY’Prepaid vouchers, including gift cards and digital wallets, are considered ‘money’ under the GST framework. Prepaid vouchers, including gift cards and digital wallets, are considered ‘money’ under the GST framework. Transactions involving these instruments are not treated as the supply of goods or services. Instead, they are viewed as a method of payment, similar to cash, and therefore, exempt from GST.NON-PREPAID VOUCHERS: ACTIONABLE CLAIMS Non-prepaid vouchers, which allow holders to redeem specific goods or services, are classified as ‘actionable claims.’ These transactions are also excluded from GST since they do not involve the supply of goods or services.GST ON VOUCHER TRANSACTIONS While the vouchers themselves are not subject to GST, the goods or services redeemed using them may attract GST. For instance, if a customer uses a Rs 10,000 voucher to purchase goods, GST applies to the purchased items, not the voucher.VOUCHER DISTRIBUTION MODELS AND GST Principal-to-Principal Basis:
Distributors buying vouchers at discounted rates and reselling them are not subject to GST since these transactions do not qualify as the supply of goods or services. Commission/Fee Basis:
Distributors working on behalf of issuers and earning commissions for marketing or support services must pay GST on their service fees.UNUSED VOUCHERS AND ADDITIONAL SERVICES If vouchers expire unused, no supply of goods or services occurs, exempting them from GST. However, distributors offering additional services like advertising or customer support to voucher issuers must pay GST on their service fees. The CBIC's clarifications simplify voucher taxation but require businesses to understand their specific scenarios. While vouchers themselves don’t trigger GST, commissions and related services do. Upcoming amendments to the GST framework may provide further clarity, ensuring businesses remain compliant and avoid ambiguities.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 3, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Budget 2025: Key proposals for FDs, and long-term savingsTax incentives for fixed deposits and boost middle-class savings could redefine savings strategies in Budget 2025.
Content: As the Union Budget 2025 approaches, expectations rise for measures that can stimulate middle-class savings and rejuvenate the banking sector. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman recently met with representatives from the financial sector to deliberate on tax incentives for fixed deposits (FDs), amongst other investment tools. Here's a closer look at the discussions and proposals shaping this narrative.advertisementTAX RELIEF FOR FIXED DEPOSITSRepresentatives from banks and capital markets proposed treating FD interest as distinct from regular income tax or linking it to long-term capital gains tax. Representatives from banks and capital markets proposed treating FD interest as distinct from regular income tax or linking it to long-term capital gains tax. Such measures could make FDs more attractive, addressing declining deposit growth and encouraging middle-class savings. Currently, FD interest is taxed as regular income, which may deter potential investors.BOLSTERING CAPITAL MARKETS Radhika Gupta, CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, emphasised the need for greater efficiency and inclusivity in capital markets. She proposed incentives for long-term savings through bonds and equity investments, aligning with the government's broader goals of financial inclusion.TAXATION AND COMPLIANCE FOR FDs Interest earned on FDs is categorised as "Income from Other Sources" under the Income Tax Act and taxed according to individual tax slabs. To simplify tax compliance, individuals should gather essential documents like interest certificates and Form 26AS. Submitting Form 15G or 15H at the start of the financial year can help eligible individuals and senior citizens avoid Tax Deducted at Source (TDS).MUTUAL FUNDS: A GROWING CONTENDER While FDs remain a staple for household savings, their dominance is waning. Nearly 15% of household savings still flow into FDs, but mutual funds and equities are gaining ground. RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has highlighted the shift towards these avenues, urging banks to innovate and bridge the gap between credit and deposit growth. Budget 2025 presents an opportunity to balance traditional and modern savings instruments. By introducing tax incentives for FDs and enhancing capital market inclusivity, the government can bolster middle-class savings while addressing broader economic goals. A reimagined framework for savings could provide the much-needed impetus for both individuals and the financial sector.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 3, 2025Must Watch

Headline: No entry to unmarried couples: OYO changes check-in rules, starting in MeerutOYO's new check-in policy, starting in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, restricts unmarried couples from booking rooms in partner hotels without valid relationship proof.
Content: OYO, one of India's leading travel and hotel booking platforms, on Sunday announced a major change in policy for its partner hotels, introducing guidelines that unmarried couples will no longer be able to check in at the properties. The new rule, the company said, will initially be applicable only in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. "We are committed to upholding safe and responsible hospitality practices. While respecting personal freedoms, we must also collaborate with local communities and law enforcement to ensure a harmonious operating environment," Pawas Sharma, Region Head, OYO North India said.  The updated guidelines, which will immediately affect OYO's partner hotels in Meerut, require all married couples to provide valid proof of relationship during check-in, including for online bookings.  The company also stated that unmarried couples may be denied accommodation, with discretion granted to hotel partners to decline bookings based on local social norms. The move, according to OYO, is part of a broader initiative to address community feedback and reshape its image as a safe and trusted accommodation provider for families, businessmen, students, religious pilgrims, and solo travellers. OYO's decision followed repeated appeals from civil society groups, particularly in Meerut, urging stricter regulations against stays by unmarried couples. Similar petitions have emerged from residents in other cities, prompting the firm to pilot the policy in Meerut and considering expanding it to other locations based on feedback. Alongside the revised policy, OYO has introduced several nationwide initiatives, including hosting joint seminars with the police and hotel partners on safe hospitality practices, blacklisting hotels found engaging in activities deemed immoral and taking action against unauthorised establishments misusing OYO branding. Published By: Sahil SinhaPublished On: Jan 5, 2025ALSO READ |  Oyo clocks first profitable year in FY24 with Rs 100 crore net profit

Headline: Standard Glass Lining IPO opens today: Check latest GMP, price band, key detailsStandard Glass Lining IPO price band is set at Rs 133-140 per share, with a lot size of 107 shares. Retail investors must invest at least Rs 14,980.
Content: Standard Glass Lining IPO will open for bidding on Monday, aiming to raise Rs 410.05 crore through its book-built issue, comprising a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 210 crore and an offer for sale of Rs 200.05 crore. Established in September 2012, Standard Glass Lining Technology Limited specialises in producing advanced engineering equipment tailored for India's pharmaceutical and chemical industries. What sets the company apart is its ability to handle every stage of production under one roof, ensuring quality and consistency throughout the process. The company offers comprehensive turnkey solutions to its clients. These include everything from conceptual design and engineering to manufacturing, assembly, and on-site installation. Additionally, it provides support with standard operating procedures, making it a one-stop partner for pharmaceutical and chemical manufacturers.PRICE BAND AND OTHER DETAILS The IPO (initial public offering) will remain open for bidding from January 6-8. Price band for Standard Glass Lining IPO has been set at Rs 133-140 per share, with a minimum lot size of 107 shares. Retail investors will need to invest at least Rs 14,980, while small NIIs must invest Rs 2,09,720 (14 lots) and large NIIs Rs 10,03,660 (67 lots). Standard Glass Lining successfully secured Rs 123.02 crore through its anchor investor segment ahead of its IPO launch. The company is led by its promoters, including Nageswara Rao Kandula, Kandula Krishna Veni, Kandula Ramakrishna, Venkata Mohana Rao Katragadda, Kudaravalli Punna Rao, and M/s S2 Engineering Services, reflecting a strong leadership team. The IPO is being managed by IIFL Securities Ltd and Motilal Oswal Investment Advisors Limited as the book-running lead managers. Meanwhile, KFin Technologies Limited has been appointed as the registrar for handling the allotment and refund process.LATEST GMP The grey market premium (GMP) for Standard Glass Lining's IPO has remained steady in recent days, showing no fluctuations. As of January 6, 2025, at 5:04 AM, the GMP stood at Rs 97. With a price band set at Rs 140, the anticipated listing price for the IPO is around Rs 237, calculated by adding the cap price and the current GMP. This projection suggests a potential gain of approximately 69.29% per share. The company plans to finalise the allotment on January 10 and list its shares on both NSE and BSE by January 14. Headline: Do banks owe you money? Check unclaimed deposits via UDGAM portalRBI (Reerve Bank of India) launched the Unclaimed Deposits – Gateway to Access Information (UDGAM) portal in August 2023.
Content: We’ve all had that delightful moment when we find a Rs 500 note tucked away in an old jacket or a forgotten pair of jeans. It feels like an unexpected bonus, doesn’t it? Now, imagine if that forgotten money wasn’t just a few hundred rupees, but potentially thousands or even lakhs lying idle in a bank account. That’s exactly what unclaimed deposits are – your money, sitting unnoticed. Unclaimed deposits amounting to a staggering Rs 78,213 crore are lying idle in various banks across the country as of March 2024, according to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). These funds, transferred to the Depositors' Education and Awareness Fund (DEAF), earn a simple interest of only 3% per annum, reducing the potential returns for depositors. To address this issue and make it easier for individuals to access their unclaimed funds, the RBI launched the Unclaimed Deposits – Gateway to Access Information (UDGAM) portal in August 2023. The platform helps users track and consolidate unclaimed deposits across different banks in one place.WHAT ARE UNCLAIMED DEPOSITS? Unclaimed deposits are funds lying in bank accounts that have been inactive for a long period. Here’s how this happens: Dormant accounts: Savings or current accounts become inactive if there is no activity for two years. Similarly, fixed and recurring deposits are considered dormant if not claimed within two years after maturity. Unclaimed deposits: If these accounts remain untouched for another eight years, the money is transferred to the DEAF, making them unclaimed deposits. These deposits often occur due to forgotten accounts, unclaimed fixed deposits, or the account holder's demise without proper succession planning.HOW UDGAM PORTAL HELPS The UDGAM portal is a one-stop platform developed by the RBI in collaboration with Reserve Bank Information Technology Pvt Ltd (ReBIT), Indian Financial Technology & Allied Services (IFTAS), and participating banks. It simplifies the process of finding unclaimed deposits across multiple banks. Currently, 30 banks are part of the portal, representing 90% of the total unclaimed deposits in terms of value. Banks already on the platform include State Bank of India, Punjab National Bank, South Indian Bank, Central Bank of India, Dhanlaxmi Bank, DBS Bank India, and CitiBank N.A. The remaining banks were added in phases, with full integration completed by October 15, 2023.HOW TO REGISTER ON THE UDGAM PORTAL To search for unclaimed deposits, users need to register on the UDGAM portal by following these steps: Visit the UDGAM Portal: Access the official website. Register an account: Enter your mobile number, name, password, and CAPTCHA code. Submit the details. An OTP will be sent to your mobile number for verification. Log In: Use your mobile number and password to log in. Enter another OTP sent to your mobile number. Search for deposits: Provide details such as the account holder’s name and the bank name(s). Include at least one of these search criteria: PAN, Voter ID, Driving Licence Number, Passport Number, or Date of Birth. Click "Search" to view your unclaimed deposits. The RBI launched UDGAM to tackle the growing trend of unclaimed deposits and ensure that rightful owners or their legal heirs can reclaim their money. Public awareness campaigns are being conducted to encourage people to check and claim their funds through this portal. Once you find unclaimed deposits through UDGAM, you can approach the respective bank to either reactivate the dormant account or claim the funds. The process may require submitting documents such as ID proof, proof of account ownership, and, in some cases, succession certificates.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 6, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why Easy Trip Planners share price jumped up to 17% todayEasy Trip Planners' stock price hit an intraday high of Rs 17.84 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, reflecting a 17.67% jump from its previous close. At 11:23 am, the stock traded at Rs 16.56, up 6.70%.
Content: Shares of Easy Trip Planners Ltd., the parent company of travel platform, soared by as much as 17% during early trade on Monday. The rally followed co-promoter Nishant Pitti’s confirmation that there will be no further stake sales from any promoters in the company. Pitti had taken to social media platform X to assure investors that his recent sale of a 1.4% stake was solely for personal financial requirements. He reiterated that neither he nor fellow co-promoters Prashant and Rikant Pittie would be selling any more shares.  Pitti clarified that his remaining 14.2% stake was never fully up for sale. The announcement came just days after Pitti stepped down as CEO, with Rikant Pittie, his brother and the company’s CFO, taking over the role. Nishant Pitti will remain the Chairman, focusing on the company’s strategic vision, including global expansion and new business verticals such as corporate travel and luxury tourism. Pitti addressed the transition in a post on X, stating, “As Chairman, I’ll focus on shaping our future and driving international expansions, while Rikant steps in as CEO to lead day-to-day operations and drive our vision forward. Big things coming!” He also outlined plans to integrate advanced technologies like AI, data analytics, and blockchain to enhance customer experiences. Additionally, the company will pursue eco-friendly travel initiatives and carbon offset programs. Following Pitti’s remarks, Easy Trip Planners’ stock hit an intraday high of Rs 17.84 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, reflecting a 17.67% jump from its previous close. At 11:23 am, the stock traded at Rs 16.56, up 6.70%. The promoter group’s stake now stands at 48.97%, down from 50.38%. However, Pitti assured investors that this change will not impact the company’s growth trajectory, underscoring his commitment to strengthening its global presence and driving innovation.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 6, 2025
